description:
I've been a fan of Shabu House ever since I used to go to the Burlingame one, but I haven't been to it in a long time. When one day, I was passing through this area, I saw that there is one closer to my apartment. So I had dinner here with my friend about a couple of weeks ago which was delicious. Service was pretty good except for toward the end where they forgot to give us our ice cream, but they were pretty busy. My friend had covered the check so I didn't know that they charged the tip to it. I thought tip is only charged automatically if it's a group of 5 or more, but they charge for for smaller parties too?

Parking wasn't that hard as I found parking on the side residential street nearby.
author: Amy C.

description:
This place is very popular for a reason! Good clean food and great service. The staff keeps things moving quickly which is important in a place that's this small and this well liked. There's usually a line but it moves fast. 

Love the ginger chicken broth and the meat is very high quality. Always lots of fresh vegetables. A favorite for us for big dinners with family and friends. Have a drink at Villa de Este across the street while you wait! The perfect time.
author: Laurel M.

description:
It was my first time to this place but I will make sure it is my last! Though the food was ok, I am rating their service a ZERO, if it was ever an option!

Felt very disrespected by server Brenda.  I enjoy eating Shabu broth with a blend of soy sauce. So I asked if they offer soy sauce. She happily said yes.  I also enjoy my rice with a sprinkle of sesame seeds, so I asked, the same girl. This time she responded with a mean disrespectful tone of voice, asking me back with a Southeast Asian accent "is there anything else?" When I calmly and respectful said "no, thank you," she rushed off making a sound what seemed like a pout. I did not feel welcome there at all, worse service restaurant experience for me. I even ask to speak to their manager and they said there managers weren't available. Didn't really want to waist my time with this, just wanted to finish my food and get the hell out of there.

I've had Shabu Shabu at restaurants own and operate by Koreans and Japanese and never had a single bad experience. These people still have a lot to learn when it comes to servicing their customer properly! 

In writing this review, I'm also addressing to the owner and manager of this restaurant. You need to train your staff on how to be professional, polite and respectful to your customer. After all, your customers are the reason your business exist.

By the way, 15% service charge was automatically charged to my bill. We were a party of 2 people. The server said this applies to all tables. I wonder if there is a city code for this action.
author: Food L.

description:
Food: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Ambiance: 4/5
Overall: not a bad option for all you can eat shabu.  Beware...there usually is a wait!  Make a res if you can.

The extended review...

Food: 

All you can eat - yep...gotta get this and all the fixings.  For the most part if you are a meat eater then this is the place for you.  A decent meat selection and other veggies to go with it.  

Service: good service especially since we were constantly asking for refills.

Ambiance: very casual but the interior is definitely nicer than other shabu places I have been to.
author: Spencer Q.

description:
My friend and I came here for all-you-can-eat shabu shabu on a cold day. All you can eat is $34, which seemed pricey to me. But we are in SF, so maybe that's the going rate? 

The meat and veggies unfortunately didn't seem very fresh. The vegetables were various mushrooms, napa cabbage, carrots, and tofu. We are also able to choose a soup base of spicy miso or ginger chicken. I got the ginger chicken and friend got the spicy miso. I preferred the ginger chicken. And for those who are wondering, the spicy miso isn't too spicy. 

It does get pretty busy so service isn't the best. But they also aren't the best staffed. Overall, a good one time eat shabu shabu.
author: Jackie C.

description: I've been to this Shabu House for over 10 times and it's the only hot pot place I always go. They don't have many choices on the menu. But I liked their meats and soup base. Customer Service is excellence. When you order more meat they bring it out quick. The restaurant is in a good area easy parking. I've been to iPot, Seapot, Boiling Hot Pot. You name it! Shabu House is my favorite hot pot place.
author: T B.

description:
Shabu House doesn't seem to have a lot of choices, but nevertheless, it's still a good spot to eat on a chilly day in SF. They do charge a service fee FYI.

Food: the Kobe and the lamb are pretty good in my opinion. We always get the spicy miso broth. I wish there were more options tbh. Maybe then the AYCE price would be more worth it.
author: Phi V.

description:
I ordered the large beef and I was stuffed! I usually substitute the cabbage for extra udon. Beef with spicy miso is the classic but all the different broths and meat are delicious. 

Food is excellent! I do prefer the Burlingame location because it is a little larger and staff is a little more attentive. But this one is still very good! 

P.S. the tip is included in the bill!
author: Manny R.

description:
Coming to this place at least twice a month with same order every time. The quality of its Kobe is always good, the sauces taste good too. However the quality of rice can be unstable, and the water and sauces are always left on the table for a while before serving customers, which makes me a little bit concern with the hygiene issue. It won't stop me from visiting the place thou. 

Tips - visit earlier than normal dinner time if you can, otherwise you might need to wait for 1+ hours for the yummy food
author: Yuen Yung L.

description:
Shabu House's lunch special is such a steal! We came here after running a half-marathon on Superbowl Sunday. Glad they were open as we were ready to feast. 

The customer service is great, no waiting in line and they always came to check up on how we were doing. 

Definitely order the miso for your soup period. 4 types of meat if I'm not mistaken and the veggies were freshly served on our table. Lots of sides that came with our order and we were highly satisfied. 

Lastly, a complimentary scoop of ice-cream to end our meal! YAASSS!

Nothing beats good quality and this is one of them. Highly recommend this place!
author: Dianna O.

description: The quality of the meat is phenomenal. Love the spot in Burlingame but glad there's one just as good right by home. Pretty cute servers too.
author: aaron t.

description:
I love Shabu House. It's still my favorite shabu restaurant. I moved to LA and SJ and always crave Shabu House. I haven't been to a shabu place that compares to Shabu House. The service is really good and friendly; they're always checking up if you need anything. The atmosphere is great for big parties or a simple get together. I haven't left
Shabu House disappointed ever. So I highly recommend. 5/5
author: Rita L.

description:
3.5 stars

Pro tip, get there right before they open to get in line otherwise your wait will easily be 1.5hrs or more 

Seating is comfy and service is fast
Meat selection is concise and portions are based on how many orders you want 
Veggie selection is lackluster and personally feel its not needed, just stick with the proteins

Overall Thoughts

Would I wait? No, but if I was able to sit first round I would easily stock up on protein
author: Eddie W.

description:
Shabu House never fails to hit the spot whenever my soul craves for something warm in the chilly san francisco weather.  

I tend to go on the weekdays to avoid the lines because it can get pretty packed on the weekends.  Generally, I've been seated promptly and the service is great.  I'm never left too long without a plate of meat or veggies in front of me. 

For the price of $33/person it's fair.  Auto gratuity is included at the end of your bill.  The meat options are beef, pork, and lamb but I usually order the beef.  The beef is very tender and has a nice amount of fat to it.  I like how it doesn't break up when you try to grab it with your chopsticks like other places.  

Each plate has about 30 slices and I can eat between 3-5 plates depending on the day.
I'm simplistic so beef and the assorted vegetables are perfect.  Don't forget to save room for the complimentary green tea or red bean ice cream at the end of your meal!

Shabu House keeps me warm on a cold night :)
author: Derek L.

description: Came in for a dinner with a friend and tried the chicken ginger broth which was very flavorful. Unfortunately, they didn't have regular miso broth but we did enjoy the chicken ginger broth. We had the beef, lamb and pork for our meat selection and everything was very fresh and thinly sliced. We were not able to take full advantage of the all you can eat price that we paid for as one tray of each meat was more than enough. Will definitely come back. *two thumbs up*
author: Grace Y.

description: If I could give a negative star, it'd be -10. Horrible service. I usually never even bother to complain because I am a server for 13 years and there's going to be a bad day for everyone and not everyone is going to be happy with you. But honestly, this place is horrible. It's funny because I read the reviews before going there. I still gave it a chance. For the owner of this place, food might be great, but if the service is BS, be ready to sell the place. And for the servers who laughed at us.. we still tipped 20 percent.
author: Malisa W.

description:
The main reason we came here was it's close to my friend's house and we felt like shabu. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but the meal was fine. 
 
THE COST: $27.44 each total. 
 
THE FOOD:
We got all the meats, the beef was good. My hot sake was inexpensive and sweet. The ice cream was alright, a little hard in texture.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Parking - We always get lucky when we go here no matter what time of the day we always seem to find parking nearby. Street parking that is.
Ambiance - Great little Shabu restaurant, modern look, TVs, Bar, and also great for groups.
Food selection - Just like any shabu shabu, they focus on minimal selection but great quality. Hot pot is different, that's chinese for those who don't know, so we cannot compare hot pot having a variety of food to throw in the pot. Shabu is basic but good. You have your soup base, the meat, which here i believe there is only 4 to pick from, and veggies, rice and udon. They have great selection of drinks :) that hot sake is strong. 
Price - this is the only reason why I will be knocking off a star. It's a bit pricey compared to hot pot or maybe even other Shabu places. They also thow in the automatic15% service charge. If you are eating here and select AYCE, you are looking to walk out -$90
Customer Service - In the past we had trouble getting the servers attention and they kept forgetting our order. However, recently we have been coming here and everything is going great.
Recommendation/Overall Review - Yes, I recommend this place because of the quality of food. 4 stars!
author: Madel R.

description:
I've been coming to this location ever since I moved to San Francisco since it's so close to where I live, and I always love coming here to get my shabu fix whenever I feel like I need to. It's a busy store, people lining up for at least 30 mins, I know, and even it's super busy, the staff still greet us with a smile and being professional at work.

Until today.

My faith for Shabu House, after coming here for 4.5 years, has splattered into pieces. 

We are a group of 4 and it happened that we all wanted to get Chicken Ginger Broth. Little did we know, Shabu House automatically offered one pot if 2 people requested the same broth. However, we'd love to have split pot even we are getting the same broth. Our server, a girl with ash blond high ponytail, gave us 2 pots without the divided pot, so we asked her if we can get the divided pot and we pointed to the table next to us since they had the divided pot. Our server repeated "like that pot?" and took the pots back. When she returned, she gave us 2 divided pots with different broth. We approached her again and told we wanted the same broth but with the divided pots. 

She made a face and looked unhappy. Turned off the heat and made a sound when closing the cap. Took the pots away. Gave us the new pot. I said "Thank you" when she put the pot down. She didn't say anything and left with the unpleasant face. 

Sure. 

I admitted there was miscommunication. Maybe we should have confirmed with her that we want "the same broth with divided pot". Or maybe she could ask us too, I don't know. Or maybe she was too busy at work so she was annoyed by us. But honestly, I don't think we deserved a face like that.

Honey, 15% gratitude was added to the bill automatically. Maybe you can show us some patience. We weren't yelling at you for changing a pot. Or maybe you could respond with a plain tone of "sure' or "yeah" or "no problem" or "uh-huh" when I said "thank you". 

Talking about being professional at work, our assorted veggies were forgotten for the longest time. Had to wait until the servers done taking shots with their friends at the bar and tried to holla to get our veggies. Other than that, the food was great as usual. Well, guess it doesn't matter now.  

2017025
author: Leslie C.

description:
To be honest, I don't crave shabu or hotpot style food often, because you cook it yourself, lines are usually long, and all the above makes for a loong meal. I don't have time to waste unless it's for a long overdue catch up, which was the case last night.

How to order:
1. Pick a soup (water, chicken ginger, or spicy miso) 
We picked spicy miso which didn't taste spicy. 

2. Pick all you can eat, regular, or large size: 
Prices vary per choice, but we picked regular (around $22/person) which comes with a bowl of rice, a plate of veggies, mushrooms, and choice of green tea or red bean ice cream at the end. 

3. Pick your meats: beef, lamb, or pork. 
We chose beef and lamb and shared. There's also a combo plate where you can choose 2 meats.

4. Prep your sauces:
There are two sauces, a peanut saucey one and another one. I like to put green onion and garlic into each one, and then dip my meats in there. 

5. Wait, and enjoy:
The meat will arrive, then cook to your liking. 

Overall, we had a good time. The wait was 10 minutes for a Thursday night, meat was good quality, and service was good.
author: Corinna T.

description: This is my first time review for this place. The server are nice, the food are fresh but no seafood.  I like it, but the weird thing is the put the service charge for 15% . It's not a big deal, but just weird. Never experienced that a restaurant does unless it's a party of 6 or up for 18%
author: Jullie T.

description:
Food 5 star
Staff 5 star+++++ 

The waiters are awesome and the food is bomb dot com. ........ #shabu4life
author: Irving C.

description: BEST. SHABU. PLACE. OF. LIFE!!!! I want to move to SF just so I can I have this everyday. I ordered a large beef and it was the perfect amount. LA places need to get their portioned checked lol. I'm never satisfied with a large back home, but SF knows what's good. Chicken ginger and spicy miso are both really good and light. Kobe beef is the best beef quality I've ever had. And they give free red bean ice cream! To be honest, this place is kinda pricey, but well worth every bite, and I would happily give this place my money every single time. Can't wait to come back!
author: Melinda T.

description:
I took my sister here for AYCE. ($33 + Tax and Tip = ~41) Do note that there is an automatic service charge. The pricing is quite steep, but the food is delicious. The meat is extremely fresh and thinly sliced. Compared to other hot pot houses, the quality of meat here is much better. However, there are limited sauce options and vegetable choices here. 

The soup bases are more on the blander side but the sauces balance it well. Though the meat platters may not seem like much, there is ALOT of meat to it. Between me and my sister, we finished 3 platters.

Next time I come here, I would simply order a platter of meat to share. A large platter of meat is a lot. Unless you are starving (like you just ran a marathon starving), AYCE isn't worth it. Speaking from experience, you enjoy the food less and it turns more into a challenge of how much food you can consume. In that case, find somewhere cheaper, because you are no longer enjoying the fresh quality of meat they serve here.
author: Melinda L.

description:
My Bf and I came here on a Friday night around 8:55pm, found parking right away. Once we walked in we could see that all the tables were filled except one. There was 1 person waiting ahead of us they were on their phone, we put our name down on the sign in sheet and sat down. 

First Warning: We are invisible
What was incredibly strange was that the waitresses didn't even acknowledge our existence. It was like we were AIR/INVISIBLE. The waitresses were serving the customers and when they served the ones near us, they didn't make eye contact with us.

Second Warning: 25 mins in and we are still INVISIBLE
To me that is extremely upsetting and very rude, (What kind of customer service am i experiencing right now? I'll tell you it's a bad one.) This is the first time we've experienced this level of horrendous customer service. Ive work as a waitress before and yes I understand it gets super busy but not even a small nod or a greeting after 25 mins of waiting and avoiding eye contact is just all the warnings signs of (We are ignoring you).  

I was excited to try Shabu House in San Francisco, since the one in San Mateo is great. Another thing that was strange was that there was 1 table opened, then i'm thinking either it's broken or they are ignoring us. At least tell us if you can't handle one more table of 2 people, so we can leave and not waste our time. We waited 25 mins in and still we are AIR to them...They close at 10pm it was around 9:21pm, I mean at least tell us something, it felt like we would have waited there til closing and then they would finally say to us "we are closed."
author: Carmen C.

description: This is a very cozy hot pot restaurant.  The employees are very nice and courteous.  The meat was freshly cut.   Everything was just right.   Will definitely hang out there again.
author: Thomas L.

description:
Tip- if  come before 6:00, you get 15% off your bill, which is awesome because you don't have to pay tip. If you come after 6:00, they automatically charge you a service fee of 15%. 

When I come here, we always get an order of large beef and regular pork. That's enough for two people. You don't have to get all you can eat. Each order of meat also comes with rice or udon and veggies, and ice cream at the end. If it's cold outside and you want simple hot pot, this is the place to go.
author: Tracy C.

description:
With so many hot pot and shabu spots around, this one takes the cake! First of all, it reminds me of one of my favorite shabu spots in Socal --Mokkoji, so already a plus. We were asked for our orders right away and they kept checking back on us by refilling our waters, adjusting our fire temperature and adding more soup base.

So I ordered the Regular Set with Beef and Spicy Miso ($18.99). The soup base was so tasty, I wanted to drink all of it. Their slices of beef were beautifully marbled and thinly sliced for quick cooking. The veggie plate that comes with the entrée is huge as well that we mistakenly thought that was my friend's veggie set. The pairing of their sesame and ponzu sauce made everything taste even better, especially with a lot of added garlic! And to end, you even get a scoop of red bean or green tea ice cream. This is now my go-to shabu/hotpot place in the bay now.

P.S. Take note that gratuity is included in your bill. Also, 15% off during their happy hour from 5-6pm!
author: Cindy Z.

description: We didn't like this place at all. The broth was so bland that it felt like they didn't put enough miso paste. The meat was fine but this place was not worth the money! You could easily make this shabu shabu at home by buying miso paste, meat and veggies. It's nothing special so I would never pay over $25 per person for something that I could do it at home for less price.
author: Emily M.

description: Food was good, three different broth to choose from. The spicy miso was excellent. We ordered the large beef and it came with a vege plate and icecream in the end. But they have a 5 dollar sharing fee?? Seriously?? Unless you order an appetizer. Makes no sense to me. There is an additional service fee and they also include 15% service charge. Good food, ridiculous fees.
author: Jane T.

description:
I cannot express how much I love this place. One of my favorite restaurants. Anytime anyone ever visits I will bring them here. I don't know what they put in the soup but it is amazing and the dipping sauces are just as addicting. 

I'd highly recommend the set amount don't think it's necessary to get all you can eat. I can eat A LOT and the set amount was the perfect amount for me. 

It also comes with a scoop of ice cream at the end! The matcha ice cream is delish

Also, no need to leave tip. It's included in the bill!

I could probably eat here everyday. So so good
author: Susie C.

description:
I chose Shabu House as the last restaurant to dine in before I left San Francisco. It was the closest hotspot place from where I stayed, Westwood Park. I made a reservation on a weekday but it wasn't really necessary because the restaurant was crowded but not full. 

As soon as I seated, I was satisfied by the dipping sauces on the table. There were peanut and plain soy sauce that you could add more condiments/toppings to it. I added seasame oil, scallions, red pepper immediately! 

The menu was simple as there were only 3 options of meat available: Beef, lamb and pork. Honestly, I prefer simple menu when eating hot pot. I don't really like the meatballs and miscellaneous stuff that other AYCE hotpots offer. The meat was so on point. We tested lamb and beef platters at first, then decided to only go with beef after. We as a party of 3 could only eat 5 rounds of meat until we were too full to walk home. The portion in 1 dish was very generous as they had 4 layers of beef in each dish. The Kobe beef was of top quality. It was so juicy, tender and didn't have too much fat. We had the spicy miso and ginger kitchen broths - both were not spicy at all. Both broths were sweet and weren't salty! 
Shabu House also gave a dish of assorted veggies and udon to every person in our party. you could also order rice here! I really liked the rice here because it was sticky and soft (almost watery because it was cooked with lots of water). 

Shabu House concluded my 5-day food journey to San Francisco. I had so many good food here and Shabu House didn't disappoint me. The price could be more expensive than other AYCE ($34/person), but the quality made it worth. 

If you're a light eater, I recommend to order a la carte instead of going with the AYCE option since the portion here was very generous.
author: Nhi D.

description: Great meat and yummy broth! Service is fast and friendly. Tables are clean and parking was easy. Overall a great experience.
author: Michelle B.

description: Delicious food and a pleasant wait staff. Hot shabu on a cold Sunset night always warms the soul. Recommend coming here often for the best results. Be prepared to wait sometimes though, this place is a not so well kept secret.
author: Lawrence A.

description: Come in with a party of three and wait for about an hour as you watch tables of four walk in and be seated in front of you because they do not seat three at a booth. Pretty stupid.
author: Dennis S.

description:
I never really understood the idea of Shabu, until last night when my cousin celebrated her 28th birthday at Shabu House. My husband and I have tried places where "you cook, your own meat," but that was on a hot grill. Shabu, on the other hand is where "you cook your own meat" but with a really high temperature broth- available in 3 flavors: 1)Traditional, 2) Spicy Miso (fav!), 3)Ginger Chicken. 

My favorite meat offered at Shabu is the American Kobe Beef. I couldn't stop saying how the meat practically melted in my mouth like butter, after I braised it into the boiling broth. What's nice 'bout the beef is that it doesn't need to be in the broth that long in order to eat it. I like my meat medium/rare so within a few seconds to minutes-my meat was cooked. With your meat order, you receive rice and a plate of veggies, tofu, and udon noodles. 

The restaurant is on the smaller side, so plan accordingly. Would I go back for a second round of Shabu? Yes, in a heartbeat!
author: Lene N.

description: Terrible terrible customer service on Saturday evening. This Asian woman with a pony tail I wish I got her name ignored me three times when I asked her for more soup in the pot. She nodded her head every time, rolled her eyes and then called us assholes for asking for more soup? Seriously? Wow! they forcefully charge you 18 percent of service charge regardless. Therefore they are entitled to be rude and mean to you because they will surely get their 18. percent tips by calling their customers ASSHOLES. You are assholes stupid fk waiter/loser.
author: Woopie P.

description:
It was not great. The service was slow and the staff made us feel like we were keeping them from talking or having time on their cell phone.

The broth without soy sauce had no flavor. Not a good place for those with gluten sensitivities or celiac. By now I expect restaurants to accommodate with tamari sauce since it so easy to purchase.
author: Christine D.

description:
I took my mom here when she visited recently and we both absolutely loved it. There was no wait when we came around 7pm on a Tuesday, but that was also election day so I'm guessing normally it's a bit more crowded.

Their broth selection is very small. You only have 3 options: water, spicy miso, and ginger chicken. We opted for the ginger chicken (though they do let you split the pot if desired) and it was so amazing. We were already sipping away at it before we even started cooking!

Please note they have a $5 min charge per person. We were hungry (but not starving) and wanted to share one order of meat, so we ordered some extra sides to meet the min spending requirement. 

We ended up ordering a combination of Kobe beef and kurobuta pork with sides of two eggs and kabocha pumpkin. Each order of meat comes with a platter of veggies and udon, a bowl of rice (but we substituted with more udon), and ice cream for dessert. We thoroughly enjoyed both meats and all of our veggies; everything was very fresh and well prepared.

It was a good amount of food and we were both stuffed at the end (in fact, we couldn't finish all the udon), so it was kinda surprising to us how one person could finish a whole portion of meat + veggies on their own. Highly recommend splitting one meat order if both individuals in your party have an average appetite like us.

As far as sauces go, they have a sweet sesame-based sauce and a ponzu sauce along with typical shabu sauce ingredients such as minced garlic, green onions, etc. They give you an empty bowl so  you can mix and match sauces and other ingredients. Since I'm not a big fan of ponzu sauce, I mostly stuck to mixing garlic with the sesame sauce.

After hot pot/shabu I always like to try the broth since it's been infused with all of the yummy flavors of the meats and veggies from the meal. When I tried the broth here, I was absolutely blown away by how sweet it was. I could not stop drinking it. I was already stuffed, but still I somehow found the room to drink up most of the broth. There was barely anything left in the pot by the time I was done; I liked it that much! 

My mom also really enjoyed the taste and speculated that there might have been some msg in the broth to give it that umami flavor, but I did not get thirsty at all throughout the rest of the night, so that's a pretty good sign the taste was completely natural.

The whole meal only set us back $35 after tax and tip...I consider that really great value, especially for this type of food! Please note they add an automatic 15% service charge to your bill.
author: Dianna H.

description: Great fresh ingredients and portion for a hot pot place.  Price per person was reasonable except that the receipt had an automatic, unspoken "15% service charge" included BEFORE tax; is that legal? I don't know.  A server later confirmed that's supposed to be a tip because the owner wants to ensure they're tipped. We usually tip 20% but felt cheated by the unspoken charge so the bill was left as is. Beware you will be tipping at least 15% whether you like it or not.
author: L T.

description:
Quaint little spot to enjoy some all you can eat shabu shabu. 

$33 is a little pricey but luckily I can always make sure I can eat my money's worth. 

Service was attentive, they always made sure we had water & beer at all times...probably why they automatically charge their service fee, regardless of party size. 

Then again, they had delicious red bean & green tea ice cream at the end which hit the spot after getting our carnivore on. 

Probably won't be back since I'm not in the area too often, but would recommend for someone craving shabu.
author: Roger D.

description:
For those that want to treat themselves to a simple and delicious meal, Shabu House exemplifies the notion that sometimes less is more.

Came here on a wintry Friday night around 7 and waited about 30 minutes for a table for 3. First thing I noticed was how compact the restaurant was. I've been to the other Shabu Houses before, both spots in Richmond and the one in Burlingame, as well as other shabu joints in the city and this might be one of the smallest ones. This meant most people waiting had to do it outside. To avoid the cold, I noticed people cramming in the middle of busy service where the waitresses had to bring out hot bowls of broth and other ingredients. I must commend the staff here, not only were they understanding and kind, they were also very attentive and made sure (double and tripled checked) we had everything.

We chose the AYCE option to celebrate a friend's birthday. All the things came out quickly, and to my surprise, they gave each of use our own fully lined large plate of meat. All other places I've been to bring out communal plates which meant we had to reorder constantly. The meats were beautifully marbled and folded so it was easy to grab without ruining the structure of each slice. The broth (spicy miso) had a nice kick but isn't as flavorful as its hot pot counterpart. I believe this is because they want the emphasis on the quality of the meat. The veggies were also a nice change of pace in a meat focused meal.

Overall, it was really delicious but I think their AYCE option is the wrong way to do shabu. I noticed that I wasn't enjoying each bite of meat and just trying to get my money's worth. For 41-ish after tips and tax, it felt like a challenge more than what it really was, a simple and delicious meal. Next time I come, I'll take the less is more approach with the single order so I can enjoy the amazingly marbled meats.
author: Philip W.

description:
When the weather is cold and/or rainy, there are few things better than AYCE shabu to get you all warmed up.  And when it's hot outside?  AYCE shabu is still the answer!  I mean, they offer AYCD for a reason right?  Plus, if you're going to sweat, might as well make them meat sweats!  Mmm...meat sweats.

While there are plenty of shabu and hot pot restaurants sprouting up these days, Shabu House has long stood as one of SF's best options for either.  Yes, shabu and hot pot aren't the same, yet competitors from either category can't offer the same combination of taste, quality, and overall value (save for Hot Pot Garden, if/when they ever reopen again).  Granted, $33 per person for AYCE (or $23 for vegetarian) may not seem like much of a value (it's $11 to add on AYCD), but it is when what you get is just so good!

Beyond the shabu, the menu also offers a mix of starters and rice bowls (single entrees), but I can't say I've tried any of them (since they'd only stop me from hitting the AYCE that much harder!).  Of the handful of broths (Traditional Water, Spicy Miso, and Ginger Chicken) and meats (American Style Kobe Beef, Lamb, and Kurobuta Pork) to choose from, the Spicy Miso with Lamb and Kobe Beef is my go-to combo.

Although the broth doesn't quite live up to its "spicy" name, it actually has the perfect level of heat and packs a tasty punch (especially as it gets cooked down with everything else).  The basket of veggies, udon, and tofu (which are always really fresh) do a good job of soaking up all that miso flavor.  As for the meats, the lamb isn't very gamy and nicely complements the broth while the Kobe Beef is usually well marbled and very tender.  The pork is great as well, but the other two hold up to the shabu a little better.

If there was one potential knock to be said, it'd be with how service can drag at times, especially when it's busy.  However, it's not significantly worse than any other shabu/hot pot joint and the workers are all really friendly.  Plus, parking is a lot easier, the lines are much shorter, and the food is just as good, which makes this Shabu House just as awesome, if not more so, than the original one on Geary!

And BTW, if meat sweats really aren't your thing, don't worry...the free scoop of ice cream at the end of the meal will help cool you down!
author: Mike L.

description: Shabu House fills a nice niche when I have an urge dip my meat. Yup, swish and swash all over the place and for only about 33 bucks! They only offer about 3 types of protein from what I remember. Pork, beef and lamb. To be honest though, I can't really tell one from the other after the meat sweats starts. What I will say is that the meat appears to be of good quality, fresh and plentiful. There isn't a huge sauce bar so you can't get too creative but the basics are there. Ponzu, sesame, chili, scallions and garlic if you've carried mints for the night. Our servers were pretty attentive in refilling our meat and vegetables. She also made sure we knew about ice cream being part of the meal! I really couldn't have asked for much more.
author: Quoc N.

description: Love how they let you get a combo plate of two different types of meat, and their ginger chicken broth is delicious. The quality of the beef was better than the lamb I would say, and the meats were sliced to a good thickness. The vegetable platter comes with spinach, enoki, napa cabbage, udon noodles, tofu, carrots, and a shitake mushroom. The portion sizes here are pretty generous as I had a hard time struggling to finish a regular platter and had my boyfriend help me finish. I wish they had a spicy version of the ginger chicken broth though and spicier chili oil. Service was okay, I didn't have any problems with that, and the included ice cream was great. I do dislike how they automatically charged gratuity though, but oh well.
author: Sandy K.

description:
Delicious. Beef & lamb are my favorite. We got the AYCE & drink. Money well spent. Happy stomach & happy heart. We will be back. 

4 stars because the wait was long
author: Melissa G.

description: Love shabu! So good, one of my fav places to go to esp on a cold chilly night in sf. Usually get the Kobe beef here
author: Danielle A.

description: this place gets crowded on a friday night.  i know why though.  it has all you can eat and drink for just under $50.  so put your name down early and be prepared to wait.  theres a korean place down the street that you can get soju as you wait.  the wait staff keeps coming by to ask if you want more.  very attentive.  the meats are thinly sliced and the broths are good.  lots of veggie options although my fav is the two different mushrooms. lots of dipping sauces.  lots and lots of drinks. beer and sake keep it coming.  sake bombs all night long.  if you come after 6 parking is free.
author: Matthew G.

description:
All you can eat shabu shabu? Is...is that a challenge? What's more bottomless, Shabu House's meat reserves or my stomach? These questions will be forever be a mystery.

So like, we didn't even know there was an AYCE option before strolling on in here. We just saw it on the menu and knew it had to be done. $33 per person is a bit steep but hey, it had to be done. It had to be done.

The eats here were delicious. It's all you can eat, so you already know your stomach is gonna be satisfied. But would the tastebuds be happy too? Yes, yes my tastebuds were super happy and jumping for joy with first bite to about 80% through the meal. We kinda hit a bit of a wall around plate 5 and struggled and crawled our way to completing 6 plates of meat. We definitely ate our moneys worth here. We had two types of soup base, spicy miso and traditional water. The spicy miso was my personal favorite. Not spicy at all and it gave the meat a nice and simple hit of flavor. The traditional water tasted a little bit too much like the sea for me, but it definitely wasn't bad at all.

The meat itself was amazingly tender, obviously. Thin meat better not be tough. They give you a few sauces to dip your meat into and a cup of rice as well. Also there's a plate of veggies if you wanna pretend this meal is sorta healthy. Our servers were pretty good about refilling our soup base and getting us more plates of meat.

Honestly, I'd go back here again. Definitely not going to be one of those every day kinda meals but as a once in awhile thing, it's great. You really can't go wrong with an AYCE shabu place, especially if it's as yummy as Shabu House.
author: Sean H.

description: This shabu place is an awesome. You have to go. Just bring some little extra space in your stomach.
author: Pele L.

description:
I have been to this location a few times and the service was just mediocre. The girls were not that friendly it seemed like they literally just came in to get paid and leave. 

The 5 stars is for the server DENISE! She was amazing. She was very attentive, polite and friendly. I came in right when it opened, so she was the only server. She eventually had 5 tables to help, but was still attentive to us.
author: Chantel H.

description:
The food was decent, but there is only one server who doubles as a host and bus boy as well. As a result, I had to wait over 10 mins for her to take our order and check in multiple times before she actually came back to the table after serving 4 other tables and clearing out others. Same situation getting the check and my card back. So 20+ mins just sitting and waiting, and that's upon even getting a table. Food did come quick though after the order was taken. Given that it's raw. :)

I didn't care for the sauce options they had, and they didn't even have hot sauce with the setting.

They also charge an automatic 15% service fee so expect to spend upwards of $25 for a small hot pot.

I prefer the Shabu place by the AT&T park in terms of the service and table setting.
author: Cotica N.

description:
Came here for my friend's birthday. It was my first time doing shabu but it's pretty much like Chinese hotpot. My party of 9 got the AYCE option ($42 pp after tax+tip) and it was a pretty okay experience. I wish I could handle AYCE places and eat my money's worth but I can't anymore; but since the bday girl wanted it, I tried my best. I wish the pots were bigger though since the two pots for a group of 9 couldn't fit a lot of food at one go.
The servers were kind and polite; even when one of them accidentally spilled my water on me and on my phone, she apologized profusely and told me that if my phone is broken she would replace it 100%. She then came over and brought comp potstickers.

They also have free ice cream at the end and even though I was really full, I got GT ice cream since I'm not a fan of red bean. But my friend shoved some in my mouth and I was pleasantly surprised that it didn't taste like red bean at all. Anyway, I would come back again maybe sometime in the future but not get AYCE lol
author: Emily L.

description:
Went with my gf for lunch. Not crowded at all and we were able to get seated quickly. We ordered the spicy miso soup base and ginger chicken soup base. For meats, we got 1 regular pork and 1 regular beef. Both were great when dipped with the sauces. Recommend the red bean ice cream at the end!
It came out to about $45 for the both of us, with gratuity included. Both of us came out really full in the end.
author: Anthony T.

description:
Took my mom and sisters here hoping to settle our hot pot craving. Unfortunately ended up losing my whole appetite and made for a bad experience for my family and I. 

First: Strand of hair in our vegetables. Understood that this may have been a fluke and things may happen. Alerted the waitress right away and she sent me a replacement vegetable tray. 

Second and third: the appetizer and meat (essentially the core of the meal) came out 20 minutes after the broth and veggies. By then, we had finished eating half of our veggies. 

Thirdly (and that's went I threw in the towel): Ate halfway through the meat to find another piece of hair! Immediately brought this up with the waitress. I asked her what had happened as we have been there several times before. She later came back to tell me that she told the person cutting the meat to be more careful. Also that this has happened in the past. I asked to speak to a manager in which she said there was no manager onsite and that she has tried to mention incidents like this to the manager before. She offered to send out another meat dish, but I was more so offended than hungry. I just lost my appetite...how are you going to force more food in front of me?! Seeing how the rest of my family sat in an awkward silence all looking at their food and questioning the quality of their food, I ask that there needs to be some sort of adjustment to the bill. She understood the nature of the incident and agree that an adjustment was necessary.  

I understand running a restaurant can get overwhelming. But 4 stars for this place makes no sense. This is a message from one manager to another: I highly suggest checking in on your establishment. I was shocked to hear that your waitress attempted to warn you of previous incidents and no changes were made.
author: julia n.

description:
OMG!!!  Just took the family here tonight.  We live in the neighborhood and for some crazy reason, I've been putting it off thinking that it might be too complex for our 14, 8 and 4 year old.  Boy, was I wrong!

Aside from the food being served up quickly, the pots were boiling and the kids had SO MUCH FUN!!  In addition to this, and most importantly, the food was delicious!  The staff was so friendly and we were seated with reservations ahead of the crowd.

This is a neighborhood GEM!  We'll be coming here much more often.  Family friendly, reasonable and delicious!!

Thanks, Shabu House for a great family night out!!

P.S.  I'm a 20% tipper, BUT, they add a 15% tip in with the meal.  Not a biggie imho, but wanted to let the more thrifty know about this.  Loosen up your wallet for these folks!  They are working hard to keep you happy!
author: Scott H.

description:
***WORTH READING.

Wait was about 30mins for 2 on a Sunday around 7pm.

Food was good.

Our server DALENA (see picture of her attached) sat us down at a table for 2, took our 1st order, took about 5-10 mins for us to get our 1st order: (All You Can Eat) we both asked for exactly the same one, Pork and Beef with veggies, rice and water.

***Now we have to go back to when we were first seated, we noticed that Dalena seemed to be friends with a group that sat a table away from us, they were all enjoying their dinner and drinking. They offered Dalena multiple shots and she did not hesitate to take them. 

It made me curious to why would one be drinking while on the job and it was fairly busy, and to see her coworkers running back and forth to attend to all customers made me think that was unfair.

As we were almost done with our 1st meat plates, we ordered again because we knew it might take awhile for it to come out. 2nd order was just 1 plate of kobe beef (to share), 1/2 a plate of spinach, 1 rice for the bf, and a water refill for him as well. Dalena took this order with a smile. 

As I watched her walk back to the cash register, her friends were leaving, the 3 girls came up to her behind the counter to hug and say goodbye to her. 

At this point we were done with our plates and were patiently waiting, our wait turned to 20 minutes and thats when I thought to myself that it seemed as if maybe she might have forgotten to punch in our order in the system. I watched the other servers coming out with multiple meat plates for other tables. I mention this to my bf and he says no lets just wait. So we do for about 10 more minutes. Our broth that was boiling for this long started to evaporate (see picture attached). We see Dalena walking back and forth not really doing anything but just walking and seem to look over our way but ignore us. 

Until it came to a point her coworker, the other server with braids, purple and blonde hair notices that it looks as if we were done eating, comes up to us and ask if we needed anything else. This is when my boyfriends face lit up and had the WDF face. Mind you he is patient and doesnt get pissed off easily. So I was like "ooooooh!" He and I both at the same time said, "No we been waiting for our order." She asks us what we ordered and we told her, "a plate of beef, spinach, 1 rice and a refill for water." She quickly arranged this for us and asked if we needed anything else, thats when I said "i guess we now need more broth too (sarcastically) but i really did appreciated that she intercepted this table from Dalena. 

What I can say was worse about this experience is not her drinking, or forgetting our order, its the fact that we seen her looking at our table multiple times, AND her coworker taking over but she never bothered to come back to assist or even say anything to us. Why? Maybe because she realized she messed up, but why not come up and apologize, she completely ignored us and at the end did not even give us the ice cream/check, it literally was turned over to her coworker and her coworker noticed we were mad/pissed or maybe felt bad having us wait so she gave us 15% off. Which really honestly did not do anything, because that 15% was an automatic service charge, a service that we did not get!!!

Overpriced! 6$tax too wdh
We will not be back.
author: Ledam O.

description:
If you're craving shabu-shabu, this place hits the spot.

My spouse and I went on a Saturday afternoon around 1:30 pm. We had just landed in SFO and were starving. There were two open tables when we got there and were immediately seated. Our server was super nice, helpful, and attentive. We had beef, lamb, with the spicy miso broth. It's served with veggies, tofu, mushrooms, and small portion of noodles (more please!), rice, and two dipping sauces. Ice cream (green tea/red bean) is included for dessert.

I'm not going to pretend to be an expert on shabu-shabu, but this place was tasty and affordable. If I lived closer, I would be a regular.
author: Martin S.

description:
Shabu is one of my fav comfort foods for a cold night so best believe I will come here or their other locations if I ever have the cravings! The wait for a table can vary from 30 mins to an hour since they don't have much seating.  

Service - It can be hit or miss sometimes. So far the past times I've come...weren't too bad. Not amazing but not bad either. ***Be aware of the auto-gratituity they put on the bill though so you don't double tip! 

Food - I always order the large meat combo with kurobuta pork and kobe beef. The meats are so fresh and marbled! Def not too fatty either. & I love how they serve ice cream at the end of your meal. I mean who doesn't like ice cream??

Definitely will be back.
author: Coco L.

description:
Good for kids, not if the "head waitress" is drunk and she knows the table next to you. 

I was eating dinner with my husband and 12 year old daughter when they sat a huge party next to use with a bottle on the house of saki as they were already drunk and cussing up a storm. Seems like they were celebrating so I didn't want to cause a storm so I got up and went to a waitress and asked her to please move us or if she can tell them to maybe take it down a bit as my daughter told me that she was uncomfortable by the people next to us screaming were "fucking drunk" and f this and f that. 

The waitress came over and said she can move us, great I thought! But then she says but the table only has one pot holder, we had 2 pots. I told her we needed three as we still had all our uncooked meat sitting on the table so she goes to the next table and points to us and says the table next to you has a problem with you guys and the entire table looked at us, I then had to explain to that table that my daughter is 12 and their cussing was making her feel uncomfortable, why do I have a to do that? Why did she point at us? Why did she just make the whole entire meal and tables feel uncomfortable? So unprofessional. I then told her to take the mandatory gratuity off the bill, I was still going to tip but I was not going to tip what they are forcing me to tip after what she just put my family through. Then the "head waitress" told us that we were eating for free and that we should never come back! Because I didn't want to pay the forced amount of gratuity, I then told her I'm not eating for free as my meal is 68 dollars and then she starts screaming at me in front of my daughter, I then told her to please leave change my card the 68 and stop taking to me like that because I was with my daughter. She then went and stood behind my daughter and continued to talk crazy to me. All while we still had food that we were eating in front of us! Girl I get it those are your friends but then move my family or discreetly tell them to be quiet or stop cussing. No one else in there was screaming and they were all eating peacefully. And then to tell me I and eating for free? How am I eating for free if I'm paying 68 dollars and I was gonna tip until she came being crazy drunk and screaming at me in front of my child. 

ROBERT! THE OWENER I LEFT A MESSAGE FOR YOU WITH THE CLEMENT LOCATION SO PLEASE CALL ME BACK AS THIS IS NOT OK AND YOUR "HEAD WAITRESS" AS SHE CLAIMED NEEDS TO BE CHECKED OR FIRED! ROBERT I NEED YOU TO CALL ME AND NOW I WANT A REFUND! YOUR STAFF RUINED MY FAMILY DINNER AND EVEN THE TABLE NEXT TO US ADMITTED FAULT AND APOLOGIZED TO MY FAMILY! CHECK YOUR DRUNK STAFF! AND IF THEY ARE GIVING FREE BOTTLES TO THIER FRIENDS MAYBE THEY SHOULD GIVE FREE BOTTLES TO EVERYONE THERE! 

ROBERT I NEED YOU TO CALL ME! Like yesterday!
author: Karen A.

description:
Mhmmmm!! My go-to shabu place.

- Spruce up the hell out of your sauces (sesame/peanut and ponzu) with green onions, garlic, daikon (?), sesame chili oil, pepper flakes, etc. My friends and I have been starting to put some of the sesame/peanut sauce into the ponzu sauce! Delicious!! 
- You can have split pots! I always go for half spicy miso and half ginger chicken. There's also "traditional water" or something like that, but noooo thank you lol
- 15% off your bill during happy hour (5-6pm). 
- If you run out of sauce, feel free to ask for more
- I usually go for the kobe beef and always pick the red bean ice cream at the end =) (vs. green tea ice cream)

Staff are always super friendly, nice and accommodating! Parking is usually a breeze. The place is small so you may end up waiting for a bit. They accept reservations for 4+ people, so take advantage of that if that applies to you. 

Fun and delicious place for shabu!
author: Kris C.

description:
My boyfriend and I keep coming here because the food is actually pretty good. The service on the other hand is the worst thing ever.

On Friday's, the place opens at 1130am. My boyfriend and I park right in front of the door at 1130 and notice that their workers are still waiting to get inside. We walk around for 20mins and still no sign of them opening. (But the workers got in finally). So, we wait and its 12pm and she finally opens. I felt a bit of sympathy because there was only 1 server and two BOH workers. The manager(the one that had the key to the store) was there too but she barely was in the front.

Server informed us that it would take 15 mins for soup and rice. Soup actually came out real quick. Then we had our meats and veggies. No rice..... The server even asked if I wanted more veggies, and I said yes.... She never came and gave it to me.
It's 12:40. Rice is ready..... 30 mins after being seated and my food all in front of me. I even finished my veggies before my rice...... Was so sad. The rice was ready and she gave it to another table before giving it to us when we clearly were the first ones in the restaurant.

We finished our food and asked for ice cream. She gets our order and was so quick to give us the check. THEN she goes back to other tables and serves them all their food..... It took so long that a worker who just started her shift 10 mins after even realized we were waiting for ice cream.

I felt so bad because a table who came after us already finished their meal with no rice.

I'm for sure going to stick with the Burlingame location now :(
author: Michelle T.

description:
So I was looking for  a place to eat. Yes I wanted Shabu Shabu on a cold day. Shabu Shabu is basically hotpot. So ordered the regular combination for $18.99. You get to pick two kinds of meat and total weight is 6 oz meat. It comes with veggie and rice as well. Its enough for one person. Or you can pay a bit more and get the all you can eat. I don't think the all you can eat is worth it. Or for extra $3, you can make it a large. So instead of 6 oz meat it becomes 8 oz meat. If you want more meat its about an extra $14 for more meat.

I ordered the lamb and beef regular. Good high-end quality meat. It was very tasty. The best part was their sauce. I had sesame sauce with sweet soy sauce and I also added in garlic and green onion. Its the sauce that makes a difference. They have other condiments as well.  I ordered the ginger soup. I was worry it would be spicy. Luckly it was fine. 

I was full after the meal. I think I ate too much. One meal is enough for one person. I love this place.

Too bad they don't have it in Vancouver. But one thing to note is that parking is a nightmare in that area. I had a hard time finding parking. 

I would come back that is for sure if I am in the area.
author: Denise W.

description:
I would've given 4 stars but their automatic %15 tipping is a shitty thing to do. I normally tip 20% but this little darling of house rule made you servers lose money. If the owners want the servers to get paid more, then pay them themselves. 

Otherwise, a good spot. Fresh ingredients. They aren't miserly with their ayce style but big fresh platters of beef. Broth isnt' the most flavorful. Friendly enough service. Not a lot of variety however.
author: Bill N.

description:
I have been craving for Japanese shabu shabu, but the lack of options in Phoenix had led me to wait until a recent visit to San Francisco. My expectations were high, especially since I previously had enjoyed the food in their Geary location. On this evening, my fiancée Santi and I were fortunate to beat the dinner crowd by arriving early. The clean, vertical interior included a narrow walkway that divided a long counter and good numbers of booths and tables stationed along the walls. The atmosphere on this particular evening was calm and quiet. 

The regular size two meat combo Shabu Shabu ($20.49) arrived with our choice of spicy miso broth, meat, assorted veggies, udon, rice, and dessert. I ordered the lamb/beef and for Santi the lamb/pork combo that were thinly sliced with good fat and lean meat ratio. We also ordered a side of Kabocha Pumpkin ($3.50) and Enoki Mushroom ($4).

Portion size was excellent. The spicy miso broth tasted complex, smooth, and delicious once the meat and veggie flavors were well integrated. The meat were easy to cook and did not dry out quickly; and the number of veggie options were topnotch, including the side orders. In addition to the Kabucha Pumpkin and Enoki, I enjoyed the tofu, udon, spinach, and shitake mushrooms. 

Our dinner also included a scoop of green tea and azuki ice cream. The flavors were striking and not just another filler to finish to meal. The sharp green tea flavor had an deepening effect, and the azuki ice cream tasted rich and concentrated. They were equally excellent.

Service was attentive and friendly. Our water was constantly refilled and our server occasionally came to check on the shabu pot. Overall, their prices, portion size, quality, and service were consistent with my experiences at their Geary location. I hope to visit their restaurants in Burlingame and Milpitas.
author: Daniel L.

description: I came here for lunch. There were 2 server, one of the server work for all the stuff and another lady was playing at her phone almost all the time! Played at the bar and inside the kitchen also! And they charged 15% service charge automatly of only 2 people dining!  What if I wanna give lower tips? They don't have the right to do that! I hope the manager will see this!
author: Jessica H.

description:
The lunch AYCE is just as expensive as the dinner and has limited choices- just pork, lamb or beef. That being said, all of it is HIGH quality. Because this is shabu shabu and technically not hot pot-- they only offered a couple flavours of soup, the most flavourful of which is a spicy miso. However, be aware that the chicken ginger broth is easily overwhelmed by the lamb, and your broth will end up tasting like lamb ginger lol. We found the spicy miso to taste the best (not too spicy! Kinda sour, like kimchi with miso, but super bomb) and helped cook everything along. The AYCE i includes udon noodles as well as a wide assortment of vegetables. If you are looking for variety, this may not be the place. However, if you want quality at a decent price, this place might be to your liking. Just come during dinner because the prices feel more justified lol (it was like $36 for AYCE!) 

Service was also a little slow (maybe because it was almost closing time) as it took them 15-20 mins with a reminder to shave our second servings of lamb and beef, so that's why a star is dinged off.
author: Christa Lei S.

description:
Shabu is one of my all time favorite comfort foods and guilty pleasures. It's especially great in cold weather or when you're sick. Since San Francisco is usually always cold, I would get shabu a lot more than I probably should have.  ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

I'm definitely a regular here at this Shabu House in particular because of it's location. It's always busy but the staff remain friendly here. I'm always curious about the carpaccio and the unagi bowls but I always get AYCE shabu meal. 

My favorite is the ginger chicken broth with all the veggies, tons of spring onions, tons of garlic, and lamb and beef. I prefer these two over the pork simply because the flavor is more pronounced compared to pork, despite the fact that it's Kurobuta pork. It comes with ice cream -- green tea or red bean. I'm usually team green tea but I prefer the red bean to the green tea in this case because the green tea is more floral in a perfumy way compared to the red bean which tastes like vanilla with slight sweet and earthy flavors.

Since it's been a while, I plan to come back here to eat sometime soon!
author: Sofia R.

description:
First time here, I was impressed.

Ordered all I can eat and the service was very fast and the server was very nice on a busy Saturday night. 

Line was long but I waited for 15 mins that was impressive.

Everything was great and quality. 

Personally I love quality food.

Thanks for making this happen in sf and I will be be back
author: Mack A.

description: Good selection of drinks. The meat is fresh and delicious. The service is ok, needs a little more attention at a cook your own food dining venue.
author: Charles P.

description:
I've read the reviews beforehand and came here expecting the worse since my boyfriend and I got here around 915pm and they were set to close a 10pm. However, they were actually very accommodating to us and I'm glad to say that service gets a thumbs up. 

This Shabu House is way smaller than the Burlingame one and the Clement St. one which makes waiting for a table take a while longer since it's limited seating and a lot of people do AYCE so just keep that in mind when you're coming here. It's also located on Ocean Ave. and parking is all on the streets and metered till 6pm.

My boyfriend and I opted for their AYCE for $33 per person (way cheaper than ordering the meat plates separate!) and the waitress let us know when last call was so she can get our orders in before the kitchen closes. We ended up getting spicy miso and the broth was way better than the one at Osaka Imai (as told by my boyfriend). Food was definitely on par and I'm seriously grateful that the waitresses were still nice enough to let us eat while they were cleaning up. 

Overall, definitely enjoy this place. Probably won't come back for a while though because prices are a bit steep and I'm not a fan of the auto gratuity at any place. But I still enjoyed the food here!
author: Venus L.

description:
Pretty good Shabu Shabu!

We came on a Wednesday night and fortunately had reservations because it was packed and pretty busy by the time we were finishing up.

They have a limited menu for soup choices, vegetables and meat choices. But everything is good. The broth was super tasty, spicy being my favorite.

Service is good. Prices are reasonable for the amount of food you are getting.

Street parking.
author: Natasha S.

description: Pretty dang good, the chicken ginger broth is yummy and the Kobe beef is on point. Lots of fun sides and ingredients to develop your flavor. Large beers, only tip is try not to sit near the windows at lunchtime cuz it's waaaaay too hot.
author: Alicia T.

description:
Not my favorite shabu place, not really my to go shabu place at all actually. 

Spicy miso is so bland and tasted like spicy water... My boyfriend and I had to put ponzu sauce to mix it and add more flavor. I don't know what's the hype is all about. One pot shabu in Cupertino is wayyy better! 

Service is good though they were fast and kept checking + star for that :)
author: Debbie D.

description:
Can't say that I'm impressed...

the service is good but the food is subpar for what I'm paying.

So... I did get unlucky and my beef slices happened to be thinner and less flavorful than the other guys around me who ordered beef (drew the short straw...) but that just points to quality control problems if the meat thickness and quality can vary that much.

The vegetable platter was also nothing amazing either. It was very bland and generic as far as shabu vege platters.

I've been to the other 2 Shabu House locations and this is the most disappointing one.

so meh, I've experienced better.
author: Mike L.

description:
I like coming here because it is always consistent, reliable, and good. They have AYCE here but I've never tried it. PS they automatically add 15% to your tab (even if you're just 1 or 2 people) just so you know.

Like most shabu places in the city, your entree comes with 2 sauces (mini sauce bar at each table includes onions, garlic, and chili oil), vegetables (with udon), rice, and a scoop of ice cream at the end (red bean or green tea).  They have 3 basic broths to choose from and I usually go with spicy miso. Past few times I've gone, they never seem to bring me a ladle which is pretty annoying.

Usually, I order the large kobe feef with an extra plate of assorted vegetables to split with the boyfriend. It is a good amount of food for us and is cheaper than ordering separate regular size entrees (because lets be real, I'm not sure if I can finish a whole entree on my own). Even though we have one entree, they still offer us each a scoop of ice cream, our own bowl of rice, and our own set of sauces unlike at shabu club - which charges a split fee to offer the items listed. So props to you shabu house!

Service is generally pretty attentive but not overbearing. Quality of food is pretty good. Prone to semi long waits on weekend evenings because the seating is kind of limited and people like to enjoy their time whilst eating. They do offer bar seating also.

Pro tip - you can also get two scoops of ice cream if you say you want both flavors. Hopefully they dont' change their minds if they see this review.
author: Josephine T.

description: Yummy. Love the condiments of garlic and horseradish.  Very efficient and friendly. Very satisfying spot. Been to both locations and consistent between both.
author: S. C.

description: This is not only one of my favorite Shabu houses but the first Shabu house I ever went to. Of course I was apprehensive about spending upwards of $25 to cook my own damn food! But actually really amazing. I only get the all you can eat option. I love the spicy miso and chicken ginger. I get the beef and lamb. The collection of vegetables are great especially the udon and spinach. I usually get a side of rice and extra udon noodles. They are really good at replenishing the meat when it is gone. The restaurant is really clean, the staff is very polite. A couple TVs in the back. Parking is available right in front there is a meter but it's free after 6. It's a very good experience and you will not be disappointed. Try something new.
author: Rubin S.

description:
The Ocean Ave. location is my go to for shabu. Although it is much smaller than the Burlingame restaurant, it is the most convenient in terms of location (closest to Daly City) and parking is always easy to find. I recently came in with a party of 10 and the service was on point. The restaurant was packed, and the wait staff was still very attentive. 

My usual order includes the kobe beef with the spicy miso broth and hot sake to drink. Compared to other shabu shabu spots, I prefer Shabu House for the quality of their meat and the flavorful dipping sauces and broth. At the conclusion of your meal, you also get your choice of green tea or red bean ice cream. Pro tip: order half and half and you basically get scoops of ice cream vs just one. Win.
author: Camille B.

description:
Came here with a group of 6 at 8pm and waited until 8:40pm for a table. Shabu shabu has always been my lesser-liked cousin of Taiwanese hot pot, which I adore (especially on a cold SF night). The shabu shabu at Shabu House, however, is my favorite Shabu Shabu I have EVER had. 

We ordered 1/2 the Garlic Chicken broth and 1/2 the Spicy Miso. Both broths had a nice flavor and was a nice addition instead of just the hot water traditional Shabu Shabu cooks in. Both broths also were nice to drink some of (not the traditional way, I know). Of the two, I preferred the Spicy Miso as it was just a little more interesting a flavor, but would happily recommend both. 

In terms of things to dip/cook, we opted for $33 AYCE (all you can eat). There's also a $44 AYCE and AYCD (all you can drink) option, but it was a school night, so we stuck with waters. One of our party is vegetarian so she got the AYCE vegetarian option for cheaper ($23 perhaps?). To get AYCE, everyone at the table must opt in for that option. The quality of the foods to dip was excellent. There is a noticeable difference between the kobe beef (super soft and marbled) and the regular beef. Both were very thinly sliced (delicious) and cooked perfectly in the broth. The lamb was also tasty and the pork was a nice change up from the red meats. With the meat AYCE, you get a plate of veggies too that has tofu, noodles, carrots, mushrooms, enoki mushrooms, spinach, and lettuce...all in plentiful amounts. And since it's AYCE, you can ask for more of anything you liked. I enjoyed most the kobe beef, spinach, enoki mushrooms, regular mushrooms, and the big noodles. Everything was super fresh, well-cut, clean, and delicious.

Wait staff is very friendly and helpful. Would happily come back here for a slightly healthier feeling hot pot!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
First, off, this place is great. All you can eat price is $33, which seems pretty normal in the Bay area. The quality of the meat is fresh, and they give you a lot of meat per plate that you order. 
The soup base is what really does it for me. Most shabu places give you bland soup base or even just water, but Shabu House's spicy miso and ginger chicken soup base are DELICIOUS!

The restaurant itself is not that big, so there was a bit of wait at first, but service is quick and attentive. They do include a service charge of 15% on parties less than 5 and 18% on parties greater than 6, and state that tip is not required. 

I would recommend this place to any shabu/soup lovers! I definitely will be back next time I'm in the area.
author: Carrie C.

description:
Pretty good shabu house - definitely a long wait though it could have been a timing thing.

Got 3 beef platters, gyoza, and a chicken karaage. I must have not been paying attention to the broth but whatever we got it, it was clear. That's as helpful as I can be at this point.

The gyoza was my favorite - super crispy, maybe a little bit oily for some, but definitely worth a try! The chicken was also crispy, though didn't have as much crisp as the gyoza. Gyoza wins this round.

As for the shabu itself, it's pretty good. The vegetables are standard, I ponder why these places only include 1 or 2 mini-carrots as if they were rare but it definitely is entertaining to see who has the audacity to get them as they float in the broth. The beef itself was "pretty good", definitely "not bad", and I apologize for "being vague" :)

At the end, we all got a small scoop of ice cream (Team Matcha vs Team Red Bean) which I'm unsure was complimentary, but was definitely appreciated!

Overall a great experience, and will come again!
author: Greg G.

description: We got the spicy and miso broth. The spicy broth was pretty good but the miso one didn't really taste like anything. I noticed the cup I had for water was dirty and the staff wasn't very friendly. I like the service at the Clement location better.
author: Alan G.

description: I love this place! The meat here is very fresh and the soup bases are flavorful. What is cool about this place is that you can do AYCE shabu for about $30 (super good deal btw). But since it wasn't starving I opted for the regular. The sauces are A1 and the servers are very attentive. Another plus, there's complimentary ice cream at the end of your meal; either green tea or red bean. YUM! If I lived in SF, I would be here several times a week, if not everyday.
author: Jennie T.

description:
When my friend was pregnant all she ever wanted to eat was Shabu Shabu or Mexican Food. Basically, if red meat was involved, she was in. Honestly, if your cranky (sorry), pregnant friend wants Shabu Shabu, you shouldn't argue. Shabu House is good for groups, but you should make a reservation or be prepare to wait on the sidewalk outside or in the insanely small hallway that serves as a waiting area.

We always went as a group of four or more and the best thing about Shabu Shabu is how interactive it is. You order a meat or vegetarian plate, get rice and a huge plate of tobu, udon and vegetables. They place your choice of broth into the table hot plates and you cook your own food. So fun, so delicious and the wait staff is super competent and you are never wanting for anything. Probably one of the better places in San Francisco for eating with a group.
author: Tara H.

description: So glad to have found good shabu shabu near my house! I got a large order of beef with the ginger chicken miso broth and everything was crazy good! I even asked for my leftover broth to go, which I never do. I definitely want to come back for AYCE sometime because I think it'd be great. Our server was all smiles and super nice about refills and anything we asked for, and I really enjoyed everything about my meal here.
author: Celina T.

description:
Pretty good AYCE shabu shabu and service was excellent. Got here on a saturday at 6pm and we got seated immediately for a group of 6. Good thing we got here earlier because after 6pm a line start forming! The meat was so good and tender! Kobe beef was the best one! 

Service was excellent! Even though it was pretty busy Saturday night, the waitress would come check often and check if we need anything and help refill our water and soup base. 

$33/a person for ayce and 15% off your entire bill for happy hour between the time 5-6pm! Awesome! 

Freee ice cream at the end! How can you say no to green tea ice cream! There was also red bean ice cream.

Overall, excellent food, excellent service. I would be back!
author: Louise C.

description:
Y would a place that has the best Shabu meat ever also have the blandest, fewest choices of soup base & noodles & veggies?? Y?? 
Been here twice now and I've learned to skip the veggies and literally just gorge on meat and udon noodles. Out of all the soups the spicy miso is probably the best one to get because it has most flavor.
I feel like this place is most worth it because of the meat that they slice themselves. See the attached picture - look at that marble. I could cry.
The service is great and for 33$ ayce its on the expensive side, but I would recommend if you're in the area and have a Shabu craving.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
YUM. Giving 3.5 stars only because they have very little selection in meats. Kobe beef was fresh a delicious. We kept ordering more! 
Service was great and the restaurant was kid friendly.
author: J. K.

description: Super slow waiters who didn't seat anyone on the list for an hour. Had tons of tables open saying they were only for reservations.
author: Kimi D.

description: This place is awesome.  Staff is always friendly.  Veggies are fresh and clean.  A great meal if you are watching your carb count - that's if you don't partake in eating the rice.
author: Jana O.

description:
Food is ok. 

The service.......is HORRIBLE! 
Waited waaaaaaay tooo long (at least 30 mins) for a plate of meat, a bowl of rice and my first refill of water! The lady (Dalena) who served us ignored us after we asked for our orders. I understand if its busy but not checking up on us is where i question the service. She was probably drunk on the job cause she was taking shots with her friends who were also eating. 

By the way, who wear heels as a waitress? 
I dont think im coming back
author: Carl J.

description:
This was my #1 spot for shabu for over 2 years since this location is most closer than any other locations

So, I came here with my friend on a Tuesday night. Our pretty waitress didn't even check up on us and they weren't even that busy. 
Even though we ordered all you can eat, since the waitress never came to our table until later, didn't even get to ask for our second plates.. Worst service ever.. 

We just got annoyed (No refilling waters, no refilling soup broths, No meats, No Vegetables..etc) 

We just even decided to skip the deserts and just asked for our checks. 

And we have found this out after our card was charged. She saw us writing our tips and she didn't say thing. And I checked the back of the bill there was 15% tip. 
They have charged us 15% auto tips without even telling us!!!! And we are party of 2 people!!!???  

I normally tip about 20% or even more especially whenever I dine in my favorite spots I tip them more. Our waitress probably got higher tips anyways doesn't matter now;  If we didn't check the bill, I probably have double tip them, BC our waitress didn't say anything!!! 
So glad that I checked!! 

Please check your receipts when you eat here BC auto tips could be anywhere up to  15% - 30%. 

I probably won't be coming back for awhile BC I feel like they were being dishonest about that 15% tips. 

Plus, Doesn't matter how many party size you have, they will just add tips without telling people. 

I will all my shabu lovers know around me, how dishonest this place is with tips..
author: Stella K.

description: Like the pot soup and the portion. My husband and I always order two regular combo. Always need to wait on a weekend evening. Green tea and red bean ice cream are my favorite.
author: Danyang W.

description:
I literally come here once a week.  I used to be a huge Shabuway fan, but I now live near the Shabu House in Burlingame, and my boyfriend lives near the Shabu House on Ocean. The broth is what wins this place over for me. The spicy miso is sooooooo good. I sip on it as I wait for the actual meat and veggies to come out. The veggie plate is huge, and has cabbage, carrots, tofu, enoki mushrooms, shiitake mushrooms, and udon noodle. I oftentimes get full off a medium Lamb and the veggies alone, with just a couple bites of rice. Shabu House even offers ice cream after the meal is done, with your choice of red bean or green tea. 

However, lately they have been skimpy on the udon noodle, and gratuity is now included, which I am not 100% sure if that is fair because the service is not consistent every time. In addition, the sesame sauce tastes watery. Other than that, this place satisfies my weekly shabu cravings.
author: Genevieve M.

description: What a top notch restaurant! We ordered (3) regular beef and (1) combination lamb and beef. What a feast! You seriously get your money's worth at this place. You get the broth (I recommend spicy miso), choice of meet, and a variety of veggies! Be prepared to wait though because 1 hour after they open there's already a consistent wait. It's worth the wait though. Plus you get your choice of either red bean or green tea ice cream at the end.
author: Katrina G.

description:
High quality food and amazing service!

We went on a Saturday night for dinner so naturally the wait was around 45 minutes. But I was very impressed that the waitress offered to take down our phone number, to call us when our table was ready, so that we could go somewhere to fill in the time. 

The restaurant has a very clean appearance and our table was spacious enough for all our food. My friends and I all got the buffet which in my opinion was very worth it! There's only 3 choices of meat (beef, pork, lamb) but honestly that's all you need because the meat was so fresh and melt-in-your-mouth and too many options can be a bit much. The sauces were on point and you get ice cream for dessert! I do have to admit that the broth was kind of underwhelming (we got spicy miso) so if you were eating the meat without the sauce, it would taste bland. 

The thing that really impressed me about this place was the service. Their were only 2 waitresses that night, attending to about 15 tables, but they always came by our table and asked if we needed anything. We rarely had to flag them down and they always got our orders right and didn't miss a thing. They definitely went above and beyond to attend to us.
