I love shabu and I'm really glad that I found this place. Will definitely be coming back here when I'm craving shabu again!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
1/12-2 hr wait ! Don't waste your time coming here to starve.
I was told 20 mi. Wait in the phone and I was there for almost 2 hrs watching people come and go
author: Guillermo F.

description:
YUMMM. Nothing I love more that soup on a cold day! We got the AYCE (which is pretty pricey). I think there were only 3 soup options that we could chose from, but I usually always go for the miso. One of the choices was clear broth which they said was just water. What a waste.

We got just about one plate of every meat, some udon and a lot of veggies and they were all good. My fave is the lamb as usual and the miso broth was good.

Overall, I liked this place, but it's really pricey compared to other Shabu place.
author: Sophia Y.

description: The food was pretty descent, but there's this one server who kept asking if we were done which got pretty annoying. The wait was long, when my group and I ordered the server rushed us. Also there's a service fee of 15$, if you get there and order before 6pm you get a 15% off your meal.
author: Ernalyn C.

description:
Come early to avoid the wait and save 15%. Shabu House has multiple locations in the bay area. I came here with my family for dinner around 5:15pm on a Saturday night for dinner. We made reservations ahead of time to avoid the wait. Since we had a party of 7, there was 18% gratuity added to our bill. 

You have the option of all you can eat Shabu (2 hour maximum) or ordering by the plates.

It was many of our first time at Shabu House although we've had hot pot meals elsewhere before. Not everyone gets there own individual pot and between the 7 of us, we shared two pots. Since there were three types of broths to try, we got a divider and tried the spicy miso broth and the chicken ginger broth. We did prefer the spicy miso broth best. The servers will add additional broth if you are running low.

We then shared 5 large plates of meat (2 kobe beef, 2 lamb, and 1 pork). We enjoyed the kobe beef the best. Each order came with a plate of udon noodles, veggies, and mushrooms along with a bowl of rice. Since there's a sharing fee if everyone doesn't order something over $5, we added an order of agedashi tofu and unagi over rice to avoid additional fees. 

After we finished, we were brought out ice cream for dessert. We had the choice of red bean or green tea. You can even ask to get a scoop of each flavor, which we all opted to do. They even serve Maeda-en ice cream!

When we left the restaurant, there was a crowd of people at the door and outside waiting to get seated. The restaurant itself isn't that big with table seating and counter/bar seating. 

Going out for shabu is always fun and a different eating experience. The menu isn't very extensive and the service could be better. During the course of our meal, the server only came at the end to refill our water. Overall, I'd come back if I had reservations during happy hour.
author: Steph F.

description: it's the average mocking "Japanese"place with boiled pots, unclear how to heat up and down, secondary used meat in ready soup and 15% mandatory extra tips. But still nice and clear, except the bill and a few extra orders which you didn't makes.
author: Misha S.

description:
Writing an update since I came over tonight. Havent been here in a while and my cousin decided to take me out in celebration of getting accepted into CSUSacramento :D.

Came for dinner and it was a semi-packed house. Since most of the two-people tables were occupied, we decided on the counter. The counter's pretty nice if you want your own pot. It's clean, wide, and right by the flat screen TV. Although, the area where the pot goes in is kinda far, so you actually have to stretch your arm a bit to grab food from your pot. 

Since I typically came here for lunch, dinner was a different experience for me. The prices are more heavier $31 fpr AYCE shabu ($17.99 for a regular plate of shabu meat, $20 for a large). 

The pot has three types of broth:
- Plain water, Ginger chicken, and Spicy miso.
There are 4 options for meats:
- American Kobe Beef, Lamb, Kurobuta pork, or a mix of two meats.
* there is also the vegetarian option for $14.99

I opted for American Kobe beef with ginger chicken broth. Every shabu comes with optional bowl of rice, a platter of veggies(lettuce, spinach, enoki mushrooms, a huge ass mushroom cap, tofu squares, and carrots), two sauces; the sesame sauce and a soy sauce/vinegar mix, and udon noodles. You also get the option of ice cream (green tea or red bean) afterwards.

Overall: the meat is nicely sliced into thin cuts that make it easier and faster to get cooked. The broth does take a while to get warm but eventually it does. When you add your veggies, do be careful because it actually gets really hot. I was surprised however, by the sudden decrease of veggies on my plate. Last time i came, there was lots of tofu squares and even squash slices. But tonight, i only had 4 tofu cubes and nowhere did i see the squash slices. :/ 

The sesame sauce is my favorite, it actually helps give flavor not only to the meat, but to the veggies as well. The ice cream flavors are always the same, but their green tea and red bean ice creams are both creamy in texture and full of its respecrable flavor.

The workers here are very attentive, despite how hectic it can get in here. Thankfully we came when there wasnt a line! You are definitely paying your money's worth here, you can always conclude that you come in starving and come out full as hell.
author: Jerianne G.

description: Will always love shabu but I wished they had more variety. Went In for lunch the other day for all you can eat and it was $34! Wtf?! Same price as dinner!
author: Lola L.

description: Your options are limited with only 3 kinds of meats. Personally, I find the lamb and pork to be lacking. Thus, I end up only ordering the kobe beef but this by itself is worth the AYCE price. The killer feature, though, is the green dipping sauce which you absolutely need to try atleast one. The all you can drink beer + sake is awesome, too.
author: Tuan V.

description: I love this place! I crave it all the time. I love how you can just cook your own meat and veggies in some hot soup right in front of you! You just choose your soup and type off thinly sliced meat, it comes with an assortment of veggies, some rice and even ice cream! It's definitely entertaining. The food comes in at a reasonable time and its delicious. I go there and invite friends all the time and they have enjoyed this pretty cool restaurant too!  It tends to become tedious to try to flag down the waitresses, they don't put too much attention into your table, however once they do happen to attend to your needs, its quick! Will definitely be coming back
author: Dana K.

description:
Great place to go when you're craving hot pot and shabu. 
What I like about this location is that it's in a pretty random area so it doesn't get as busy as the places on Irving or Clement. The wait on a busy night will be about 30 minutes. 
They have and AYCE + All you can drink option which I haven't tried, I usually prefer to get chinese hot pot for AYCE because there is a greater variety of ingredients. 
With that being said, this place is great for a regular dinner date. Their Large portion of American Kobe is a good amount for me, my girlfriend gets the regular. 
Vegetable selection is pretty basic (napa, spinach, shrooms, tofu) but if you upgrade the vegetables you get a few extra, and more of it. 
Spicy Miso is definitely the soup base of choice. 
18% service charge is included so no extra tipping needed. 
You get a choice of red bean or green tea ice cream at the end of the meal and if you're lucky like me you get two scoop (one of each).
author: Antonio W.

description:
This is my first time eating at this location. Menu wise it's the same as the other Shabu locations. They all taste great, the portions are huge and you will definitely leave very satisfied.

Once you get a table you forget how small the building space is. While waiting inside the front door I felt like I was in the middle of all the foot traffic. The front door swings open but also swings back in the opposite way into the restaurant. So if you are standing inside the restaurant by the door you're bound to get hit by the door because there's no sort of frame metal bracket to stop the door from swinging wide open the other way. 

Nonetheless, the food was great and I would definitely come here again.
author: Rommel A.

description: AMAZING! Fun experience, nice food and great company. A little bit of a wait, but well worth it and the service was helpful, friendly and joyful, even with the rush.
author: Joe M.

description:
Hot pot is always a good social eating occasion. What's not to like when you get to share food and cook it with others? 

There were eight of us and we had two burners going with pots of half spicy miso and half ginger chicken broth.  We got plates of veg along with an order of pork and several of beef. 

The positives were that the food was fresh and it was fun. Drawbacks, which is typically the case with any hot pot/shabu shabu experience, is that you're essentially just eating boiled food which is never really the most delicious thing out there (let's be honest).  You're really coming for the experience. 

The beef is very well marbled (positive!) which also makes for very greasy broth in the end (negative!). I would have liked some seafood options or possibly have just done vegetarian. 

Also, can decide between pork or beef? Get whichever because it will all taste the same in the end!

Fun place for a meal. Good service!
author: Ada C.

description:
Be prepared to wait as it's first come first served now. They will accommodate even when near closing but not all the time.

Good place to go anytime and not just when it's cold out (they have cold beers and sakes for when it's warm). The prices are reasonable and the shabu is as good as their main location...hence beware of long waits since the place is not that big.

If you call first, they'll put your name on the waitlist and you can practically waltz in when arrived. Oops, I've said too much already.

The crowd is geared toward young/high school/college so it's a positive or negative depending on your preference.
author: Peter L.

description: Two stars for the environment and ice cream. The soup base was just powder and hot water, which looks and tastes like instant noodles soup. The sauce was over sweet.
author: 一超

description: Service was pretty bad. Food was bland. I don't know why this place is popular. Btw, they automatically tag on a 15% service charge regardless of how many people are dining. Who does that?? That's probably why the service was so bad.
author: Kevin L.

description:
We've been to this shabu house multiple times and the wait times can vary on a Friday night to immediately getting seated (around 5/6), to waiting 15 minutes (7), and waiting almost an hour (8). Every time we've been here we opted for bar seating just because you get your own pot.

My go to is a regular lamb, extra udon noodles instead of a bowl of rice, and chicken ginger broth (basically tastes like chicken stock broth with small hints of ginger soaking in it and then taken out). One time I ordered lamb and they placed a plate of beef in front of me so make sure your meat is correct.

Is shabu house the best shabu I've ever had? No, I don't think their broth is amazing but it's a lot better than other places that have overly salty miso or other kinds of broths.

Service is OK. Whenever we need refills they are accommodating.There's about 2-3 girls running around making sure people get their food. I never see them with much time to spare in between parties coming and going.
author: Lauren K.

description: We had reservations at 5:30.  You get 15% off if you get there before 6.  I recommend reservations as it gets crowded.  I like the Ocean St. location because parking is easy (earlier the better).  I didn't realize there was no seafood and they only had beef, chicken and lamb (and veggies).  I'm so used to the the places that have a lot more to offer however my husband felt the quality of their beef was much better here, and that's what he's primarily interested in.  We did not get the all you can eat but I recommend getting it.   There's so many hot pot and shabu restaurants these days and they seem all the same after a while.  I like a little more variety myself and like to have more seafood.  I'm giving it 4 stars because my husband liked the quality of their beef and their soup.
author: Brenda W.

description:
Shabu House was my first love (but I cheated and found One Pot Shabu in Cupertino). 

This location is a lot smaller than the Burlingame location, but they get you seated pretty quickly. I believe they take reservations too. I had a friend that was a server here (not sure if she still works there) and she always made our experience delightful, fun. 

My usual order consists of:
* Traditional water broth
* American Kobe beef
* Rice
* Large hot sake
It comes with a huge plate of vegetables, noodles, etc.

They have an AYCE for $32/person and AYCE + Drink for $43/person. I've never ordered that but I'd say it's a pretty darn good deal.
author: Steffi G.

description:
My first hot pot experience, it was fantastic!
This is definitely a conversation food and the peanut sauce they dish out is AMAZING.
Without that bow of sauce it wouldn't be great at all hah.
Kind of reminds me of an assembly line for automobiles the way they serve you here haha.
Service was a bit robotic and they didn't turn the burner up enough for it to boil, so we sat there waiting for some time.. no boiling.. other people around us who were served after started boiling.. ours still just sitting there haha.
I took it in stride and they did realize thy had done something wrong and readjusted the temp, we were boiling in no time.
Really busy like gem of raw meat and tofu! Be ready to wait at this spot, about an hour when we went.
Well worth the wait!
author: Nathan B.

description: Terrible customer service. Rude waitress. Impolite. Not worth the trouble. Time to find a new spot.
author: Evelyn Q.

description:
The first time I had shabu EVER was at Shabu House on Geary about 3 years ago, and I loved it!! Since then, i've consistently going to this restaurant whenever I or my friends are craving shabu. 

The menu is really simple, you choose your soup base, and meat and size, then you're done and you just have to wait for your soup to start boiling and you can start to grub! I know they also have an AYCE and AYCE&Drink but i've never tried it! I think i'm a pretty big eater for my size and the regular fills me up fine, so I never really thought about it.

I always get the spicy miso (it's not that spicy, but has a nice kick!) with regular american style kobe beef. The meat is always good quality and it's fun watching them carve it through the glass while you're waiting!!! One order comes with a plate of veggies, including napa cabbage, spinach, udon noodles, tofu, mushrooms, carrots, and enoki. I really like the veggies here except when I get alllll the big stems for the cabbage (am I just being picky..? probably). OH and the dipping sauces!!! Omg the sesame/peanut sauce (creamy beige one) is so good, and so is the ponzu! I like how you can customize it with the green onions, garlic, and cilantro too.

Oh! And at the end they give you free ice cream!! I love the green tea, but the red bean is very popular among my friends too! 

The service is always pretty up to par here, and they're quick to refill your water (always something I look for... tryna stay hydrated over here lol). I like sitting at the bar too because they're always playing espn AND YOU GET YOUR OWN POT! Yeah that's right, your friends can't steal your veggies and meat (ha ha, just kidding...)

Overall i'd definitely recommend this to anyone who likes shabu or has never tried it!

Btw the lunch prices are cheaper and I honestly think they're just as filling!
author: Tara A.

description:
WORST SERVICE EVER!  While already waited 45 mins in line, and the next one to be seated, a group of 4 just came in the restaurant, and took our spot!  It was obviously their friends that cut everyone who waited.   
There was not one time they came to our table to ask if we needed anything else.  We had to flag them down to remind them we ordered a couple of beers.  This was the same service to all tables around us.  
Will not come here again.  People pay good money for great environment (good service) and good food at a restaurant. Customer Service in very poor here.
author: Marky P.

description:
Hungry for meats!? This restaurant has excellent beef, pork,and lamb, depend on what your preferences. There are 3 different kinds of soup, i like spicy and miso base. After cooked the meats, dip them in the source( Sesame Sauce). Don't forget to get green tea and red bean ice cream.
This place is always busy tho.
author: Jee P.

description:
I forgot what good shabu meat quality was after eating at Jazz cat (SoCal) so many times :/ 

I love this place! The amount of meat they give you is amazing and definitely more than most places in LA! The marbling on the beef is surprising too :3 

I love their spicy miso and doing half beef/ half pork. For around $20 a person, it's such a good deal. 
And I think it's 15% off if you order before 6pm ^_^!
author: Chelsea L.

description: This is the place I often go for shabu. I usually go when they open at 5pm to get the happy hour discount ( makes up for the required tip  added to bill). I always get the kobe beef and often end up asking for a second plate. Skip the rice as you get udon noodles already so save room for more meat. I  usually ask for half traditional water/spicy so that my vegetables are clean and the meat is cooked with the spicy sauce. The wait is long on weekends and Fridays but service is pretty quick. Big groups are doable but recommend calling for reservations in advance as this place isn't as big as their sister shop on Geary.
author: Kerry K.

description:
I've been to Shabu House on several occasions and haven't been disappointed with their food.  My first time here was about 2 years ago with my buddy Peter.  Thanks to him for introducing me to Shabu House!

The price is $32/person for the AYCE option.  You can do the regular a la carte dinner as well, but if you know you can eat a good amount of meat, I'd recommend just going with the AYCE...because it just makes sense.  I came here with my family, 2 brothers and two nephews.  I called in to have a table reserved for 7 of us.  When we arrived, we waited about 15-20 minutes before the previous group left before we were able to get a table.

The table they gave us was probably made to seat 5 adults comfortably.  So, squeezing 7 people into a 5-seater was quite uncomfortable to say the least.  But we did get our table, so we can't complain too much.  

We ordered 2 plates of the Kobe beef, 1 plate of lamb and 1 plate of pork to start off our meal and I think everyone pretty much killed that off within the first 10 minutes of our meal.  We asked for two types of broth, the spicy miso, which is my personal favorite, and the ginger chicken which the kids liked.  They also gave us 4 plates of veggies, which took us a little longer to kill than the meat.  Having 3 men and 3 growing boys at the dinner table is definitely a challenge because you have to fight for your food if you want to eat.  Of course, we ordered more meat...lol

They all said that they enjoyed the meal.  The meats were good, both broths were tasty and the veggies were fresh.  Service was a little slow, but bearable.

At the end of our meal, they gave us a choice of a scoop of red bean or green tea ice cream.  I asked for a half scoop of both flavors because I like them both equally.  When the bill came, I was shocked because they gave us the wrong bill of $35.98, which I told the waitress I would be more than happy to pay.  Lol

But I told her that there must be a mistake since there are 7 of us so it's quite impossible to be so cheap.  Our real bill came out to just below $300 after tax and tip.  Although it was pricey, but it's not everyday that we go out and enjoy a great meal together.  Thanks to my two wonderful older brothers for treating their favorite (in my opinion) younger sister to a happy meal.  Hehehe
author: Sivilay T.

description: Love their spicy miso and prices aren't too shabby. If you go around 5pm it's happy hour even on the weekends. Plus their green tea and red bean ice cream that comes with the meal are super yummy.
author: Angela D.

description:
Definitely my go-to shabu place! The place is pretty small compared to other restaurants, so it does get pretty crowded, but in my opinion, def worth it! 

You it down and the waitress brings you water & all your sauces. There's a sesame/peanut tasting one and ponzu (which you can add green onions & garlic), both are super tasty! Then you order straight from the menu, I usually order the same shit lol. I get a regular kobe beef w/ spicy miso which also comes with a plate of veggies (tofu, carrots, enoki, cabbage, spinach, mushroom, udon) and a bowl of rice! I always opt for this plate instead of the AYCE cause honestly I can barely finish this hahah. And after you finish your meal, you get a scoop of ice cream, either green tea or red bean! I always opt for the green tea just cause I'm not too into red bean, but some friends have said it tastes like Polly Ann's! 

The service was pretty good! I always look for how often they come to refill waters LOL (which they were pretty good about) and they would also come by ever so often to see how we were & if we wanted to turn down the heat. Overall, I have no complaints (yet) hahah oh! And another awesome thing is there's a shit ton of parking all along ocean so that's never a problem hahah
author: Carrie L.

description: Super busy but we received awesome quick service. Called ahead for reservations and were seated right when we got there. Food was delicious, it was our first time doing the AYCE shabu experience. So nice for a chill bay night.
author: V C.

description:
Shabu House closes in between lunch and dinner hours. Never going there before, we were warned to get there a bit early because the wait can build up pretty fast. luckily we did. Parking is a quarter for every 8mins, but for dinner time, we only had to pay meter parking for up to an hour because it's free parking after 6pm. Dinner hour starts at 5pm on Saturdays. 

We got the AYCE option for $31/person and there is a 15% discount too! That was a pleasant surprise. the 15% discount applies to anyone going in from 5-6PM everyday. It's the "happy hour" option. 

The service is super friendly and nice. They were always on top of filling up our waters, asking us if we want more meat or sides, or anything else at all! 

The ayce option comes with unlimited veggies and either green tea or red ben ice cream. I love the green tea ice cream!!! The meats include pork, kobe beef, and lamb. the slices were slightly generously thick and fresh. the quality of the meat is very good. It is "on pointe." after a while, other places have meats that didn't taste like it anymore, but this place has tasty meat throughout. 

The broth option that we got was the spicy miso broth, which was DELICIOUS. It actually was very good, tasty broth. Other places would just refill the pot with water, but this place would actually refill it with the spicy miso broth itself. The temperature was set perfectly so that the broth was slightly boiling, which was wonderful because it would never evaporate and condense so fast.
author: Cuc N.

description:
Nice little Shabu spot, but there's nothing special about it. They do give a generous amount of vegetables to go with your meat, and the kobe beef is good quality. It's cool that they offer all you can eat, but the regular size portion is already a good size if you ask me. A negative for me is that they don't have hot drops for your sauces/broth. 

It was raining that night so naturally it was a perfect night for shabu dinner, and it's wasn't worth the 1.5 hour+ wait that we waited in to get seated. The servers were polite, but didn't feel particularly attentive. Again, the place was really busy cause it was a rainy night. There isn't an area to wait when it gets crowded like that, so everyone waiting for a table is eyeing for how much longer you're going to take to finish your meal. I was definitely guilty of that before we got seated. hah.
author: Missy A.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE.  Just go for the AYCE.  I can't think of any complaints for this restaurant.  Spicy miso broth is sooo good, it's flavorful and actually spicy.  Got to try all the meats, took a little while to get out to us, but after that and getting more refills of meats there was no delay.  The beef was my favorite.  Veggies were fresh.  Servers are attentive, always checking in.  Tip was included in the Service fee they add (15%)...these servers deserve more than 15% if you ask me, at least from my experience.  Thanks for another great meal Shabu House!
author: Christine N.

description: There's not too much seating but we got lucky when we were seated right before rush hour dinner time. The spicy miso soup was pretty good and flavorful. Quality of meat and veggies were fresh. Service was quick and friendly. I made a mistake of tipping on top of included gratuity, so look out for that on your tab.
author: Briget P.

description: I don't remember how much AYCE was the last time I came here, but it seems like they raised the price since then. $33 is pretty pricey for such an option, especially when there are a lot of other places that are cheaper for shabu, but then again, this has been the only shabu place I've been to in SF so don't listen to me! But either way, so worth the money. They give you a hefty amount of meat when you are a party of 4 to make sure everyone gets a share of meat each round. The kobe beef was good. The lamb was good. The pork was good. EVERYTHING was good, even the spicy miso broth. Also customer service; even though there were only 2-3 servers, they still manage to serve every single table as quick as they could. Sure, it was a bit lagging at times, but still, better than I expected.
author: Tina R.

description:
*WARNING* Watch out for rubber bands in food.

I have been to other Shabu House locations in the past and had always been very pleased with my service. Their menu is accommodating to vegans/vegetarians, and it is nice that you get your own pot with separate broth if you sit at the bar. The regular serving is more than I could finish, so the AYCE option was not necessary for me. 

I was finishing up my meal when my friend spotted a bit of blue in my bowl. Upon closer examination, it was a tiny piece of blue rubber band! Shocked, I quickly flagged down one of the servers to show her what we found. To my amazement though, she did not seem surprised at all and brushed it off with a casual sounding sorry. I dug through my bowl some more and found more blue rubber pieces. I had a sinking feeling that I had probably already ingested some.

When I told the server that I found more pieces, she dug through the green onion container and found even more. I advised her to alert the kitchen staff that this happened so that they can be more careful, because I felt this was highly unsafe, with my thoughts wandering to the gastric acid melting rubber in my stomach. The server told me it was probably from chopping the onions and offered a 15% discount. Again, all of this in a nonchalant tone of voice.

Hoping for a more concerned response from another server, I flagged another one down and explained the situation. I explained again my thoughts on how dangerous this could be... I'm certain digesting plastic is NOT good for people. Sadly, my attempts were futile, and I just got more excuses in a similar casual tone. Honestly, I understand that mistakes happen, but at least act concerned about food safety. Their lax response really leads me to suspect that this is not the first occurrence. 

Not shocked that they got a 77 on their food safety score, which sounds like barely passing.
author: Flora W.

description:
What makes you guys think you deserve a 15% "service charge"? Tips are based on the customer's gratitude from the service, not what you guys deem as adequate. You're too presumptuous to add it yourself. As a business, you have no say in that at all. Shane on you Shabu House for being greedy. Be grateful people even come - there are plenty of shabu places in the city.

Be careful not to double tip these guys. They hide it on the second receipt.
author: Gordon Y.

description: This review is solely based on the seating system. If a seating policy is established then it should be enforced as described.  Parties were seated without all persons present.  What is the point of a policy if the establishment does not honor it.
author: L. R.

description:
This place is decent and I particularly go to this location compared to other Shabu Houses more often because of the better chance of finding parking around the area. I would avoid coming here during the weekend or at least arrive a little bit earlier than you expect because there will be a wait, for sure!

Lately, the service at this location have been terrible and the waitresses working there are not paying any attention to the tables around them. Granted, there are times when this place is packed (i.e weekends), but other times when it isn't so busy, we would wait for a long period of time to get a refill on water after flagging them down TWICE. I would suggest to order and ask for everything the moment you order, even if it means ordering a second cup of water, since you won't see your server again until you ask for the check. 

The food itself is decent, and I haven't done the AYCE option for $32/person since I am stuffed by the large plate. I usually do a combo with the selection of lamb and Kobe beef. Yum! The small plate/appetizers are good as well and the sauces that go with the food for them vary on the day you go - it's been different each time I've ordered! I really enjoy the lamb and the miso soup is the perfect balance for me. However, I only come to this location now if I am too lazy to drive out all the way to Clement for Shabu Club because of their service.
author: Victoria K.

description:
1 star for convenient location, 1 star for the service, (the girls are always nice and polite) and 1 star for the quality... 

However the prices are a bit high, and I wish the had a bit more variety in terms of vegetables. It seems like they pop one mushroom, 4 cubes of tofu alongside piles of cabbage and spinach. 

Most important though, is the 15% service charge. Although I don't typically tip under 15%, I would find it a little more welcoming if patrons were told before getting the bill, at the very least to avoid over-tipping.
author: Miss F.

description:
Shabu is sooo delicious! Been to this location 3 times. The wait is usually really long since the restaurant is small. The broths are a really good. I usually get ginger chicken and spicy miso split in one pot. I usually order a regular beef and a regular lamb, which is more than enough for my sister and I. 

I've visited this location around dinner time (around 7 pm) and it was packed and had to wait about 30-45 mins for a table of 6. I've also visited right before they closed (9:30pm) and it was still packed. Had to wait about 15 minutes for a party of two. 

If you don't want to wait, go right when they open! I went at 5:15pm and didn't have to wait, which was great! Plus, you get 15% off the entire bill if you order during happy hour (5-6pm).
author: Ally T.

description: Be prepare to wait in line when you come at night! Shabu shabu is perfect for a cold day! Me and my best friend came her she ordered ginger base soup while I ordered spicy miso and for my meat I ordered the regular set for 18.99 and the sauce they provide comes out to be a perfect pairing with the rice, beef, and veggies! And after finishing the course of food, they provide ice cream! This place always adds the 15% on your bill already automatically for tips.
author: Melanie N.

description:
This uuu-sed to be my go to place for shabu, but after tonight's lack of dinner, I don't think I'll be coming back. Granted, it's a Friday night so I anticipated the long wait. However, the waitress failed to let the patrons who were waiting know that there were two huge parties coming in with reservations. Uhhh? If your restaurant is such a dinky ass place and you have two parties of 8 and 12, shouldn't you let the patrons know that the wait will be extra long tonight? Instead the slow waitresses ignored everyone unless they're seated. Worst service ever. 

Stupid beezies. 

Hmph. Ruined my Friday night.

Btw, there's a fucking leak from your ac dripping down water, you blind clueless idiots.
author: Jen N.

description: This is probably my favorite Japanese hotpot in town! Fair price, fresh meat and vegetable and don't need to wait for a long time. Only that need to improved is their service, they are just too busy to cover all the table.
author: Qichen G.

description: Came here with a party of four. The wait isn't too bad on a weekday but I think it gets busy on the weekends. Portion sizes are good and pricing is pretty decent. I love the ginger chicken soup! Got me craving it this whole week. The service here is very attentive. Bianca served our table and she's just the sweetest! Overall, I like this location more than the others.
author: Anna Z.

description:
Used to be one of my favorite places but they're quickly slumping. Food still tastes good but how are you gonna have waitresses who don't know what goma sauce is??

All you can eat is $32 per person but everyone at your table has to do it. Even if you only ordered 1 plate and can't finish it (yes, that happened, ok?) you can't take that home like you would if you ordered a large. The owners would rather throw it in the trash then to make their customers happy. My advice to the owners is to have your waitresses make sure to tell the customer that before they order all you can eat. My bad for making the mistake of not just ordering a large and an extra plate of meat. 

Too bad they're really not worth the common hour long wait anymore. Forget trying to have a conversation with the people at your table since EVERYONE is yelling. 

Too bad. I'd rather drive further to go to Shabuway.
author: Alice L.

description:
They auto add 15% tip even if you have a party of two, AND they don't break down the charges on your receipt  so it's easy to overlook.

A dinner for two (two plates) cost $18-19 each, so with taxes your bill shouldn't be more than $42. However, my bill for two people have come out to $48 each time. I'd recommend eating at another shabu restaurant such as Shabu Way, where they don't scam their customers. Or don't tip them next time.
author: Ýóseph M.

description:
You have no idea how pleasantly surprised I was to find Shabu House because 1) I LURRRRV SHABU SHABU and 2) My go-to place closed few months ago in the Outer Sunset and I was very deprived of Shabu Shabu and of happiness, jk about the latter part... kinda ;) Until last week, the bf and I randomly took a wrong street on our way to dinner and stumbled upon THIS BEAUTIFUL TREASURE. We quickly found parking (another great plus) and went in. The open sign was lit (it was probably about 8pm), lots of empty tables, the delicious aroma of Shabu Shabu... mhmm table for two please.

SETTING
-A good amount of tables, my favorite part was not having to wait. We walked in and were quickly seated, menus and all.
-Fast service. We were quickly brought out water and I can't remember if they brought out the ponzu and dipping sauces before or after we ordered. Anyways, it was brilliantly fast.

MENU
-Spicy Miso for broth all the wayyyyy!
-We ordered two large plates of meat - one combination (lamb + pork), and one beef. Each order comes with a vegetable plate full of cabbage, mushroom, spinach, carrots, udon noodles, etc. 
-Bowls of rice. Your meal is now truly complete.

PROS
-Fast service.
-Garlic and green onion in the little condiment jars for you to add into your soup :)
-ICE CREAM AT THE END!! Your choice of Red Bean or Green Tea. Seriously the best way to end a wonderful meal of Shabu Shabu.
-They have an ALL YOU CAN EAT option.
-Closes at 10pm, pretty awesome.

CONS
-Our soup took awhile to boil, I was pretty tempted to turn up the temperature because I felt that it was taking a little longer than usual. That was easy to fix so not really a con.

Yeah, I think I need to go back here, like right now.
author: Grace J.

description:
Kind of disappointed on how it went. I came here with family. Everything is okay. Portion is lesser than before I feel like. Servers were all over the place. I was sitting in the center of the restaurant, but it took me like 10 mins to have someone deliver my check.

If you are driving, and don't mind driving a little farther, you should try G cube, where they have more options in food. Slightly cheaper too.
author: Ann H.

description: My first time trying shabu shabu and it was so amazing! The prices are fair and the service is friendly. They are super welcoming and helpful with suggestions.
author: Sara K.

description: Upon my visit to San Francisco, my uncle and his friends treated me here as a "good-bye" dinner, going back to Seattle. I'd say, I haven't encountered a place like Shabu in Washington before. So, it makes my standards for Japanese Hot Pot sort of high. The wait was really long though, we went in the evening around 730PM, and it was pretty busy, we were waiting outside. Besides that, the vibes were great and the food was delicious. I'm not sure how much everything amounted to, but whatever the cost was, it will be worth it.
author: Jessica Y.

description: Shabu House is one of my favorite restaurants in SF, is worth the price,  and if u are really hungry I would recommend the "all you can eat" which is gonna make u very very full B)  The carabuta pork is really good, you should def try it, also convenient , since this location always has parking,  the one at Geary St is always too full and difficult to find parking most of the time.
author: Jath R.

description: This location is very small and there's usually always a wait. Much smaller than the burlingame location. However, the service was fast, professional, and friendly!!! Really loved how the girls were really on top of everything especially since we Waited a while for a table. I always get Kobe beef with spicy miso. Can't go wrong!!!
author: Daisy S.

description:
We were sat immediately! We came right before the dinner rush, right after spending several hours at Super Bowl City. We took the bart & muni here with the helps of the muni drivers we knew which bus to take. Everyone was soo friendly & very helpful. 

The waitresses set up our table and took our order. We did the AYCE for two adults and two kids. Once we received out soup, veggie trays, water, udon and meat, it was tough trying to get the attention of a waitress. By that time the dinner rush has began, which is understandable; however, only one waitress asked if we were doing fine.

Nonetheless, the abundance of our meat tray was over the top! It filled us up, and  we only needed so order one more small tray of meat. We also had to order more udon, napa cabbage, and enoki mushrooms.

At the end of our meal, on the bill it stated we received a 15% discount and we were confused. So we asked a waitress what was it for and she said it was because we came during happy hour. AWESOME!! What was also included was the 15% tip as well, so we did not have to tip. I'm not sure if it's for parties of four or more guests or everyone, please ask to confirm. :)))

We will definitely, come back again! The kids approved and said that they gave us a lot more meat than other Shabu house restaurants.
author: Idnyc N.

description:
Shabu House NEVER disappoints. Don't get the large. The regular portion plate is good enough for an average human being. You choose your flavor broth which would be spicy miso or ginger chicken. (If you can't handle spicy food like me, I HIGHLY suggest you play it safe and go with the ginger chicken flavor. Beef or Lamb for the meat and an option for a bowl of rice. The two dipping sauces is what really tops off the whole meal. They are your one-two punch combo. Don't be afraid to ask for more sauces if you run out.

Best to try and finish everything. You are paying at least $20 for your own self. Gotta get your money's worth here at Shabu House. Remember to leave generous tips!
author: Darrell N.

description: Shabu house is my favorite shabu restaurant! I wasn't a fan of shabu because I always felt like it was too bland and not flavorful enough, until I came here. I love the location because I never have trouble finding parking. I love their sesame and ponzu sauces with the green onions and garlic. I havent tried the AYCE yet because usually a regular set is good enough for me. You pay a decent price for a good amount of food, and I always leave with a full and happy stomach. I usually get 1/2 ginger chicken and 1/2 spicy miso - you can split the pot and share with friends! The service is great as well.
author: Annie L.

description: Just finished eatting here and food was okay and the service was just okay I give 2 stars just because the food was good. I didn't check my bill until after i paid. We had an automatic 15% service charge and was never told that we were getting this. I was about to tip them but lucky I doubled checked. For the record we were only a party of 2 so I feel this is really dishonest of them to do this without even saying anything. For anyone that eats here please double check the bill before you pay.
author: Ryan Y.

description: First timer here and all i can say is food is great. Would likely to recommend this place to friends and family.
author: Mickey M.

description:
Trying to keep it short for the third location of Shabu House that I've been to..let's see how this goes!

Pros: 
*Shabu House is pretty consistent with quality and portions at all of their locations.  Prices too (HH discount before 6PM on weekdays at all locations).
*Easy meter parking..try saying that about the Geary location!

Cons:
*Service is slower and less attentive here than the others.  
*The peanut sauce though the consistency is still the same, tasted saltier than normal.
*Smaller then the Burlingame location & I want to say it's smaller than Geary's too.

We got here before 6 on a Friday night and were seated right away, but if you get here after 6:30, you're for sure going to wait.  If you are closer to the Peninsula or don't mind driving I'd suggest the Burlingame location.  I like the Geary location better than this one, but it's easier for parking on Ocean, so pick your poison.  3 stars.
author: Cat C.

description: The go to place for shabu cravings. However beware of the long line during happy hour or in dinner generally. The wait can take from 20 min to an hour and a half. If you have a big group of 6 or more highly suggest calling in the day before to rspv. I've tried everything on the menu and my favorite is getting the half spicy miso and ginger chicken broth with large Kobe beef. When sharing also note the sharing fee! But that can be waive if you order any appetizer from the menu. Chicken kaarage and the tofu agadashi are the best out of the appetizer menu.
author: Roseanne V.

description: Delicious food, only downfall is the wait time and how quickly the servers rush you out of the restaurant. Otherwise, food was great! I advise if you're a party of three or more to get the all you can eat, you'll get more for you're $
author: Tiffany A.

description:
My friend took me here after he was SHOCKED that I've NEVER had shabu before. He was so surprised and described it as if I was missing out on life.

Shabu House is a chain so there's multiple locations across the Bay Area. My friend loves this location, probably because it is close to his home.

I didn't know what to expect. I didn't even know what to order. He gave me a run down of what to order: a large combo meat plate ($20) lamb and beef with spicy miso soup. As with all shabu, it comes with a plate of veggies, udon, and rice with a complimentary ice cream for dessert. They also provide ponzu and peanut sauce.

Downside is that they don't have ramen if you prefer ramen over udon. And they don't have that fancy split pot, but then again, they only have 3 different soups for you to choose from (plain, spicy miso, and ginger chicken). Another downside is they don't offer a good variety of broths.

We didn't get AYCE because knowing me a large plate is definitely enough to fill me up.

What's nice about Shabu House is that they also offer happy hour, 15% off your entire bill from 5-6pm. They also offer all you can drink too in addition to AYCE shabu for about $40. AYCE shabu is about $30. Prices are average, the same as other shabu places.

The meat was marbled very nicely making the meat flavorful and tender when cooked. The spicy miso was also flavorful.

Service was pretty good. We were seated at the bar where they have built in stoves and TVs so we could watch the game.

Shabu House is pretty average for shabu, but why 4 stars? because my first time was with them and they opened me up to a whole new world :D. I had a great first time shabuing and I've been in love with shabu since!
author: Stephanie L.

description: We enjoyed it. The food was fresh. The servers weren't that friendly but they were okay. The prices were on the high side but pretty good for shabu. The portions were very decent.
author: p v.

description:
Shabu is about to start feeling almost the same at most places around the city. Shabu House is one of the top ones on my list. Came here the other night with b and we got lucky with parking right in front. I think a lot of the places around are closed by that time so parking isn't too horrific as we would imagine it to be on Ocean Ave. 

We each did the all you can eat for $31/person. We got lucky because when we got in there was only one other table who was present and about to leave cause they were done.. so it was nice and quiet and started to fill up slowly and by the time I knew it, the place was packed and people were waiting in line for a table. 

After reading many reviews, we decided to go for the spicy miso soup base. The meat is really fresh and nicely marbleized with the perfect red tint that red meat should have. The veggie plate comes with a mushroom, baby carrots, spinach, cabbage and udon. It's a good variety to go with your meat.

The girls that work at Shabu house are extremely attentive and friendly. They keep the glasses full and constantly make sure you if you want another plate of meat. Really good service. 

We were stuffed but still got our complimentary ice cream. Bf even asked for two scoops since he loves ice cream and they didn't hesitate to deliver. Thank you!

Will be back when I crave for some meat.
author: Tiff C.

description:
I LOVE SHABU HOUSE ON GEARY! This new location? Ehhhh, not so much...

The newest of the three Shabu Houses to open in the SF Peninsula Area in the old Kasumi (Izakaya restaurant) space, I was ecstatic when I heard about this new location on Ocean Avenue. Yay, I can get my soul-warming shabu fix close to home. However, after my experience last night, I rather trek across the city and deal with nightmare parking issues in the Outer Richmond or deal with the rowdy drunktards greedily taking advantage of the AYCD at the Burlingame location. Let me explain why. 

1. FOOD QUALITY IS MEDIOCRE

*The kobe beef was dull in color, not very marbled or very tender; it was actually a bit tough. My friend had the lamb which crumbled into pieces. Don't bother ordering the chicken karaage. It was all batter and the chicken was dry. 

*The sesame sauce was too thick and gloppy. It was also bland and lacked a rich nuttiness. The ponzu sauce was so salty to the point it numb my tongue.  

*The broth (choice of water, spicy miso and ginger chicken broth) is filled with MSG not flavor. I'm sensitive to MSG but never had a problem with the broths in the other locations. However, during dinner last night I felt my heart racing from the copious amounts of MSG they put in the Spicy Miso broth and was up all night from cotton ball mouth syndrome. 

2. SERVICE  IS  SLOW AND THE EMPLOYEES ARE VERY INEXPERIENCED 

Though friendly, the employees really lack time management skills and need to learn how to streamline their processes.  

When there's a crowd of people waiting to be seated, why are you fumbling with sauces in the back (there's an open window to the prep area)? And more importantly, why are there two people doing that without anyone in the front of the house? They have a busboy to clear off and clean the tables yet the waitresses are helping the busboys while customers are frustrated wanting to be seated and/or  wondering where their orders are.  

3. THE SMALLEST LOCATION OF THE THREE (not their fault)

There's a ~45 person capacity with one large table in the back. If you have a large party, the Burlingame location is your best bet.  Parking is very easy here though. 

I wouldn't come running back to this Shabu House location unless they work out their kinks. For their sake, I hope they do because this is a very convenient location outside of SF's "New Chinatown" in Richmond. Until then, I'm sticking to their Geary Boulevard location or Gcube in the Sunset when in need of a Shabu Fix. 

OTHER NOTES:
*Shabu Lunch/Dinner Sets comes with Udon, Rice, Veggies (tofu, cabbage, spinach, enoki mushrooms, shitake mushroom and carrots) and ice cream. 
*AYCE is $31 and AYCE & AYCD is $41 (prices have increased).
*2 hour limit for AYCE & AYCD.
*Reservations accepted.
*For some reason, they use old school credit card carbon copy slips. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/buv-wKDpSL6Iy4_PM1LyMw?select=g3iFxjic1L6vhzxGg2eVFw I hope they destroy copies after reconciling their sales.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Not a big fan of shabu. But this time the experience was descent. I'd give the food 4 for impressing me. But minus one for auto gratituiy ( 15%), even for parties of two. Not cool. Waitress said its a company policy.... TMD.
author: PJ T.

description: I love Shabu house so much. Every time I come here I've never been disappointed they are consistently good and I compared every single Shabu place that I've been to against Shabu house. This is definitely the go-to Shabu place for me
author: Abraham A.

description:
Glimpsing through the list of great reviews, I have to wonder, did I eat at the same place?!

A couple weeks ago my friend mentioned the Kasumi had turned into a shabu place.  Being the foodies we are and the craving for anything soupy in this cold weather, my friend and I finally made our way here last night.

WAITING/SEATING:
We walked in and told the waitress table for two.  She said it would be just a couple of minutes (even though there was plenty of empty seats).  We stood there for 5+ minutes while she set up our table by placing napkins, chopsticks, and our sauce dishes on the table.  Why couldn't we just sit while she did all that?  

APPETIZERS:
*Chicken Kaarage - Pass.  The chicken was cut up and deep fried in small pieces so what you tasted was mainly batter.
*Gyoza - Good.  The veggie pork filling was delicious while the outer shell remained crispy.

SHABU:
*Broth: Choice of miso, spicy miso, or chicken
*Shabu by plate or all you can eat ($31 for all you can eat or $41 for all you can eat/drink, 2 hr limit)
*Veggies (mushrooms, lettuce, spinach, carrots) & udon noodles included
*Ponzu and sesame sauces

Everything here tastes...different.  I ordered the Kobe beef and lamb combo and noticed that the quality of the meat was not the same compared to the other two Shabu Houses.  The lamb was fattier and the beef...well, it just didn't taste as good.  The spicy miso broth was lighter and lacked the flavorful depth I'm use to.  Although the ponzu sauce tasted similar, the sesame sauce seemed watered down.

NOTE: You may want to think twice about doing the all you can eat.  You're limited to two hours and the waitresses make that clear.  I watched a couple come in and was told that they were going to wait on seating them because their two hours would start as soon as they sit down.  Service is slow and I watched the guy at the table next to us wait almost 10 minutes before he got another plate of beef.

SERVICE:
SLOW!!!  I'm use to quick and efficient service when I visit the other two Shabu Houses and I wish they would've sent over some of those employees to "train" ones at this location.  The waitresses often looked lost and followed each other around.  They never smiled and I find it odd that they were bussing tables since we saw a bus boy working there.  

PARKING:
Metered street parking which is easier to find than the other two locations.

Based on service and food quality, I doubt I'd be back...
author: Nicole S.

description:
Bf and I stopped by this place after a long hike at fort funston with our dog. We were starving! The wait was a bit long, but once we were seated service was very fast and efficient. 

We both ordered the large Kobe beef meal. The portion was bigger than usual, so I was pretty happy about that. It also came with standard veggies, tofu and udon. The nice additional plus was that they serve free ice cream at the end of the meal.

The reason for 3 stars is mainly because I've had better/more tender meat at other shabu places. I also didn't like how you are forced to choose only one broth even if you have two people ordering two meal sets. This is the first time I've experienced this. We got the spicy miso and it was good, but I would've also liked to try one of their other broths. 

Overall I would come back since I love shabu shabu but this place probably wouldn't be one of my top picks.

Tip: You get 15% off your meal if you go before 6 pm! We barely missed the cut off, so definitely something to keep in mind next time.
author: Sophia H.

description:
This was my first Shabu experience ever! I can't believe I've waited so long to try it! Apparently the original Shabu House is located on Geary (seriously too far from my house and I try to avoid having to look for parking in the Richmond). This location just recently opened, and it just so happens that both of my sisters have already had the chance to try it! 

I went here with my family on xmas eve, we ordered two orders of the Kobe Beef, one order of the lamb, and one order of the pork shabu shabu. This was the perfect amount for our party of 5. We chose the Spicy Miso soup base which was very flavorful and mildly spicy. Each order of Shabu Shabu comes with rice, vegetables, udon, and ice cream for dessert. The meat was very fresh, lean, and thinly sliced. I was very pleased with the quality of the meat, vegetables, and broth. 

Overall, the service was great, the waitresses were very attentive and helpful when making our dinner selections. And the food was so lean and tasty, I loved it!
author: Elaine N.

description:
They are no longer under staffed now..thank god..
Guess it works out since Shabu Tonight is no more...(+1)

The waitresses are fast at seating and taking down orders without feeling like you are under the gun.(+1)

Combination portion sizes in comparison to Shabu Club...House is bigger (+1)...

Server: Amy.
Efficient, quick and even for someone with a lighter toned voice. With the music and loud and over perfumed female yapping away; I could still hear her ! (+1)

That or my hearing has an advanced filter now Lol.

I still pick green tea over red bean.
author: Eric C.

description:
Would come here more often if it weren't so $$$. Bu that is typical of shabu in general, so we keep this place in mind for something special. Everything I've eaten is delicious. Often times I get the all you can eat/drink. That makes for a very fun night! Please drink responsibly! 

Wait staff is friendly and boy do they hustle! It can be hard to catch your waitress's attention at times, but only because they are so busy serving as efficiently as possible, so I don't mind! And they don't mind when I ask for more of the sesame sauce (it's my favorite). 

Try it! Fun for a date night / groups.
author: Alisha S.

description: I'm not a fan of preparing my own meal while out (or in, but that's another story!), but this is a worthwhile experience from time to time. The beef meal is good, though veggies are too plentiful and noodles are too few. I really like the unagi and rice. Not having to cook that is a bonus. The two ice cream options aren't for me. Bleh. The place could use a better non-alcoholic drinks menu. Soda, soda, soda...
author: Paulina F.

description:
I really liked this place! We came kind of late so it wasn't too long of a wait. I dont know how long this location has been open but everything looks fairly new and modern. 

The food was so gooood. We came here after a gym sesh ready for an all you can eat meat night! For only $31.00, you get a choice of American Style Kobe Beef, American Kurobuta Pork, or Lamb with a choice of broth: Traditional Water, Spicy Miso, or Ginger Chicken Broth. Served with the typical sesame and ponzu sauce that you can customize with onions, garlic, daikon, and hot sauce. We chose the Spicy Miso & with the first order we got American Kobe Beef & Lamb. That was JUST the beginning as we continued with another order of all 3 meats on the menu. Finally we proceeded to order 2 more plates of American Kobe Beef. 

With a grand total of 7 plates of meat, a plate of veggies & udon each, and a bowl of rice each between 2 people, pretty sure the couple sitting at the table next to us [that had 1 plate of meat each] thought we were monsters that had bottomless pits for stomachs. We definitely ate our money's worth. The quality of meat was amazing with a good enough thickness and a generous quantity per plate. The pieces were not so thin that they fall apart when you pick it up like some shabu places.

I did notice the quality of meat slightly decreased on our 6th and 7th plate but its quite understandable at that point. Also our soup was so drenched in meat juices at the end of our meal that it did look pretty nasty. Maybe they could consider having a slotted spoon so that those who order a lot of meat could clean it out a little & refresh with some more broth.  Either way it was delicious to the end. Even got a free scoop of yummy green tea ice cream !

Service was great, sometimes a little hard to get their attention but they are all very sweet and patient. 

Highly recommend this place for AYCE shabu!
author: Denise W.

description: This place is so good..the wait is totally worth it and the waiters are very nice and always check to make sure your food is good..def recommend on a cold rainy day! I always come here when I feel sick and feel better right after my soup
author: Leilani R.

description: Pretty self-explanatory.  The slices of meat here are delicious, thin, and fresh.  You can see workers slicing large cuts made to order.  Their choices of broth also adds to the variety of traditional shabu.  The prices are pretty reasonable for both all you can eat and all you can drink.  Spacious upstairs seating, but expect to wait on weekends.  There is ample street parking around the area.
author: David C.

description: Always great service, delicious shabu shabu. Wide selection of food. Always happy when I come to this place.
author: Margarita M.

description:
If it weren't for Shabu House and one of their employees, Anna, I would've kept avoiding hot pot because I thought I hated it :) 
I came here with a mostly full stomach, but I ate a lot. I really liked the lamb, spinach, dipping the udon in ponzu (?) sauce, and "Happy Bride" sake. We had chicken broth. Total noms. Would totally come back.
author: Sandra J.

description:
Having an AYCE option is always a gamble for a small girl like me. I always think that I can eat more than my weight, but I always end up not returning for seconds and spending more money than I should..... This is why I absolutely love shabu house.

Shabu house is definitely my go-to place for shabu, and it should be everyone else's as well. Service is fast and friendly - people think that since you cook your own food, you shouldn't tip as much. That's the case with some places, but at shabu house, you can clearly see that the waitresses try their best to make your shabu experience a good one. 

Okay, back to my AYCE rant.. Their AYCE is about $20-$30 a person (don't remember) but I usually don't go for it. I think it's mostly because I don't like getting two plates of veggies. It takes up a lot of room on the table. 

What I strongly advise is this: get a regular sized plate with your choice of meat (I prefer the beef & lamb), and then add on regular plates of additional meat. We usually get about two or three additional plates of meat and our bill comes to be about $40 which I think is a lot more worth than the AYCE.
Also, get the spicy miso broth and add a bunch of garlic. Then add green onions in your ponzu sauce. Sooooo goood!

The best part is the ice cream at the end. Without it, I'd probably be spending more money elsewhere on dessert! Lol happy shabu-ing friends :)
author: Audrey G.

description: The 15% automatic service charge is a slap to your face given their services and food quality. It s a sign of disrespect to your customer when you force them to tip to your liking and not on the actual value of service you provide. This place deserves to go out of business because of such predatory pricing. Feel almost like a scam when you pay them.
author: Derek P.

description:
Came here on two occasions, once on St. Patrick's day with my coworkers to celebrate my coworker and I's birthday and one more time with my boyfriend.

This Shabu House location is pretty small but we were seated immediately nonetheless. The first time I ordered the large plate of the kobe beef. YUM YUM YUM. You're even allowed to mix the broths!

The second time I came back, I ordered the regular plate of kobe beef.

Service is quick as well.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Favorite Shabu place to get my Kobe beef fixing!

I like this location because it's much closer to me than the one on Geary. Yes. I'm that lazy. There's a good amount of parking during dinner time, which is even better. I always get the regular Kobe beef plate with all the veggie fixings, spicy miso soup and red bean with green tea ice cream for dessert. I did the all you can eat once and highly do not recommend this unless you're super hungry.. I only finished 1.5 plates, which could've easily been just a "large plate". The gyoza is also one of my favorites here, as well as the creamy melon soda.

Our waitress: Sirenna, was super nice and friendly. She made sure we weren't left at our table alone from the time we were ordering until we asked for the check. She had great suggestions for everything-appetizers, entree and even dessert. 

NOTE: 15% off total bill from 5-6pm!

This is my new go-to place for Shabu.
author: Laura T.

description:
This place is tiny!! One of the smaller shabu house so there is typically a wait. And unless you know someone who works there that will seat you even though you don't write your name on the wait list (yes that happened and does happen a lot), make sure you get your name on that clipboard and that they don't skip your name (yes that happens too). 

It's your typical shabu place. All you can eat, hot pot, and my usual order of lamb and Kobe beef. Our waiters were horrible. One gave us pork instead of beef. Another would ask us what we would like and forget that we had asked for anything. We waited forever for our seconds (to the point that luckily a new waitress that just started her shift checked on us and finally brought out our plates that had seemly been forgotten about) but they'll clean your table in a matter of seconds. 

So if you're here for the service, get out now.! You're here for the food? I love it! Maybe you'll luck out with a nice server but that's a 10% chance. Care to take the gamble? Lol
author: Hepsie C.

description:
The staff here is friendly, and the food is good (because, you know, I cook it myself). I've been coming to Shabu House for a couple years now, but a recent visit I was perplexed.
All was fine, until it was time to pay. I glanced at the check (for a party of two), and there is a 15% service charge. I've never seen that before. The main reason I come during their "Happy Hour" is to get the 15% discount (which I eventually pass on for the tip's amount). I asked one of the friendly wait staff about it, and she said it's the tip. Hmmm. So they automatically charge a tip for a party of two? I'm used to seeing that for a large group, but never for a party of two. I later learned that even if you dine alone, they charge 15% for party of five or less. C'mon, I'm cooking the goods myself!

While it doesn't affect me since I usually pay a 15% tip from the 15% discount anyways, I could have easily, and not knowingly paid twice for the tip! I'd say that's some shady business shenanigans! They are forcing their customers to pay a tip, regardless of what their individual experience was really like. Luckily, I personally haven't had a bad experience with them, but now I don't know about returning. I'll have to find another spot that conducts honest business with its dining customers. Anyone have good suggestions?
author: R A.

description:
I always look forward to my next visit to Shabu House because I absolutely adore fatty meat. They even put everything nicely on a plate so that the pieces of fatty deliciousness are neatly folded along side one another. So why don't I come more often?

For one thing, I feel that it's become increasingly difficult to differentiate one Shabu place from another. I can't really distinguish my experience (food-wise) from G-Cube or Zabu Zabu, so there is nothing at Shabu House that draws me there exclusively.

Second, I'm a really careful spender (more commonly referred to as 'cheap'), and Shabu House cost upwards of $25. I can make me a similar HK style hotpot at home for a fraction of the cost. The quality (though very good) of Shabu House just doesn't justify the price.

You probably won't see me at Shabu House.......unless it's on someone else's tab : )
author: Ringo M.

description:
I'm really disappointed in my last visit to Shabu House on Monday.  This was my to go to spot for Shabu BUT the customer service was so horrible, that I'll drive the extra 20 mins to go to another Shabu place. 

- When we got there, it was a few mins wait. 
- Once we got our table, we ordered right away.  
- We got our veggies & soup first.
- 15 mins into dinner, we asked the server if our meat was coming yet, and she said it will be there soon.
-  I was done with my veggies and GUESS WHAT?! Another server asked us if we were done with our meal! We informed her we didn't even get the meat.
- 25 mins into dinner, we asked again because we saw other tables getting their second plate of meat when we didn't even get our first. My boyfriend saw the server ask the server who took our orders about our meat & she said "oh I forgot to put in the order"....(WHAT!?)
- They finally put in our orders and got it within 5 mins. SO UPSETTING. 

When we got the bill, they billed us for 2 large kobe beefs. I had to correct them that we got 1 large and 1 regular. I really hope they will improve on their customer service and communication.
author: Stephanie W.

description: My favorite shabu location so far. The interior is kept very clean and the ladies that work here are super efficient. I always get the Kobe beef (really good meat quality) with spicy miso as the base. If you come between 5-6pm, it's their happy hour special and its 15% off the entire bill!
author: Angela K.

description:
This Shabu House has the worst customer service by far. My boyfriend and I had to wait over an hour to finally get a table (even though we sat at the bar instead). A waitress knew we got to the restaurant before three other couples, yet catered to them first. All she did was giggle and nervously walked away without saying anything to us (she wouldn't even look at us). She was alert when it was time for customers to pay for their meal, but not attentive when it came to customers that were waiting for an hour for a table. I recommend going to the Shabu House on Geary or anywhere else.

Don't get me wrong.. The food was decent and the environment was family friendly, but if you want better service, go spend your money elsewhere.
author: Trisha L.

description:
This place is amazing!! I love it! The first time I came, I was delighted that I had found my happy place. Definitely get the spicy miso broth. The soup is unlimited refill, which is not always the case at other shabu/hot pot places (sometimes they just add regular broth to your existing soup at other places). The quality of meat isn't always consistent, but everything else is. When you order a plate, you get udon, a big mushroom (forgot what they're called), enoki mushrooms, napa cabbage, spinach, carrots, tofu, ad a separate plate of meat. I always get the regular beef, although the lamb is pretty good too. I like that the mushrooms they give you are really big.

They also give you ice cream at the end. It's a nice sweet/cool dessert after you gorge on the soup and noodles and vegetables and meat. You can choose between red bean and green tea, but I found out after going a few times that YOU CAN GET BOTH. As in, you can say you want half and half, and you end up getting a scoop of each!!
author: Josephine L.

description: Great soup! With lots of flavor the meat is super tender and good portion for veggies!!
author: Michelle C.

description:
This place was amazing. Me and a few friends came in during lunch and we all ordered the Shabu Entrees which basically come with assorted vegetables such as mushrooms, spinach, carrots, tofu and lettuce, a certain choice of meat, rice, udon, and your choice of green tea or red bean ice cream. Not bad for around a $20 price. Do note that you will be required to pay for gratuity regardless of how many people come in.

The food was really good. Broths come in either water, spicy miso, and ginger chicken. All of which are good broths. The meat was fresh and didn't taste frozen. Vegetables were also delectable and didn't really have any sort of dank quality. 

Overall really good and at the end I was full but didn't feel like shit compared to when I binge eat at McDonalds. 

(ﾉヮ)ﾉ*:･ﾟ
author: Alvin L.

description:
Food = good.
Service = good.  Attentive.

Prices = moderate.

$42/pp for all you can eat Shabu and all you can drink (soda, beer and sake included!)
author: Fannie S.

description: this is our #1 Shabu spot that my boyfriend and I always go to! We're regulars here, even staff knows what exactly we order every time we go!
author: Ma Cristine A.

description:
So sad! I really liked this Shabu House until recently, when I realized how the new waitresses don't know how to seat people. We visited on a weekend night, a little after they opened and the waitresses were running around like chickens with their heads cut off. There were reservations and walk-ins (WOW SO complicated), and it seemed to be a little too much for them because they didn't know what to do. Three parties of walk-ins actually confronted one waitress about the seating issue, asking the most BASIC question---why don't they just seat people inbetween reservations? I agreed with them because we have all been waiting for so long and they would just leave tables empty! Is it really that hard to figure out the seating arrangement? I've been to busier restaurants than this and this is by far the most unprofessional one. And, on top of everything, the waitresses weren't even efficient! Many tables were waiting for their food, waiting to be served, waiting to pay...I really do think the waitresses need to be better trained. The old staff was a lot smarter than the current one. 

We ended up waiting over two hours just to be seated..and that only happened AFTER that one waitress was confronted. I could only imagine how long it would have taken if no one said anything. We would have just stared at the empty tables until closing time, eh? 

Not coming back to this Shabu HOUSE unless I am absolutely forced to go by others. I'm sure the waitresses here don't care because it will make their jobs a lot easier, having one less customer to serve!
author: Sally Y.

description:
My favorite shabu place of all time! This is probably one of the smaller shabu houses but the servers are super friendly. My favorite person is the older Chinese lady with glasses! She always recognizes me and asks how I'm doing. Because the place is so small it's gets packed! They have happy hour from 5-6 for dinner but if you really want to make sure you get the discount (15% off) you should come before 5:30. 

If you've never been to shabu, you pick your choice of broth, size of meat, and then you wait for the servers to bring your broth and wait for it to boil. Then you throw in all your meats and veggies and cook them to perfection. Just a tip for new timers. DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT throw all your meat into the pot at once. You should cook it piece by piece. ( sorry it bugs me when my guy friends throw it all in the pot. Such a waste of good meat) Anyway, this place also offers Ayce shabu for 31 bucks but I can't eat enough to make it worth 31 so I usually stick with a regular, and if I'm really hungry I'll order a large. 

The quality of the Kobe beef meat is top notch. I've been here quite a few times and I've never had a complaint about it. Spicy miso is my favorite broth but the ginger chicken is also really good. I like that you can get two different broths if you prefer. Their veggies are pretty standard but I feel like they give you more than most shabu places. Rice is included with your meal if you'd like. Oh! And I love that you get ice cream at the end. Red bean or green tea!

Overall a great shabu place and I'll always come back. (:
author: Kelly S.

description:
Spicy miso broth was just ok.

At $31/person, I feel like Shabu House fell a little short.

Their dipping sauce wasn't exactly complementary to the meats. Selection is a small. The service was incredibly slow and I really don't think they were THAT busy. The meat itself tastes pretty fresh but I prefer my lamb a little gamier. Marbling on the beef was notable. The taste didn't seem like that of Kobe beef though.

Ended with a scoop of green tea or red bean ice cream.

Yeah, Idk about this for $31.
author: Winè C.

description: This was my first exposure to shabu shabu and it was great. Came here on a Friday night and were able to get seated after a few minutes. We ordered the spicy miso and two large entrees. The kobe beef and vegetables were great; although the carrots seemed to be packaged. I enjoyed the experience and the fact that I can control the cooking process. I'd do it again.
author: Raymond L.

description: The place charges 15% tips without telling people. When  I asked the waitress she said their boss recently changed policy to charge 15% tips for every table. Seriously? I mean the service wasn't bad but that's very shady.
author: Hanping Q.

description:
My favorite-est Shabu spot ever. Because of Shabu house, nothing else compares and because of that, it's also bittersweet when the wait times are so long and you want to go somewhere else but know that you won't be satisfied. Obviously goes to show that this is the spot! They do accept reservations, but only up to a certain time so plan accordingly. There are multiple locations but this one is on the much smaller side.

Spicy miso and Kobe beef is the way to go. Each order comes with a side, actually, a full plate of the vegetables. If you've never been, you're in for a treat AND if that already isn't exciting enough, you get to conclude your meal with a complimentary scoop of green tea or red bean ice cream!!

Yes, it's a little pricey but again, there's nothing else quite like it when it comes to quality and deliciousness.
author: Glecie C.

description:
Went here on a rainy day. It seems like a little family run joint and the woman running the show seemed a little flustered trying to get everyone seated and following up (she kept forgetting our rice) 

The ginger chicken base was great and I liked mixing it with a little bit of spicy miso. We got a large and found it perfectly sized for sharing.
Also the black sesame(?) dipping sauce was quite good. 
It's mostly a home-y vibe in both atmosphere and food. Reliable, low-key, and enjoyable. 

Side note: Would not recommend the karaage because it's not battered and fried and juicy the way I expect karaage to be.
author: Austin L.

description:
This place is fantastic. Incredible Kobe meat -- I could ( and have :) eaten it raw! The other meats they offer are very high-quality, too. I also love the Spicy Miso Broth -- all other Shabu places pale in comparison in my opinion!

They are very quick with serving despite *always* being busy. As soon as you sit, they'll ask what broth you want and if you're ready to order. We usually opt for the AYCE and/or AYCD options as it's a pretty fair deal. You get the standard choice of broth, meat, plate of veggies and noodles, sauces, bowl of rice and free refills. You also get your choice of ice cream at the end. Despite all that, you never feel rushed which is good because...

... the only reason this isn't 5 stars is we've always had to wait. Obviously that's a sign of their popularity, but we've waited upwards of 45min - hour before for 2 people and there isn't a ton of room to stand -- 3 chairs and then the rest of the time, you're standing over people eating which is pretty awkward. It seems like a pretty popular spot for families, big groups and parties which generally can take up a lot of the tables as it's a small restaurant. Also make sure to write your name on the sign-up board in the front. There is no hostess.

But if you love Shabu, highly recommended!
author: Chantelle D.

description:
A lot of policies to deal with. I understand you need them to run a business but realistic exceptions should be made.

Friday night, there was about a 15 minute wait, given a large party had made reservations. Sat down at one of the tables and because of that I was told I had to order AYCE because my boyfriend was ordering it. She said we could sit at the bar and have separate bills and it would be okay. -_- Don't get me wrong, I get why - you don't want people to share AYCE, but realistically I'm not going to eat that much. 

We decided to move the bar. She took our order and we had to ask them for water. Maybe I was a little upset from before but I feel like I should have to wait 15mins from when I sat down for me to ask you if I can have a glass of water...

Shabu house is a chain in my mind so the meat, the sauce and the broth were all good. 

How hard is it to mess up shabu, you don't even have to cook my food for me.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Okay, seriously, the service here is terrible.
