I've been to the other Shabu House locations; specifically, the one on Geary Street in the Richmond District and the one in Burlingame. The service in those two places have always been great, regardless of how busy it was. 

This place...when I got there with my friends, it was half empty. Yet, we sat around for about 15 minutes before someone came by to take our order, despite our attempts to flag someone down within five minutes of being seated. The food came, and it was fine--the same quality as the other Shabu House locations. Good sauces, thinly sliced meat, etc., etc. 

Then, it got busy. We had three people come by asking, "Are you all done here?" WHEN WE CLEARLY WEREN'T DONE. All three servers asked when one of us was mid-bite with a half-full plate of uncooked beef in front of her. The third time the question was asked, the three of us just exchanged looks and said, yeah, we're done. One of us was still eating, yet the server proceeded to pretty much clear everything out of the way and asked what kind of ice cream we wanted. 

Don't get me wrong; I understand turning over tables is really important for a restaurant. We weren't lingering over glasses of water or soda and holding up our table. Nor were we eating especially slow; we would have finished a while ago if it hadn't taken so long to put in our orders. 

But seriously, to rush us out of there when we're still clearly eating and not done? Not acceptable.

Shabu House, train your workers at this location. It's been a long time since I've experienced such subpar service at a restaurant in SF.
author: Evelyn C.

description: I came right at 5:30, waiters are more attentive when the restaurant isn't full... Service got crappier as the restaurant started to fill.  Water was never refilled, couldn't get extra green onions or ponzu... And waited forever just to get our bill.  My bf and I were charged 15% service charge!!!!!  The credit card slip also had a spot to add additional tip if u don't catch their automatic charge!!!!!! That's soooo shady!!!! I rather drive a little further to shabuway!!!!
author: Yukio W.

description:
Very bad service! I order large beef. But just only have 12 slices。I ask the waiter and she said it count by weight.  Also I just have 3 party and she charge me 15%
Service charge.
author: Eva L.

description:
I love Shabu Shabu and coming to Shabu House is always a treat for  me.  Price is very reasonable and the restaurant itself has that hip modern vibe and it is also very clean.  They have TV monitors all over so it is great if you want to watch a game while your eating.

Service is great.  The staff are always very attentive and accomodating.  It gets pretty full most of the time and you can see they are busy but they are always smiling and try to be as efficient as possible.

Food is good....always satisfying.  I always order the American Style Kobe Beef with the Spicy Miso Broth it is so good, there is a generous portion of assorted vegetables, udon, rice and it even comes with ice cream.  Good quality beef, and their dipping sauces are the best I have tasted anywhere.
author: Maria M.

description:
Officially obsessed & admitting I have an addiction.

Usually the first thing I do when I wake up is think about Shabu house's sauce. Then I wonder when the next time I can get it is (usually within 7 days hopefully).  Now I'm even toying with the idea of just buying my own hot pot set (probably won't be the same).

They are better than any other shabu shabu in the city (and I've been to quiteee a few) because:

1. Sauce is better
2. Broth is better (spicy miso...for life)
3. Beef is better (more tender, huge portion)
4. Inside is clean, environment is inviting, and service is awesome
5. To avoid the 1+ hour wait, MAKE A RESERVATION. Even when you're a little late, they're still accommodating.
6. Huge portion of veggies

The plate of beef for $20 is enough for me.  I am delightfully full afterwards and the green tea ice cream is literally icing on the cake.

An addiction I don't plan to kick any time soon.
author: Adele Z.

description: I love the Burlingame location & the service at this location is horrible. They sat us without any menus and kept walking past us, I had to flag a server down for a menu. And the worst part....THEY WERE OUT OF RICE! How does a shabu restaurant run out of rice? They should of been better prepared. Never coming back here, I'll stick with the Burlingame location.
author: Kryssa T.

description: My go to place for shabu. My friends and I usually go to the clement one but this one is closer to where I live. Each shabu house is the same so this would serve as a review for all of them. This is probably the best shabu house in the city for the cost of the beef. We get the ginger and the spicy miso 1/2 pot and just do the Kobe beef. It's the way to go. I would order the meat the second you sit down since it takes a while to cut the meat but it's worth it. The wait can be long so shoot for off peak hours for the quickest service.
author: Sara G.

description:
Hands down the best place to eat in San Francisco! I don't know if that's sad or not because there's a lot of fancy nice places to eat in San Francisco.. Anyway, the reason why I like this place so much is because the Kobe beef is soooo tender. I've eaten a lot of hot pot in my life and they're all good..

But trust me, the meat here is the highest quality! I've always gotten the spicy miso soup which is just the right amount of salty and spicy. Although maybe I can be adventurous and try the chicken soup..hehehe. They give you a lot of veggies and that delicious udon noodles with rice. I usually substitute the rice with..more udon noodles! And the waitresses there are pretty nice and do so with no questions asked. Some places will place a surcharge because I guess noodles are more expensive than rice. -_- *grumble grumble*

Anyway the only gripes I have about shabu house would be... It's kinda expensive.. Maybe not for a shabu place in sf, but definitely compared to other places *cough LA cough cough*. It's a price I'm willing to pay though because the beef is thaaaat good. No other places can compare meat wise. Another thing I wish they had are glass noodles. I love glass noodles in my hot pot!!! I would prefer them over the udon noodles they give you..even though the udon is delicious too. 

Oh yea they have all you can eat here! Which I've done once..sooo good. I wanna do ayce again! Hehe. And they give you some ice cream (green tea or red bean) as dessert if you're not already stuffed by all the hot pot. I usually get green tea but the red bean is good too..even though I don't really like red bean that much...
author: Stephanie W.

description: Shabu House is my go-to for shabu in the SF area. Came here for lunch after a Saturday morning run at Lake Merced and it was perfect. No line or wait and the service was attentive. The quality of the shabu at this location is the same as the one in the Richmond.
author: Elissa S.

description: I don't remember the Kobe Beef tasting kind of funky. I usually prefer going to the Burlingame location though because of the atmosphere and the service there is a lot better! This place would have been better if they served the water first and not after we've already eaten. It's just something that bothers me when that's the first thing that should come out.
author: Keng G.

description: mmm delicious american kobe.  Just thinking about the smell and flavor of this basic beef makes me want moar.  Only mistake I made here was getting the AYCE, I couldn't control myself and of course ate a buttload that I didn't need to.  If you're hungry just order the large plate, no one really needs to eat more than that.
author: Vince L.

description: It has been a while since i went to this shabu house. I came here on a sunday night for an early dinner with my family. We came around 5:30. I would thought it wouldnt be that busy, but when we walked in, it was almost pack. We manage to get the last open table and one of the tables was already reserve even though they opened for only 30 minutes. If we had came at a later time, we would have waited much longer since this place isnt big. Of course we got the ayce option when we got seated to our table which cost about $35 per person, thats if you dont get any drinks. Got the spicy miso broth. And got couple rounds of lamb and beef and vegetables. Whenever i come, their foods were always good but it was only  alright when i came few days ago. But the broth usually always have flavor from the meat and vegetables. The ice cream always give a nice touch after the end of your meal. Shabu house is always a cool place to hang out with your friends or family. Service was slow since there were only 2 workers. Will come here again next time.
author: Julie N.

description:
Other than being located on a crowded street full of restaurants and limited parking, this place is a prime location to have a dinner before going out to the city.  My friends and I came here on a Saturday night at around 7 pm and the wait was about 45 minutes.  The place wasn't too big so the wait was expected for a table for 4.  

Once seated, the waiters/waitresses were quick to ask for our orders which was nice because we were starving.  I ended up ordering just the regular american kobe beef and a large bottle of Kirin beer.  The meal was perfect for me as I was stuffed!  In addition to the meat, you are given a large amount of sides that included spinach, lettuce, mushrooms, carrots and the best part udon!  Other places don't offer udon so it was a surprise to have it here which is a big plus!  My friend and I ended up sharing the spicy miso broth which what I normally order at a shabu house and this one wasn't anything special but it was good.

In all, it was a great place to eat and have a few drinks with friends.  The staff was nice and friendly so they'll expect me to see me back soon.
author: Kurt N.

description: Shabu house is a pretty small place and probably the only shabu shabu in the area but definitely great service and meat! Choice are limited but it makes the decision easier and that's what I liked about this place. I got the regular Kobe beef (a lot of meat, I can't imagine how much more large is, nonetheless, perfect portion) with mix of spicy miso and chicken broth and it was bomb! Plenty of vegetables! And with your shabu you get ice cream at the end of your meal and I got the green tea, can't go wrong with that!!
author: Mel P.

description:
I'm a big fan of Shabu and wanted to try this place out since they have an AYCE option. For $10 more you can also do the AYCD option. It was really tempting but I opted out for that because I rather be filling myself up with meat!

I'm from out of town and AYCE shabu doesn't exist where I'm from. I'm used to only having several slices of meat but that's not the case here. Meat heaven. There's three types of meat choices. American Style Kobe Beef, American Kurobuta Pork, and Lamb. My favorite is the beef. The quality of the beef was great. It has good marbling with not too much fat. The lamb comes in second with the last place going to the pork. The portion sizes are very big too. I took me a while to plow through each plate of meat. Good job for them, I didn't have to bother them for refills.

There are three broth options, Traditional Water, Spicy Miso, or Ginger Chicken Broth. The spicy miso was my favorite. The goma sauce was lacking for me. Not the best I had maybe just average. The ponzu was fine, you can't really mess that up.

The service was not that great at all here. I received my food but had not even got my drinks. I really had to wave them down. Once you do get their attention, they're pretty quick about getting refills on meats and veggies. The wait here was pretty long but luckily I had made reservation and I also came before the crowd really picked up. 

Overall, come hungry for the AYCE but you would probably be pretty satisfied with the regular or large. I barely ate the veggies and rice with the AYCE option and I was stuffed.
author: Michael C.

description:
Came around 9PM on a Thursday night. Not very crowded as it's near closing but they still served us and didn't rush us at all! The place is definitely quite small and one of those hole-in-the-wall restaurants. Street parking plentiful!

I would DEFINITELY go with the Spicy Miso with the Kobe Beef. For around $20 each person, you can get a whole plate of meat and another plate filled with assorted vegetables including tofu and mushrooms and udon. You can also get rice :)! They also give you two dipping sauces - one more soy sauce-y and another peanut-y. For all this...around $20. GREAT deal right? It's even cheaper during lunch.

To top off your meal, you must get the red bean ice cream. TRUST, Yelp don't lie!
author: Ting Jung L.

description: It's a good time for hot pot !!! Food is good hope the waitress can bring food quickly.
author: Yueming G.

description: I love coming to this place! The best thing I like about this place is that they can divide the broth instead of having your own. That way you can fit more people in a table. I don't eat meat so what I got was the vegetarian with spicy miso broth and a seaweed salad. Trust me, you'll definitely get full! I haven't eaten all day until I can here which was late around 6 PM. The only thing I asked for more was the udon. They also have complimentary dessert which is a scope of either red bean or green tea. The service is always great. They come to check up on how you're doing very often. Come when it's 5-6 so you can make it to 15% off your entire bill!
author: Eileen Joy P.

description: This place is amazing, price is a bit expensive but it is reasonable for the quality of food and the amount of food you get. Don't come with a big group though because it is quite small. I come here when eating with my boyfriend or group of four people. They have different options for the meat, but also have vegetarian option, and also for the flavour of the soup. The place is clean and we get ice cream in the end. Definitely 5 out of 5. Also, I suggest making a reservation because it gets full really fast.
author: Astari S.

description:
Bitter sweet coming here! Shabu is amazing the wait is a headache! 


Also annoyed that they take reservations for all party sizes except two. It seems like a table for two is an added 20 min wait!
author: Kristina N.

description:
Sigh. Living in Japan has made me a shabu, sushi, ramen, yakitori, overall Japanese food snob.

So after moving back to the US I craved shabu for weeks but refused to eat it cause I knew it would suck. I finally caved to my cravings, even though I knew it wouldn't compare to Japan. So I went to Shabu House, merely cause I was close by. The beef was dry, tough and flavorless. Broth watery and flavorless. And their "kurobuta" pork was flavorless cardboard. My fiancee (NOT a food snob at all) took one bite of the pork and said "WTF is that?". Needless to say we will never be back. 

Side note: I remember Shabuway had the best beef so I'll have to give them a try once I get over my shabu snobiness.
author: Beverly T.

description:
Went on Valentines Day and it was already filled up by 5:30 and there were several names ahead of us on the wait list. I've been to the Shabu house in Burlingame and it is a much bigger location. This place has a bar that seats 4 and about 10 tables. I can imagine waiting a long time if you come here for the AYCE because you have a limit of 2 hours. I'm sure most people will get full before the 2 hour limit but incase everyone intended to stay the whole time, you will likely be waiting a while for a table. By the way, the AYCE is well worth the money. 

My girl and I had the Spicy Miso soup. It can tend to lose flavor after a while but still probably the best flavored soup. You get a choice of 3 different meats: beef, pork and lamb. All three of the meats were good. The beef was marbled and left a buttery taste. It was really good. You can also order rice, vegetables, udon, tofu, and mushrooms. They also offer vegetarian style Shabu. 

The only drawback here is a full stomach and long wait times. Give it a try when you're super hungry!
author: Benjamin C.

description:
Must have meattt!

That was the mentality I had going into Shabu House. Me and my friends just came from a strenuous work out, but some of the lightweights weren't up for paying 30 bucks for all you can eat. If you want all you can eat, everyone in your party must order it.

Me and my friend are both big eaters, but we settled for just a large plate of the kobe beef. We were skeptical of our order filling us up, but we were sure surprised by the end of the meal. We took our time eating, spacing out each bite of meet between bites of veggies. Our side of the table got rice since we are no carb conscious. You gotta have rice with meat, they compliment each other so well.

You get 3 choices of broth to dip your meat and veggies in. Traditional water (sounds like hetch hetchy water to me), chicken ginger broth, and spicy miso. We were afraid the first two would not impart our meat with enough flavor so we picked the latter. Some might go with the traditional water to preserve the pure flavor of meat, but flavored broth is good to drink on its own or to drizzle on rice.

The veggies were clean and looked good, but it would have been nice to get something a little fancier. Napa cabbage is pretty much cheap filler, but tastes good nonetheless. The udon is good and goes well with everything.

With your meal, there are two dipping sauces. One is a vinegary soy sauce and the other was a sesame seed sauce (imagine peanut butter but with sesame). 

At the very end, you get your choice of green tea or red bean ice cream. Both were good, everyone has their own preference so pick what you feel like.

I would like to try their all you can eat/drink meal next time, but if you want to save money, you will be happy with a single order of meat. You will just need to pace your time and let everything set in.
author: David C.

description: Not gonna come back to this shabu house! I would say the food is decent only, service needs to improve (some of the waitress are careless and rude)! $33 for all you eat shabu is not worthy! The worst is this place charged us %15 service for party of two. Sorry to say that those waitress are deserved %15 tips because of their attitude.
author: Mei Y.

description:
It was a dark and stormy night...  (what famed author wrote this?  oh, that's right, Snoopy!)  It was actually a cool, breezy afternoon during lunchtime and, never having tried their original Geary Blvd. location, this was my lunch choice. The restaurant configuration, modernly designed, is interesting as there is no greeting area and the cashier's area is about halfway inside the restaurant.  Noticing that most of the main dining room tables were occupied on a Friday, we chose to sit by the entrance, a wise choice since there was a particularly boisterous (read LOUD) diner already eating there; it is also a lot brighter in front during the day.
Choosing the spicy miso soup base (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/buv-wKDpSL6Iy4_PM1LyMw?select=96xqzeCkWgtqEcvnx6EcgQ), I ordered the large Combination Lamb and Kobe Beef (ten and seven thinly sliced pieces respectively) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/buv-wKDpSL6Iy4_PM1LyMw?select=Niy1lMbyNebgaQ1wnYa4rA) on the lunch menu ($14.49); it included one plate of the mentioned meats and another one comprising of Napa cabbage, cubed firm tofu, spinach, two baby carrots, one fresh shiitake mushroom, and a handful of udon noodles (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/buv-wKDpSL6Iy4_PM1LyMw?select=gCAUw6KMrifbd-2cEP9qZA); I accepted their optional bowl of white rice too.  Then comes the swoosh swooshing, the accompanying sound one makes in wading those meats in the bubbling broth, before flavoring them further with your premixed soy vinegar dipping sauce (mashed garlic, scallions, and reddish ponzu condiment jars to mix in) or peanut sauce.  After this hearty meal, I topped it off with a complimentary scoop of red bean ice cream (green tea ice cream is the other option).
The restaurant is kept very clean, not an easy feat given that the cooking is done in the dining room.  The wait staff were friendly and regularly checked to make sure our needs were met.  How did I like my meal?  The five stars say it all, as well as another two trips in the ensuing two weeks.  Hey, this might be a nice weekly ritual!
author: Mike C.

description:
I'm a really big fan of shabu, so when my cousin and I saw this from the street, we were really excited.

The place is small, but well kept. I think maybe some fans or something can help with the steam since it kinda gets all over the place. But the place overall was really nice and comfortable. 

My cousin and I shared the American Kobe regular with spicy miso. Definitely recommend the spicy miso! There is a sharing fee of $5, but you can get that coved by paying $5 or spending $5 on an appetizer. My cousin and I got the friend shumai and it was really good, plump, and tasty.

The beef was really good quality, and the vegetables and beef and rice were more than enough to fill me and my cousin up! And for dessert, my cousin and I each got our own scoop of ice cream, yumm.

It's pricier than other place I've been too, especially for dinner, so sharing helps. The drink prices are good too. and for "happy hour," you get 15% off your entire bill. Good deal!

I would come back again!
author: Kristine T.

description:
Wait was too long and after one hour wait we still have to sit at the bar. Service was terrible that we didnt even wanna tip them. 

Not going back for sure. Food is not that good anyways.
author: Che K.

description: I like their soup flavor, portions are very good, but the service is probably sub par if not below average. Its always very full so there's a long wait. I always order lamb and beef, their pork isn't as well marbled as the other options. I recommend spicy miso as a soup base. It is very pricey and they include gratuity.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Went here for the first time recently with a few friends we got seated right around 8pm and ordered the all you can eat with drinks. The beer Sapporo was great with some nice hot saki!

The BEEF was fabulous nicely marbled and only need to be dipped into the brother for a very short time to be perfectly cooked it was really nice that it was very thinly sliced the fresh veggies that accompany the beef where great as well. I will definitely be back.
author: Michael W.

description: Foods great but the service sucks. The workers  look at you and don't tend to you. AND on top of that, there is a service charge that is included automatically in the check. Which I don't think is fair because why should I have to pay for your sucky service? Make no sense! Well, eating my red bean ice cream now that's sort of melted from waiting to be served.... Til next time
author: Charlene B.

description: Shabu house is my favorite shabu restaurant. I always get spicy miso (not that spicy) and American style Kobe beef. Large size is very generous with meat. They also give you a side of veggies, udon and a side of rice if you want. Their sauces for dipping are the best I've tried. Service is always fast and attentive. The restaurant is always clean and smells so good haha. At the end of your meal, they offer ice cream (red bean or green tea), which is perfect because I almost always burn my tongue from the hot broth. Ohh, and 15% off on entire bill during happy hour, which is from 5-6pm!!
author: Pauline E.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

0/1 Star: there is some meter parking in the area. If you want a table you're going to need to wait. I just went for the bar seats for a shorter wait of 5 minutes. 
_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: normal waiter service. Feels clean. Nice TVs to watch sports. 
_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

2/3 Stars: good food but nothing stands out from any other place. The green tea ice cream was really good. The serving was just enough to make me content due to the rice. 
_____


Overall Experience
3/5 Stars 

_____

Pictures


_____

Last Words
author: Elliott N.

description:
The services Sucks here. If you're a party of 2 they make you wait forever. And they take a long time to take your order too. The food is good don't get me wrong. But I've been to the other locations and they have better service.
Quick tip: lie and write down you have a party of 3 so you get seat faster.
author: mindy d.

description:
I love love Shabu House and I know that there is usually always a waiting time or a line outside.  However, I never knew the way that they choose to seat their customers.  

The restaurant was full except for one table that could seat 4 people with 2 pots.  My group had three people.  There was no one else waiting except for us.  One of our people was looking for parking so we couldnt be seated yet since our whole party wasnt there. The waitress saw us but she didn't seat us at that table and told us "that table is reserved for groups of 4 people" 

.... there was no one else in line, so why couldn't we get that table? After she told us that, a group of 4 came in and she seated them right away at that table. 

Ridiculous right?!?!? Ugh. we ended up waiting for 30 more minutes until another the same kind of table was finished.  

The waitress ended up seating us there anyways =____= and she told us "I could get into ALOT OF TROUBLE if my manager finds out about this..so you better be nice to me!!! Promise?!" 

lol...*sigh* whatever.  

Besides the seating part, the service was a bit slow and unattentive.   We were seating away from where the waitresses could see us...

I rather go to the one on Geary!!!!
author: Emi K.

description: Never ever come her near closing time. Since there is already a 15% service charge, staff doesn't feel the need to assist customers. Staff member saw me a couple times but took 15 minutes to finally give us some assistance. They act as if they are trying to leave as soon as possible. Imho, this 15% service charge drags down the quality of service as the staff do not have to work for their tip.
author: Adrian G.

description:
This is now my go to hotpot place.  Here's why I give them 5 stars.

Best hot pot meat I've had relative to all other hot pot places I've been
Simple selection: 3 soup base, 3 kinds of meat
Reasonably priced: ~$20 per head with the Regular.
Portion: Regular is just the perfect amount for me.  I personally do not like the all you can eat because overeating is bad and ruins the experience.
Space: Its clean and spacious

The only thing that typically ruins my experience is the wait.  The wait is horrible, it could get very ridiculous.  Make sure to call ahead and confirm a reservation otherwise be prepared to wait 30+ minutes for 2 people.
author: Sai Kiu H.

description:
I'm so happy there's a good shabu place near my house!  I love the ginger chicken broth. It's a nice break away from the shoyu or miso broth at other places. I usually order the American Kobe beef or the pork. Both are sliced and marbled to perfection!  The only reason I knocked a star is because they don't carry chicken, boo. :(  The regular sized portion is super filling as well.  Plus the veggie plate is the biggest I've seen compared to others. 

All the servers are really nice as well and always check up to make sure everything you need is filled or brought. I've never had an issue with waiting for a table, but Friday and Saturday nights are pretty popular. Plus if you come for "happy hour" between 5-6pm you get 15% off the bill!
author: Alli W.

description:
If you haven't tried this place you SHOULD!!

My first visit I wasn't sure what to order. I looked around at others eating to try to figure it out. I had to swallow my pride and ask the server to explain it to me. They were very nice and explained it without making me feel stupid.

Now, I go in and order like a pro and it is soooo Good!
Nothing beats warm soup on a foggy San Francisco day!!! 

They do get busy but always seem to be able to fit us in. Give them a call to see how busy they are or put your name down if there is a wait.

Splash Splash
author: Kris M.

description:
I love shabu shabu! And shabu house is my favorite shabu place =) The soup broths here are much better than the other shabu places (that give you boiling water with one piece of seaweed and call it seaweed soup.) If you can eat more than a large entre + one side plate of meat, then you're better off getting the all you can eat. 
Since I'm pretty fat, I always want to all you can eat. If I'm better off with the all you can eat, then you are too! =P t's 15% off between 5-6pm too!
author: Annie Z.

description: Shabu is fun. Shabu is tasty!  This place gets pretty packed. I took a star off just because the tables are so close to each other I felt like I cant have a conversation with out the ppl on either side of me hearing it.  but still that was some tasty pot.
author: Chelsey G.

description: Love this place. Close to my house. You offer happy hour and the food is consistent. Staff could be more attentive but this place is always packed so I understand its hard to keep up. Love the Kobe beef and spicy miso soup. Yaki nuki is unique and pleasing. Don't change the food! I love it!
author: Rosalyn W.

description: Delicious. First time trying this place. We were visiting for SFSU enrollment and came upon this place. Staff was very friendly but not sure if they added the tip on top of what we gave them. Did not pay attention. After reading the other reviews about that I decided only 4 stars. Adding the tip and not mentioning it is not cool.
author: Susana C.

description:
Don't expect having your name on the waiting list means anything. They will seat people based on party size and table size first regardless of how long you've waited. My girlfriend and I waited 45 + minutes and they continuously sat other people down before us. 

Shabu House would earn a solid 3 Stars but due to the horrible service (yes it's that bad), I knocked off 2 stars.  The food is decent and a great addition to the neighborhood. The Broth was slightly under seasoned but the meat were good quality. Would I ever come again? NO, there are better Shabu options in SF with actual customer service. If time is money, don't waste your time.
author: David N.

description:
Shabu House is my ULTIMATE go-to place for shabu. NOMZ ^_^

PROS:
- I usually order the large beef w/ spicy miso soup - MELT IN MY MOUTH MARBLED GOODNESS
- The girls are wonderful! 
- Veggie plates are NOT sparse like other places .... :X
- Love their green tea ice cream! 
- They have chili flakes if you need more spice in your life

CONS:
- The line is RIDICULOUS on cold nights and during dinner time. Make reservations ahead of time or have a plan B. 

RECOMMEND: Yes, A THOUSAND TIMES YES.  If you think Shabu House is on the pricier side I suggest you come in during lunch or from 5-6PM. Cheaper meals and you don't have to deal with the dinner crowd (;
author: Kriz K.

description:
I've said it many times and I'll say it again, I am constantly surprised and pleased by how many excellent restaurants are nestled in the Outer Sunset. The line out the door is indicative of what you'll find here, so be a good adult; make a reservation and arrive on time! 

Like me. With a reservation on the books and in the door by 6pm, I was in full popular restaurant mode. Sadly, the rest of my party was not. Having underestimated Golden Gate traffic by approximately 40 minutes, I was absorbing high-octane stink-eye glances and vulture-like expressions from the poor saps waiting at the door. After 10 minutes, myself (and the staff) couldn't take it any longer, so I sacrificed the two empty seats next to me at the bar. That said, the staff was super accommodating despite the absence of my party. I was offered drinks and appetizers, and I was able to keep my seat at the bar. It was a fantastic aspect of their customer service that I really appreciated. 

After my stragglers arrived, we were offered a table quick-smart. The food was excellent - obviously fresh and prepared with care. I had never tried Shabu before, so a short instruction would have been appreciated, but I guess the idea is simple enough! Along with the meat, you receive a heaping platter of veggies, tofu, and noodles. Something about having the raw ingredients in front of you, and just nuking them in broth for a few seconds makes for a fresh, straight up "real food" meal. You know exactly what you're eating, and it feels good. 

Here's to more Shabu adventures!
author: Chelsea B.

description: The beef is soooooo delicious. Pork was too fatty though so should have stuck with beef all night. Otherwise everything was bomb and I want to come back asap.
author: Shawna C.

description:
Kudos and a lot of props to the two younger servers! My family and I came on a busy Sunday night and you can tell that these ladies really hustled. They kept a friendly attitude all the while trying to cater to us and the other tables there. There was an elder waitress there but she mostly floated around and wasn't as attentive. Sorry to say. 

The food was great! The Kobe beef looks and tastes amazing. The marbling will make you drool. But! The hidden gem here is the lamb. One of the better place that I've tried for lamb and would go back just for it. As mentioned with the other reviews, the all-you-can-eat option here is strict. It requires the whole table to order it and there's a 2hr limit. My family and I ordered a couple of the large plates instead and that was enough for us. 

All in all, Shabu House has delicious food and good service. Just remember that there might be a bit of a wait time but they're trying :D
author: Kevin B.

description:
I've been waiting till the day Shabu was going to be on Ocean ever since I found out they were opening one near me. 


A few days after the grand opening, my boyfriend and I drove to see if anyone was here (we don't like being the only ones in the restaurant lol). There were a few people but my first impression was that it was small. Sort of reminded me of the Geary location. We always get the spicy miso and a regular mixed lamb/beef. Tell me why that filled us both up. I always wonder should I get the large or the all you can eat plate but regular should be fine. If you go here from 5-6pm, you get 15% your entire bill. The people here are really nice and I love how close it is to me. No more going to the one in Burlingame now.
author: Janice V.

description: This is my all time favorite place to go to. Despite the long line sometimes it's always nice to get some warm soup like food during SF weather because it's always so bipolar. I never like to wait if there's more than 2 groups of people waiting but I usually go there around 5:30-6 when it's less empty. Also 5-6 they have a promotion of 20% off I think. The beef here is always usually fresh and so are the veggies. The TV is always playing some sort of sport and the music here is modern and set to the volume where you can slightly hear it but you can talk at the same time.
author: Sul L.

description:
Review for Feb 2012:

Overall taste was okay, but definitely overpriced. Will not be returning. 

Portions were extremely small considering we would get twice as much elsewhere of equal quality.
author: Gabriel C.

description: Fast service nice set up you cook your own food selections from the middle of the table, down in other place but this was my first time experiencing this . The food was great staff was nice , I would go back when I am in San francisco again.
author: Kyle H.

description:
Came in on a busy Sunday night with a friend.  Some folks didn't show up as names were called out.  Luckily we barely waited and got 2 seats at the counter, which were perfect. 
Went with the All you can eat, spicy miso soup, and for the choice of meat, nothing but kobe beef all the way baby.
My 3rd time having shabu and it's always a treat.  The servers were nice and cute.  I give them a lot of props and kudos since it was super busy that evening.  They were non stop back and forth.  It took a while to get some things but they were multitasking like crazy so it's understandable.  

All you can eat is definitely the way to go if you can eat more than one plate of meat.  
Felt sorry for some of the people waiting outside, which must have been a good while.   Seems like there were some folks in there before we came and still there after we left.

Had a good time chilling with a friend at the counter, and killing the plates of meat.  Finished with some red bean ice cream.
author: Raymond C.

description:
Having this place so close to where I live has been such a waste. I've known about it forever now, but never gave it a shot. First, I just never craved shabu or any sort of hot pot. And second, I never realized how misguided I was in thinking that shabu just wasn't my thing. My experience at Shabu House flipped my world upside down on that one!

We came here on a Friday night at around 630pm-ish on recommendation from a friend who, at one point, got Shabu House once every week for like 5 weeks. I trusted her as a hot pot guru and still kind of hesitantly agreed to go as my other friend wanted to try. I'm really glad we did though! It was just so good/fun!

The spot was pretty bumpin', and as a party of 2, we were able to snag the last table in the house. Lucky! There's a decent amount of seating, but it fills up quick! So be aware! There are multiple locations too, but the Ocean one was most convenient for us. Just a testament to how popular Shabu House is around here. We were not disappointed!

There were a good amount of options here for all-you-can-eat, we didn't really think of doing anything else. We went with the $31/person all-you-can-eat option. If we were trying to get our drank on, for $42/person, they offer all-you-can-drink too, which I think would've been a sweet deal! Maybe next time.

Spicy Miso broth is what we decided on. Shabu House doesn't have those pots with the dividers (like at Little Sheep Hot Pot), so we couldn't do a half regular, half spicy broth kinda thing just to try the other broths. We both like spicy, so that wasn't much of a downer. Broth was great! Not too spicy of a base, but you can throw in chili flakes/oil to your heart's content if you're into that! 

As for the meats/vegetables, they have pork, beef, and lamb. I was the biggest fan of the beef, I thought it as nice and juice/fatty the way I like it and I just could not stop eating. However, it depends on the cut you get, as the first round we had was the best. The follow up plates were more lean (not a bad thing), but still very delicious. The lamb and pork was also tasty, but it probably boils (haha) down to personal preference on that one! As for the plates of veggies (spinach, mushrooms, tofu, other hotpot veggie essentials, etc.), they were kind of what you expect when it comes to Shabu (I would think).

Dipping sauces. I was in love with the peanut-y sauce they have. I thought it went really well with the beef and all the other meats. It was wonderful. They also had a soy sauce/vinegar kind of dipping sauce that was nice too! 

Shabu House was great, it brings a fun vibe and isn't too bad in terms of price for all-you-can-eat! I like the individual pots at each table and attentive waitresses there too! Oh, and they give you a choice of red bean/green tea ice cream to end your meal. We both went with green tea and it was a nice touch! Definitely recommend Shabu House for great hot pot in SF!
author: Jason T.

description:
PARTY OF 9!!

I live off of Ocean so the opening of this location is prime time. 

Ordered a bunch of Shabu shabu plates, few beers, and i had to get some yaki niku. 

The Food was tasty, the broth not spicy enough, but whatever. Goo vegis and tofu. 

The Yaki Niku was very flavorful, and though more meat would have been awesome, the serving was large enough. Not a fan of the ice crea at the end. But with good ambiance, 2 large TVs to watch the play offs, and some not too shabby waitresses. 

4/5 BAM!
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Came here with a friend from out of town and a couple - i think we all enjoyed our early dinner.  Good portions of both meat and vegetables.  We ordered kobe, pork and lamb which were all tasty and fresh.  The lamb is not too gamey/gamy.  The kobe is adequately marbled.

Tidbits: the server never checked back on us until the time we needed our check.  The place was warm/hot even before the shabu's on (we were one of the first customers) - maybe they can adjust the temp so as not to spoil the meat?


Overall experience was great and if I just live close by, I would keep coming back here.
author: Trisha M.

description:
While the food here is really good, our experiences here have not been great. Three stars for the food but no more due to the experience. 

The most recent visit, there were three of us. It was pretty busy and when they called our names to be seated, they told us we were going to be seated at a two-seater even thought there were three of us (1 man and 2 women). I asked if this was our only option and they said yes. So would they not serve us if we asked for a larger table? That seems to have been the implication even though we waited over an hour for a table. The other female and I sat on the cushioned side of the table; good thing we are moderately small. The technique of getting food from the hot pot was a bit of a game if arm "twister" though. It also wasn't nice that the ac above one of the seats kept driving water. 

We ordered a large beef to share. Later we ordered a second plate. We were not aware that there is a splitting fee of $5 a person and the waitress did not educate us on their rules until our second round. We've been here plenty if times but never knew this rule. Since there were three of us, we we're suppose to order three plates. I am currently pregnant in my first trimester and unable to eat full meals still because of regularly getting sick. Shabu sits well with my stomach but I don't eat a full adult portion size. It was so disappointing to find out we would be charged extra just because I decided to come out to dinner and didn't want a plate of my own. How do they manage having families with children dine in? We could have just ordered three regulars instead and had more veggies!!!

The waitresses were nice but the experience was not fun. I would suggest that there be a better plan for when three people decide to dine together as well as better communication from the waitresses when extra fees are included in style of dining. 

Advice: If you want to come on a busy night, apparently they accept reservations.
author: Andy M.

description: I love this place. Sometimes the service is a hit or miss, but the food is always consistence. I like when the meat slices are cut thin.
author: Shauna f.

description: Forget everything you think you like! Shabu has changed my life. It's my most favorite restaurant in San Francisco. I'm glad they have several locations. The menu is so simple, but so delicious!
author: Maeve C.

description:
Shabu House has excellent meat! I had the beef and lamb which were of great quality and were very tasty. I loved the ponzu sauce and my favorite of the veggies were the enoki mushrooms. If you plan to shabu, your table and food is set up pretty much as soon as you order since you will be cooking your own food. 

The restaurant is very clean and service is friendly and prompt. Only thing during my visit was that the wait staff was quite young and I thought they could have been a bit more professional with how they acted in the restaurant/presented themselves to customers. Also, if you sit on the seating along the wall, the seat is far from the table so you have to sit uncomfortably on the edge of your seat to shabu.

Yet, anytime you are craving something warm and tasty and ya don't mind putting in a little work, pay a visit to Shabu House.
author: Maya S.

description:
I wrote this review because of you Amy... Yes you the wonderful waitress. I come to this shabu because you have top notch service. 

I always go to this shabu because she knows me and Wendy by name. She knows what we like and she is always courteous. We always have our birthday parties here with all of our friends. I like to come here and watch basketball or Sunday night football. 

The food is delicious especially their Kobe beef and vegetable platter. And I love your peanut sauce that $hit is CRACKING!! See you next weekend shabu house.
author: Ronald G.

description:
Our group of 3 had a great time here. On a weekday night, we arrived at 6:30 and got a table right away. We chose 2 broths - the spicy miso and ginger chicken. Loved both of them.

One person ordered the vegetarian and it was heaps of fresh cabbage, spinach, mushrooms, and tofu. He loved it.  Could not eat it all.

We also had 2 meat eaters that ordered the lamb and beef. One person ordered the regular size dinner and it was PLENTY of food. The other eater ordered the extra meat order and he was very happy with the size of the meat that came.

The ONLY thing i would love for them to add would be the scoopers I had when I had Shabu Shabu in Japan. That way, your own personal chopsticks never go into the communal broth and it is easier to fish out the small things like tofu.

I thought it was yummy and unique since we don't have any Shabu where I live!
author: Amanda M.

description:
There's a shabu place off Ocean Avenue...

If you've been to one Shabu House, then you know the drill.  Same menu and same prices.  Get the spicy miso soup and half lamb/half beef. And to top it off literally 1 scoop of either green tea or red bean ice cream.

I like the location of this place with plenty of street parking.  I still like the Burlingame location one more because it's bigger and has better ventilation.  Plus the meat cuts seems more marbled than the one here.

Sure I'll come back here if I don't want to drive down to Burlingame or up to the Geary location. The customer service was ok -it's pretty simple: order, they'll bring you the food, and then the bill.
author: Elliot Y.

description:
There is no words to describe this delicious hot pot place. Every time I hear, "What do you want for dinner, Kayla?" my response is immediately "SHABBBBBU!" 
Not even joking, for a 13 year old, this hot pot is incredible. Like even one of the waitresses already knows what I want and serves a table already for me! First of all, the meat is FANTASTIC its so fresh and tasty. Although, the only red flag is that the building is extremely tiny, which means its always packed. Besides the packed, the meat is really delicious and fresh. The broth just waters your mouth, making you want more and more! Overall, this is one of the top favorites, also I love the waitresses since they are extremely sweet. Only one flaw, is that it takes a bit long if you want another plate of fresh, tasty, delicious, meat.
Just by looking inside, it grabs your eyes and shoves you in the house of Shabu.
author: Kayla C.

description:
#Wait time#
Got there on a Saturday evening around 6, so there was no wait then. But I did notice that the line started to form around 6:30, so be sure to make reservations or get there early enough to skip the line.

#Menu#
The soup options are water, ginger chicken and spicy miso. They also have half-and-half pots, so it is very popular to get half ginger chicken and half spicy miso. The spicy miso can get a bit spicy if cook veggies in it, but if it is just used on meat, it taste pretty mild.
All combinations include veggies, noodles, tofu and one or two kinds of meat which is pork, beef or lamb. Two portions are available, standard or large. The standard is slightly larger than Shabuway's, since the price is a little higher. They also have an all you can eat option, in case you have a big appetite.
Dessert is complimentary. They have green tea and red bean flavored ice cream.

#Tips#
15% off if order during happy hour which is 5-6pm everyday.
author: Weijia L.

description: This chain is still one of the best shabu shabu places to indulge at.  They just did a renovation here which is very clean and modern.  It's clean and stylish like the other locations I've been to in SF and Burlingame.  The service is consistently attentive.  The quality of meat and vegetables is YUM.  We got the all you can eat and just had Kobe beef the entire time although you can have lamb or pork too. They give you shitake mushroom, enoki mushrooms, carrots, tofu, spinach and napa cabbage for veggies, but they will serve you whichever you prefer.  They have a Happy Hour from 5-6 which means 15% off your order.  That's nice if you'd like to have a drink but not go big for the all you can eat and drink.  I like this location and intend on returning.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
My girlfriend and I came in on a random weekday to try the all you can eat with spicy miso soup.

Food: 2/5
The soup was pretty good, they were really generous with the veggies, and our first platter of American Kobe was soo good, super tender and fresh. Our second and third rounds of meat were frozen, old, dry, and rubbery. Definitely not the same as the first. I thought maybe they brought out lamb instead, but they insisted it was beef. We would've gone for a 4th round, but we decided to get dessert somewhere else to salvage the last part of our meal instead.

Service: 0/5
Overall, they were pretty inattentive (bringing a strainer after our meal, taking forever to bring things out despite there only being a few tables, etc.). We actually saw a man cut the meat in a room, leave, and had to wait for some girl to finish channeling her inner Anna Kendrick and her horrible rendition of the cup song to deliver my meat. My friend and I were left to watch for a good 5 minutes or so until she finished practicing so that we could ask for the bill. Not cool.
author: Vi-Ann L.

description: this location is pretty small. we were a party of eight and arrived for happy hour on reservation of course. it all started out real nice. the meat and side dishes are really fresh. the service is kind of lacking especially when theres a time limit of 2hrs to eat all you can. we would ask for things and nothing happens so time is ticking. you cant get all you can eat when service is forgetful or slow for a party of eight in 2hrs. anyways our server was a very nice gal but when it was time to pay the bill another gal was rude cause she wanted us to pay ASAP and when we didnt have money ready she got nasty and rude saying they have another party that was waiting for our table and needed us to pay already. we didnt do it on purpose to not have the money ready, we were just enjoying each others company cause we havent seen each other for a long time. shit we were a party of eight they got good money from us. very disappointing!
author: H L.

description:
Mmmm... I busted my Shabu Shabu cherry here a few days after my birthday and I looooove it!

First time I came here I didn`t know what to order... or what to do at all, so I got the $41 all you can eat and drink (beer) What was bad about that was that I rarely drank my beer and I only ate one plate of beef. Also at that time I was so hungry and didn`t pace myself like I should, my stomach was regretting it after :( I didn`t even have room for more, so it was not worth it.

I came back here a few weeks after, and this time I was prepared and I knew what to expect this time. This time I managed to eat more then I did last time, by taking my time and spacing out my veggies, food, and udon I ate.

I really really would love to come back, I`m so addicted now :)
author: Johanah I.

description:
I went here for dinner. We had the all you can eat meal with the spicy miso broth. I was completely stuffed after having a plate beef, lamb and veggies. The meats tasted very fresh. The green tea ice cream was good too but I wish the scoop was a little bigger. 

The wait can be long to get a table. Service was a little slow. The plates of sliced meat took a long time to come out. The place gets very humid inside from all the hot pots boiling away.
author: Alexander L.

description:
I've been meaning to try this chain out for a while. I am not a shabu shabu expert, not have I tried the other location. This review is purely based on first impressions. 

We made a reservation for a Friday night by calling a few days in advance. It gets packed, so I highly recommend it. They ended up mixing up our reservation, but then again how crazy it was to have A Winny reservation for four at 8pm twice on the books! The place is spacious and has ample seating. 

When you walk in, there's really no reception. But you do get a great view of the chef slicing the delicious and well marbled Kobe beef. 

This place isn't cheap, but normal for most shabu shabu places I am told. $17 for the basic large combo plate, $31 for AYCE and $41 for AYCD. 

The meat (beef and lamb) are both delicious and so tender. We did a combo broth of spicy miso with herbal chicken. Soooo yummy. I had a full bowl of soup after we were done. 

The only complaint I have aside from the cost to food ratio is the scattered service. The girls were very nice, but I can't help but think they could be more organized and have more of a service plan. It was super hard to flag them during our meal, so order up front.
author: Winny F.

description:
Dear Shabu House,

I love coming to all your locations on a whim when I get my shabu craving but you make it so difficult to just walk-in. I was secretly hoping that you wouldn't accept bigger parties of 10 and up at your newest location (Ocean Ave.) considering it is a much smaller place but to my disappointment you still did. I can't really wait an hour to get seated and then another 20 mins. on a weeknight to get served food. It's just way too much. I hope one day there will be a specific area in your locations  for walk-ins like me.
author: J M.

description: AUTOMATIC 15% Service Charge which means the TIP is included. I got thrown off by that charge but they highlight it so you know. The food is excellent. The service is excellent. Water service could be more frequent. The large was good, I think all you can eat would have been worth it too, depending on how hungry you are. I like this place a lot. Only thing missing would be a sauce bar like little sheep.
author: Jane S.

description:
I am a Shabu House fanatic.

Yes, I have, on a couple extreme occasions, eaten at Shabu House for four meals in one week, but even I, like fellow Yelpers, have passed up a Shabu House opportunity here and there to avoid the half hour search for parking on Geary or the trek out to Bgame.  Well, from here on out (or at least until everyone else catches on), all Shabu House opportunities will be seized, as a new location opened up less than a week ago on Ocean Ave!

Same Shabu House feel (hooray for the bar seats, albeit limited at only five), menu, and taste, minus the crowds (for now!).  Also, my fav meat slicer, Keiji, can be spotted here! 

One area of improvement?  Though friendly, our waitress could have been a bit more proactive (we were constantly asking of her rather than her checking on us), but if this Shabu House is anything like its sister locations, I'm sure she'll get the hang of things in no time.
author: Mel T.

description:
I was very excited to come to this restaurant and when we arrived my group of 6 put our name down as went outside to wait, it seemed pretty busy but we were willing and eager! After waiting about half hour the waitress told us it would only be about 15 more minutes, after waiting another half hour we went inside to ask and she told us she had given our table away to a group after us and it would be another 15 minutes!!! 
Horrible service! We would have been more than willing to wait if we weren't promised a table and then to give it to another group that showed up way after us!!! I was really looking forward to this place but now I won't be returning ever! Good job losing a customer!
author: Erin C.

description:
Came here few times with some friends
The food was GREAT!!! Love the 15% off happy hour (5-6)
I don't mind coming back here again!
author: Rena Y.

description:
Swish swish. Yum Yum.

The name shabu shabu is an onomatopoeia of the sound of the meat and other ingredients swishing in the hot pot.  It is also a super yummy dish that does require some effort on your part to get the meal cooked.

I love shabu.  If I'm in the mood for meat, it's one of my favorite foods to get and the Shabu House on Ocean is one of my favorite places to get it. I think it's the spicy miso broth that really gets me. It's so flavorful and makes everything that goes in the pot taste delicious.  Shabu House is also nice because you can choose between beef or lamb for your meat selection.  

The prices are really reasonable for both food and drink.  If you come hungry, there is an all you can eat option for I think around $30. Although you might have to wait for a table, the wait here is not nearly as bad as the Shabu House on Geary, so be thankful for small miracles.  

One tip - when they come around to let you know that the kitchen is closing and it is last call, that also means last call for drinks.  Don't get stuck without enough beer and sake to finish your meal!
author: Rebecca H.

description:
It's no secret that I love shabu and -- even more than that -- that I love Shabu House. I've been a loving patron of the Geary location for a while because simply put, their sauces are so on point and their ayce is fantastic quality at an excellent price. Other places will have beef that literally disintegrates upon cooking, slices that are too thin, or freezer burned/old beef BUT NOT HERE! Seriously, gotta get the beef plate.

I'm so happy that my little sister introduced me to this location, which is both newer than the Geary store AND less crowded. Go figure. 

The ayce is the only way to go and honestly, if I could, I'd eat shabu house for every meal. :) It's THAT good. (Bring some tums though...pounds of meat = unhappy tummy)
author: Debra L.

description:
We love this place!!! It's fun and interactive  some people hate the fact that you cook your own food but it's pretty fun. I love their potstickers.  One plate of meat and veggies is enough for two people. It's actually a lot of food. 

I often crave shabu house. Only thing is the wait is always forever!!
author: Katerina K.

description: AYCE is worth it if you're hungry. Service was fast and polite. We had 2 1/2 beef platters, 1 pork platter and 3 veggie platters. Beef was very good. Veggies were fresh as well. We started with the the Ginger Chicken broth. Soup at the end was delicious. Will come again and highly recommend it. Popular place gets very crowded.
author: Cheryl W.

description:
Shabu House is pretty good for the price, portions, proximity to our house, and street parking (typically available).  There are a lot of other places that offer similar food in the area, but this place is one of our go to spots for the reasons above.  

We typically get the regular size plates of beef, but if we're hungry we'll get larges.  Haven't done the all you can eat in a long time, but probably couldn't get my money's worth now anyway.

Sometimes the wait is 10 or 15 minutes and others over 30 minutes on busy nights, so be ready.
author: Erick L.

description:
Service is OK, nothing special or extraordinary. Food is great!!! I lalalala love eating here!!! 

My choices:

Spicy miso soup
Kobe beef/Lamb
Sesame (peanut) sauce (mmmm yumm!!)
Veggies
Green Tea Ice Cream

I wish they had brown rice.
author: Maria Gracielle Y.

description:
I LOVE this new location!

I always go to the one on Geary but due to long waits, lack of parking and once they started diluting the spicy miso more, my hubby and I started going here shortly after classes started at CCSF, as it was more convient to get to the highway after.

So far, I've been here three times and each time the food, in particular, the spicy miso broth have been consistently good. The girls who work there, namely the two I always happen to see on the evenings/weekends we go, are extremely friendly and attentive and already know what we love. (BTW, thanks for my extra large scoop of green tea ice cream yesterday at lunch, it really hit the spot!)

Anyway, I will probably be frequenting this location more from now on and you should give it a try too! (No wait, eh..on second thought, I don't really want to share it with you anyway, as that would mean risking not have a secured spot at the bar every time.)
author: Petra S.

description:
Love AYCE Shabu Shabu! but when I come here I just order their large plates. 

I use to work across the street from this place and before they use to serve RAMEN! I love this place cuz I can always find Free parking, there's also the option of Meter Parking that's right out in the front. I get off work early, so I usually make it to their HH which is %15 off before 6pm! I love how they have two options, you can order a Regular or Large, besides AYCE or AYCE and drink, also for meat choices there's Lamb, American Style Kobe Beef, Kurobuta pork or my Fav which is combination of your choice of two meats! But I usually stick with Kobe, I've tried their lamb and Pork, it's pretty good and fresh.

I've tried their Ginger Broth on days when I'm not feeling well, but I usually stick with Spicy Miso and it's perfect for taste not watery. They also offer two dipping sauce one is creamy peanut sauce and the other is kinds like lime Ponzu sauce, but not too salty. Beside the meat selection they also offer a good portion of veggies and rice, but I prefer just their Chewy Udon if cooked right. This is place is clean and cozy, I like to come here with my friends or coworkers (best 2-4 people), the service is attentive, except when it gets really packed like sat or sunday nights then yeah there's a wait.
author: Mel L.

description:
I do admit that I try to come here on a weekly basis, but the reason why I do try to make it here so often is because the food is good, the customer service is outstanding & this location has good parking compared to the other locations. 

     My regular order consists of:
           -Gyoza
           -Large beef & lamb combo
           -Spicy miso soup
           -Green tea ice cream

   Although I usually get my regular order the majority of the time, all of the other items I have ordered has not disappointed. Everything is delicious.
author: K Y.

description:
Service was slow to the point where you're wondering if the workers are waiting til the food already in your stomach will take on liquid and bloat you so that you won't order so much meat, thus saving them money. Cuz they are quick to bring out the veggies, so...?
I mean, I see them slicing the frozen meats in the back but they are slooooow.
It's 31 bucks for all you can eat. I don't think it was worth it, honestly. The broth was good, the meat was ok for frozen stuff, and they have a pretty good sized list of sake. But I still don't think it's worth $31.
I think I'll go for hotpot on Clement next time. At least you can order apps or cooked items with your AYCE.
One small highlight was that their free ice cream with AYCE, though tiny tiny tiny as it was, was pretty good. The green tea one.
author: Karen C.

description:
All you can eat shabu is pretty awesome. I came here with my girlfriends and we had a great time. Servers were super nice and refilled our water when needed and asked if we wanted more when our dishes were close to being finished. Our table had 2 pots and there were 4 of us. The table was perfectly sized where everything we wanted was with in reach. I love the peanut sauce! I think it tasted great with everything. Writing this review makes me hungry!

We all left with a food babies. I am sure most people who eat here will leave with food babies too!

Very good location and parking is awesome! Price is reasonable. For the all you can eat dinner was $39/person (tax, and tips included)
author: Tiffany C.

description: Not much different from the one on Geary.  Great meat, great sides, and great broth.  This is just the one I prefer to go to now cause it's closer to my place.  There's more parking.  And I'm always able to get a table here without waiting.
author: Karen L.

description:
One of the best Shabu places in that isn't in freakin sunset or Richmond. Came here last week for happy hour and ordered the all you can eat because it's shabu, it's the only way to go. It makes absolutely no sense to just get one large plate and veggies..........or so I thought. The meat came out in a huge plate and there were like 40 pieces in a plate. It took me forever just to finish that one plate and I thought I was going to give up but my pride wouldn't let me just tap out so I ordered another plate. The second plate was just equally as big. "Why did I just do that? I'm so stupid". I thought to myself. Once again it took me forever just to kill that one plate and then the waitress came by and asked "more meat"?. I was so full and I couldn't possibly eat another piece of meat let alone an entire plate so I looked up at the waitress and said "yes please".  What is wrong with me?!? I was so full that I literally confused myself and stupidly ordered another plate. I killed the 3rd plate with ease actually so it wasn't too bad.

The meat is great quality, one of the best meat I've had eating Shabu. The broth was OK and just had enough flavor but people just dip their meat into their sauce anyways so it didn't matter. The sauce was normal, just like any other shabu place. I also loved the decor of the place. It looks welcoming and they stuck to a theme which was really nice. Will definitely come back here .
author: Will C.

description:
So my roommate and I checked out SH a few weeks ago. (Friday night)

A combination of the patrons, service, price and food quantity and quality (or lack of) leaves more to be desired.

This place caters to the younger folks (college kids or ragers who like happy hour/alcohol) so it is very loud. With that said, we placed our names on the waiting list and sat patiently for about 30 minutes. No worries here.  The wait and crowd gave me the impression that this place was pretty good. 

They seated us next to a couple. The girlfriend was mugging me the whole time while the guy was mad-dogging my roommate. We were like, wth? Oh well, kids.....you know how they get when you plow them with some alcohol.

In reviewing the menu, I saw there were numbers by the portions.  I thought it denoted ounces but it turned out to be number of pieces. Instantly, I was skeptical thinking "It doesn't say how large the pieces are." We both ordered the large.

My roommate wanted the spicy miso broth but I wanted the traditional kombu. Since they don't do 50/50, we settled on the kombu. Also, the kombu will allow us to taste the food where the miso will mask any issues.

The meat was OK, not kobe-level good, and expensive.  Shabu Way Angus (their cheapest cut) was waaaaay better than SH's Kobe (which is their entry level cut). Their veggie portions are tiny too.

Imagine our disappointment with the food while the table next to us was staring us down the entire time. We would have moved tables but we couldn't get the waitress' to unfocus her attention from the party table of drunk guys (and one girl) five feet away. Oh boy. SOB. FSOB. Damn. I had to get up and stand in front of our waitress to pay the bill!! If they didn't want us to pay, they should have told us so.

All in all, we paid about $50 for dinner without alcohol or accompaniments and got Jack-in-the-Box on the way home.
author: Chibi F.

description:
When comparing Shabu House to Little Sheep Mongolian Hot Pot, I would definitely choose Little Sheep! I recently had dinner here to celebrate a friend's birthday - we had a large party of 9 people. Our server was extremely patient and attentive. One of the people in our group had some food allergies and she made sure to accommodate to his needs. 

The food itself was above par. I enjoyed having two dipping sauces for my food and the choice of veggies. I got the American Kobe beef with the spicy miso broth. All in all, the food was good, but not worth the price. The broth at Little Sheep is definitely one of a kind, which can not be said about Shabu House. The best part of my dinner was the dessert! The red bean ice cream was extremely delicious! Sadly, after dinner, all of us were still hungry afterwards! Some of us even went to Burger King LOL! I definitely do not want to be paying for an expensive dinner and getting Burger King after!
author: Victoria M.

description: I only ever come here for lunch on a weekday so I can skip the long wait during other times. A regular portion of meat is filling enough for me while a large portion pushes me slightly over the edge. The Kobe beef is simply awesome in the spicy miso broth. I try hard not to drink all the broth after I finish my meat and veggies, but it is very tempting. I love that I can top off the meal with a scoop of green tea or red bean ice cream. Overall, it's a reasonable price for what you get.
author: Susana T.

description: If I could give one star, I would. We had reservations here tonight and we arrived 5 minutes early. Once we got there, we were told no table was ready for us. We waited for 15 minutes, but still no table. No apologies from the staff at all. No point in making reservations at all! We left and ended up eating at a restaurant next door.
author: Rena S.

description: Really enjoy the shabu here. The kobe beef is really good and make this one of my favorite restaurants in the city. This location is a little out of the city, which is great for parking and getting away from usual traffic. Service is fast, tables are clean, food is great. Wait can get a little long so make reservations!
author: David D.

description: Wonderful service even with a large group, we were given plenty of attention and recommendations. I've had Shabu Shabu many places in Asia and this is pretty authentic for the Korean and Japanese versions. I brought a group of Japanese nationals here and they said it was like being home in Tokyo. Highly recommended if you're in the area
author: Nick S.

description:
This hidden gem restaurant in the quiet neighborhood of Lakeside is a must try if you are hungry for some healthy food, doesn't matter if it is for meats or veggies.  

We were hungry and ordered the "All You Can Eat" from the menu for $31 per person. 

Our reservation was at 5 PM.  When we get there, our table with ice water, dipping sauces, and all the utensil settings were ready and waiting for us.  That impressed me.  Haven't came across too many restaurants recently still doing that.

We started our meal with ample portion of veggies, lot of tofu, mushrooms and udon (round rice noodle).  Our initial meal order was 2 orders of beef, 1 order of pork and half an order of lamb.  It was a nice start.  The meats took a while to come but they were thinly sliced and delicious.

Words of caution, the art of eating Shabu is that only cook the amount of meat that you are going to eat immediately. I only cook one piece of meat at a time. They get cooked fast, within seconds.  Don't over cook for best tasting.

Among the dipping sauces, both the sesame and the ponzu (light soy sauce and vinegar like) were great, easy in adding the minced garlic which was very powerful and the odor/taste lingered.

My favorite broth was the ginger chicken in comparing to the spicy miso.   We ordered both in a split pot which was a good idea so we can sample both.

The only other suggestion that I have is that if you are in a hurry, order your additional meats in advance because they come relatively slow compare to others.

The Red Bean Ice Cream which came with the All You Can Eat is a pleasant delight.

Overall, the whole "Shabu" experience was great and satisfying.  Four of us still can converse and enjoy our meal at the same time without raising our voice to overcome noises.
author: Thomas L.

description:
SURPRISE 15% SERVICE CHARGE the second time I came!!!!!!!!!!  

So the first time I came with my two girlfriends was about a few weeks ago. The food was great and the service was great but recently when I came with my little sister they charged us with a 15% SERVICE CHARGE!!! They didn't do that when I came her with my two girlfriends the first time but since I came with my little sister they probably assumed that we didn't have enough money to pay to some bullsh*t like that. I research online on restaurant service charges and it said it was all based on the server and who they choose to give the service charge to and who not too. I was very not happy about that. 

I'm sorry it is your job to serve people if you work at a restaurant. If you do a good job at serving you will receive a good tip but when you want to charge a service fee on people they aren't going to want to tip you or tip you less then they had original plan too.
author: Kavin G.

description:
This is just an a-okay Shabu House. It was a cold night and I was craving something hot and on the soup-side. Place is clean, tables are spacious and 

The service is pretty mediocre, the waitress seemed confused half the time. We decided to order 3 large meat dishes to share amongst us four, but they have this odd policy that everyone has to order something. Lame. So we "ordered" a side of edamame. You might have gained 3 dollars but you peeved off four customers. 

Service is slow, we have to raise our hands every time we needed anything. 

The soups that they provide, miso and ginger are too diluted and the ginger just tasted like chicken broth and we had to add so much seasoning into it. The miso tasted like its from the package you can get at 99 Ranch. For the money I spent, not worth it. I probably will not come back. 

If you do come here I recommend the lamb over the beef.
author: Amy L.

description: Seriously, service was spotty.  Food wasn't abundant. Won't be back.
author: Jinny K.

description: I love this place. I'm not sure if they take reservations or not but the only downside was the long wait. I love the spicy miso broth. Since I tend to lean towards vegetarian dishes this was perfect for me and my carnivorous partner. His was loaded with very tender meat and mine had great fresh vegetables. I can't wait to go back.
author: Diane M.

description:
Very solid shabu house. My friend and I shared a large beef and pork combo with the spicy miso broth and it was the perfect amount of food. I definitely recommend using all of the condiments provided - chopped green onions, minced garlic, hot sesame oil, a sweet soy-like sauce that I'm forgetting the name of, and peanut sauce. As far as I'm aware, the best way to do it is mix a dollop of peanut sauce and a dash of the sweet soy stuff into a small bowl of the broth, and then transfer the cooked veggies and meat into that bowl before eating them. Despite sharing an entree (the large is a lot of food, so I'm not sure if they really expect one person to eat it all) they gave us each a bowl of rice and a scoop of ice cream to finish off the meal! We almost turned the ice cream down because we were so full, but the waitress pointed out that it's included/free so we tried it - one scoop red bean flavor, one scoop green tea. They were both interesting to try, but not my favorite.

We were seated quickly after arriving at 5:30, and by the time we left at 6:30 it was packed with a big line, so like anywhere good, definitely come early if you don't want to wait!

Good service, great food, good prices, great experience.
author: Chris M.

description:
I love shabu! 
I always get kobe beef & spicy miso broth. 
 I get full off of the large portion--so I rarely do the all you can eat option.  

I would have given 5 stars because of how much I enjoy shabu, but I deducted one star because of my last experience here.  We were a group of four on a Monday.  There was a small wait, which I didn't mind.  My name was up next on the list, we were waiting on our other two friends, but all the tables were still occupied.  The server came up to me and told me she'll only hold my table for 5 minutes.  What table? There were no free tables.  We even waited another 10 minutes after the whole party arrived.  I found that a little rude that she said that when no tables were even available yet, but I brushed it off.  

We were seated in the corner by the door.  I couldn't tell who was our server--but more than once, we felt like they forgot about us.  They definitely need more servers, or at least a busser to clear tables and help with little tasks so the servers could focus on their customers.
author: Abby M.

description:
Sat at the counter and ordered the lamb w/ the spicy miso. Lamb slices were tender and fresh as was their beef. Enjoyed the ice cream at the end of my meal too! 

Nice thing about sitting at the counter is that you get your own pot and that no one else gets the chance to steal your meat! I love my shabu so when I have to share a pot with the bf it means that my food gets stolen from me! Beware though, this place gets busy and the staff tends to forget about customers sitting at the counter. It's a lot more difficult to flag them down since you're not in their line of sight. I reminded them about getting my bowl of rice TWICE and was close to finishing my meal before I finally got it.

Other than their slow service, this place is great and I'd recommend coming here on a cold night.
author: C Y.

description:
My go to place when I need a quick shabu fix and plus it's close to home. I always get the American Style Kobe Shabu which comes with veggies and ice cream for dessert. All for $17. The waiters are friendly. They are young students most likely from SF State. We come late sometimes, almost close to closing and they are still smiling and friendly. Love this place.

I didn't give them five stars because I am still bitter I had to wait over an hour and one time even left 'cause it took too dang long for a table.
author: Cindy W.

description: Efficient and very friendly staff. High quality meats. Ambience is active but not too loud. This is my favorite Shabu in SF. I think the taste is as good as The Richmond Shabu House, but the location is better for me and the staff is nicer.
author: Anthony H.

description: Shabu House is one of my favorite restaurants. Everytime I eat here it just gets better and better! I highly recommend this place if you're looking for quality food.
author: Megan J.

description: Had dinner at Shabu House on Ocean for the first time.  I can hardly wait to eat there again.  Yes, it was that good.  I ordered the large beef with spicy miso, best beef and broth I've had at a hot pot place. Although not as many choices as other hot pot restaurants (types of broth, meats, veggies, noodles, dumplings, etc.), dinner was still very good.  Service received was good as well.
author: R K.

description:
I can't stress how much i LOVE their sesame sauce!! I can't find it anywhere else better.

Hands down, my favorite shabu joint. Nope, you cannot change my mind. Their ponzu and sesame sauce are great combined! Load it up with garlic and green onion. Meat is important, but it's not 100% without the sauce!!
