Their spicy miso soup is very flavorful. i love scooping some of that for my udon noodles.

Ice cream is delicious too!!! Mostly it'll be a choice between green tea and red bean, sometimes black sesame. I know, after AYCE and AYCD, you probably don't have room for ice cream... I don't blame you.
author: Nancy N.

description:
This is literally my go-to Shabu place in SF! The one here on Ocean Ave. is less crowded and has better parking than the other Shabu House's around the city.

Their menu is relatively simple (which is a good thing), and they have some excellent sauces for their meats. But more importantly, their soup base/broth is very flavorful (which is what definte a shabu place in my opinion). I usually get the spicy miso broth.

I usually order a large beef combo which comes with a large plate of beef and a big bowl of assorted veggies.

The service is swift and efficient, and the wait is usually not that long for this location.

Did I mention that you get your choice of green tea or red bean ice cream at the end of your meal? #winning

If its a cold and foggy day in SF and you're craving something hot, definitely come here for Shabu!
author: Albert L.

description:
Food= always good and hits the spot
Service= very attentive
15% off happy hour= awesome! Get there before 6pm (5-6)
author: Nicky C.

description: Never disappoint everytime I come here! The girls that work there are super friendly and give great recommendations . Even though I never eat my money's worth for all you can eat, I still get it just so I can get all the lamb and waygu beef that I can eat. It's also a great way to try all the different type of meats available.  Try mixing the ginger chicken broth with the spicy miso, it has the kick that you need, but if you can't handle the spiciness, like myself, the ginger chicken is the best,  add some garlic and green onions and we are set.   The best shabu place in the city by far.
author: Fanny C.

description:
Craving some kobe beef with spicy miso broth right now!

I recommend sitting at the bar so you get your own broth to cook with, and it's easier to get the waitress's attention :) .. also you get the best view to watch whatever game is on the flatscreen. It's a win, win.

This is place if very clean and parking is easy. Space is limited at this location, so the wait can get long and the waiting area gets a little crowded on the weekends.
author: Helen Z.

description:
This place is my definite go-to place for Shabu. the waitresses here are soo friendly and gives the place that good spark of light. the meat here is nice and tender and the spicy miso soup is super good. they are very generous with veggies but dont be shy to ask for more! parking is never hard to find and there might be a bit of a wait for a table because of the popularity but its worth the wait. 

i definitely recommend this shabu house over all the other ones!
author: Crystal L.

description: Food is amazing! The meat is always delicious and the broth. Customer service is amazing! They really do work hard to make sure your happy. Only problem is the place is small. Besides that i love going there!
author: Jade T.

description:
eat at your own health risk!!!


the wait time is always over an hour with no reservations available. the staff only pay attention to the larger groups due to the forced gratuity. i found that the broths and soups are stored at room temperature over night! if there's still some left over from the day before, they combine it with the new broths and soups. the staff are very unsanitary! during my 1 hour wait to be seated and 1 1/2 hour dining experience, due to no order taken for 30 mins, i saw no staff member go to the back to wash their hands after bussing the tables. i even saw a single mans broth being poured into the rest of the broth because he left early. this place was a good place about 2 years ago, but now, it's just a money hungry sludge bucket. 

eat at your own health risk!
author: Nathan C.

description:
I love Shabu House on Geary, and was so stoked to hear that a place was opening closer to me. This block of Ocean is pretty quiet after sundown, and there was plenty of free metered parking on the street after 6pm.  This place pretty big and seems to be more spacious, and they have lots of tables for large groups. 

Of all the Shabu places I've tried so far, I think Shabu House gives you the most food and highest quality for your money. Also, the waitress told me that they're happy to switch out certain things (say, if you don't like cabbage but want more spinach), which I never would have thought to ask for. It was very sweet of her to notice our preferences and make recommendations for next time.

I highly recommend that spicy miso broth and kobe beef. Also, the green tea ice cream is really delicious! Overall, great food, great staff, but it was pretty busy even on a Thursday so be prepared for a wait!
author: Rachel A.

description: Best shabu I've ever had and awesome staff! I always look forward to coming here and feel great after such wonderful food. Red bean ice cream is the bees knees, this place can get packed tho.
author: Jade D.

description: Good food. Reasonable prices. Lean operation, but fast friendly service. Would be back if in the area and craving shabu.
author: Debbie Chiou S.

description: servers were kinda slow and couldn't multi task. Barely checked up on us and we were a group of 6. Choice of meat was limited. I like lamb but I feel as if their lamb was old bcus it tasted so bad.. They didnt give the group refills on water until later later on. Service needs to be improved. $250 for all you can eat for 6 ppl so $42 per person which includes gratuity. Spicy miso w/ Kobe beef is good.
author: Boo Z.

description:
Went here for a late Valentine's Day dinner and it was great! Service was quick and efficient. I recommend calling in advance for a reservation and go before 6 p.m. for 15% off your bill, it's their happy hour special. 

They have three options of meat platters, regular, large and the all you can eat special. I went the greedy route with the all you can eat special! So good and only $31. Bring an appetite. The waitresses give you an abundant amount of "refills" on meat or vegetables. For the broth, go spicy miso, delicious and flavorful. A+!

Loved the ambiance and the furniture. Their tables convert easily from a two top to a 16 top within seconds. 

Try this place. Go for the Kobe beef. C- on lamb, just my personal preference.
author: J P.

description:
3.5 stars

Contrary to what others have mentioned, I CANNOT tell the difference in the meat here and the Geary location. The only major difference that is immediately noticeable, is how small and claustrophobic this place feels. 

We had the table in the front and there was simply not enough space between our table and the next. My butt would easily rub on the adjoining table when walking out of the booth to the bathroom. I don't think I like giving people free booty. Doesn't seem right at all.
author: Alfred Y.

description:
I'm not much of a fan of Chinese hot pot, but I loved shabu shabu! This was my first time trying it. I ordered regular sized plates of beef and lamb ($17.99 each), and this was too much meat for 2 people, at least in my experience. I got the spicy miso soup and ginger chicken soup. They were both good, but I definitely recommend ginger chicken. They also give you a bowl of rice and a plate of lettuce, spinach, mushrooms, and carrots to add to the soup. It was so filling. I also got ice cream after! (It came with the meal).
On a Saturday night, there were maybe 5 people ahead of me to get seated, but the wait wasn't too bad--maybe 20-30 minutes. 

Overall, I would definitely recommend Shabu House!!
author: K T.

description:
Pretty good shabu place with thinly sliced lamb and very tasty sauce. I like it when they offer chopped spring onions and garlic on the table. Chicken Karaage was a bit underwhelming (overcooked deep fried white meat).  

Note: We're refused the 15% happy hour discount because two of our friends had not arrived at the table (all the orders were made before 6). Our friends arrived at 6.07 pm. I guess they have to stick to the rule. It'll be nice if they can be flexible to make customers happy.
author: Saran R.

description:
This establishment is our go-to Shabu place in San Francisco.

The Large Plate is plenty of food, but if you really want to go hog wild, you can do the all you can eat.  We prefer the beef, and also frequently ask for leaner cuts of meat because we would like to avoid the heart disease that may eventually catch up to us from all the deliciousness.  The staff usually does a pretty good job of filling that request.

The vegetables are all very fresh and plentiful, and the broth is very well done.

Despite how busy the entire place is, the staff manages it very well.  The waitresses (not being sexist here, but I'm pretty sure we've never been served on by a man) are all super quick, very smart, and very responsive.  They're always running around, but they're very astute and paying attention to your needs.  And, they're always friendly.
author: Jon S.

description: ayce shabu, come hungry, wait can be long at times so plan accordingly
author: Long C.

description: This was my first time having shabu shabu and I loved it. The high tech boiling pots and excellent quality of service made it a great experience. The restaurant was bustling when we got there but our server still took time to explain the whole process. The servings were enormous and although it seems a little pricey at first, you get a ton of food and dessert for around 20 dollars. Def recommend.
author: Annie F.

description: Enjoyed a wonderful Mother's Day dinner here. The staff were very attentive and prompt in meeting our various needs during the meal. My family especially liked their spicy miso broth. We will definitely be returning in the future for another special event!
author: Hillary K.

description:
Their menu is grammatically incorrect. Just sayin'!

They charged us 2 all you can eat of kobe beef in spicy miso soup. I think it was $60-70 for us total. Yes, there's two of us but we asked for one. If you read their menu, it needs to be changed 'cause the menu is wrong. I only ate 2 large plates, hella fat..... don't get it unless you're super hungry 'cause the rice will certainly fill you up! Nonetheless, it always tastes good.

It also sucks that they are only open during the evening which forces me to go all the way to Geary or even San Mateo.
author: Jessica R.

description:
I know that we shouldn't gorge ourselves.  It's bad for our bodies and such large quantities of meat may kill us eventually, but sometimes you MUST INDULGE.  

And with all you can eat and unlimited rice and veggies and meat, oh god just enjoy.  The dipping sauces are unusually good and for an extra 10 dollars you can get all you can drink too.

I came for a work party, which ended with a weird seating arrangement and an unfair dividing of the paycheck....which makes my toes curl, but the food.  GOOD.  So yes I would definitely come back again.
author: Aly A.

description: MMM one of my favorite shabu places! The amount of food they give you is perfect (if you eat everything; meat, rice, and veggies). The meat is freshly cut and not soggy like other places I've been to. This location is pretty small though, I've always had to to wait to be seated. The broth could be better, but the sauces make up for it.
author: Lina C.

description:
Solid shabu, and easier to get a reservation than the other location on Geary. 

The lamb is the best meat--don't go for the combo, go for lamb only. Also, the super size is probably not necessary; I did it and regretted it--go for the regular size instead. Appetizers are not bad including gyoza if you want something fried, or the agedashi tofu which is tasty. 

Go for the spicy miso broth and dip in the sesame sauce liberally, with a healthy dose of the minced garlic mixed in. Mmm...
author: Mike G.

description:
3.5 stars comes mostly from the service because the girls working their were attentive and very good listers although my ordering habits can be a little complicated. Nevertheless, I'd have to say that it was my first time having shabu and I thought is was alright. I mean there's nothing really special I can say about it. 

Just to know: 
The spicy miso wasn't so spicy more like salty because I drank tons of water during my entire meal. 
The ginger chicken broth wasn't tasteful either...so my friend claimed. 
Unagi bowl was a typical rice bowl. 

But the quantity of the good they give is probably a reason why others would come back. The meals do come with ice cream red bean and green tea. I enjoyed both flavors. :)
author: Lisa T.

description:
I have been to the other Shabu House on Geary and the food is the same at both...delicious and addicting.  This place goes above and beyond though.  I took my boyfriend, because he loves meat and sake, but had never had this thinly sliced beef.  He fell in love (I was already there).  The next time we went back, they remembered our drinks, the fact that my leg had been hurt, the type of broth we liked.  Now that's how you keep customers.  Everytime we go to Shabu House on Ocean, it's a great experience, not only because of the food, but because of the people. 

Suggestions:

Both the lamb and beef are amazing.
The veggies are fresh and sooo yummy, but I try not to get rice, because it's really filling and I love udon so much I eat a lot of that.
The sesame sauce is so good...mix it with the sweet sauce and some garlic and green onion, the best dipping sauce.
YOU HAVE TO GET THE SPICY MISO.

and if you have a DD, get the all you can drink.  I'm always DD, so my bf can enjoy a lot of sake.
author: Edelmira D.

description:
Very good Shabu restaurant, with good selection of meat & vegetables, but a bit noisy & expensive.
Individual food servings are medium-large, and can accommodate 2 people with small appetite, buy you may be charged an extra cover charge in this case.
Waitresses are welcoming, but don't waste too much time with you, as they're running from one table to another.
author: Jeff R.

description:
As we walked in, the hottie led us to our seats, and asked if we wanted some sake or beer. To the left and the right young Asian women all did up with their low cut tops and tight short skirts were laughing and drinking the night away. No, we were not at some popping new club or bar...it was Shabu House on Ocean Ave on a Saturday night. 

When the hell did going to a damn shabu establishment mean dressing up like you are in Vegas, or at least a downtown bar in Soma? I felt so out of place here because I had my eating clothes on..track pants and a T-Shirt that was three times too large for my body.

But how was the MEAT? it was damn good sir! The beef was definitely better than the lamb, but that's just a matter of taste. in terms of quality, they were both fine. The spicy miso broth is the way to go as well- who the heck just wants plain ol' water as the base? You can't take some fine-ass girl and put her in a target sale dress for a night on the town..she's gotta be done up in Dior, Kate Spade, or at least BR. Same goes for good shabu shabu meat. It was about 30 bucks for the all you can stuff in your fat gut deal, and it was well worth it. Just take my advice ladies..don't be wearing your hoochie outfits here to eat because it will be hard to look sexy after dinner with your hug hanging down to your knees. Or maybe it is just me, because I eat like a horse- and hung like one too. Just saying.
author: Jerry C.

description:
My cousin comes here at least once a week! :D  
I love this place, unlimited beef and delicious soup for $31? They also accomodate kids (who dont have to pay and can share your unlimited meat) and their green tea ice cream is amazing! 

Service is also always on point, i've never ran out of meat.

tip: add a heaping spoonful of garlic into the ponzu sauce. Mmmm.
author: jennifer f.

description:
Shout out to the two SUPER nice girls who were working today. THank you for accommodating us. I am vegetarian and picky, admittedly, and while they stuck by their rule of only two broths for a table of 5...  they moved us around to at least give us more space, etc. While we were a little rude about it, they were firm but very nice. 

The meal was great, I ended up cooking all my veggies in one broth while the other 4 had to use the other one for meat... it was ok, after all. Food was great and for 5 people being stuffed, the price is not bad. The space is clean and it's a fun atmosphere. I recommend this place, for sure. 

THank you Shabu House!
author: Kim D.

description:
I'm so glad they opened a Shabu House in this neighborhood. I do not have to drive all the way to Richmond and deal with the BS there (long wait, no reservations for 2 people).

Whenever The BF and I want shabu, we come here and get service right away. Parking is easy to find, seating is usually within 5 mins since we usually come after the 7-8pm crowd, and food comes out fast since we order as soon as we sit down. Service is great - the girls will refill soup and water when needed and they don't interrupt you in mid-conversation like other places. One time we came for two weekends and one of the girls recognized us. 

The spicy miso broth is great and flavorful, enough meat and veggies to fill up one person. They have no probably refilling the sauce(s) that you need for dipping. Will definitely come back for my future shabu cravings!
author: Joanna W.

description: Currently my favorite of the 3 locations and all because of....location, location, location. It's easier to get to for me than the Burlingame and Geary location and has a lot more parking (or maybe I'm being a bit delusional and we just happened to come here at a really good time). Food quality is the same as the others, in fact, I think they give even fresher and even more vegetables than the other locations. I also feel like the waitresses here are more on top of things, accommodating, friendlier and perhaps not yet jaded by the job yet (yes, I'm talking to you Burlingame). Anyways, the service will keep me coming back here. To save money, I think it's best to hit this place up for lunch Friday-Sunday, as opposed to paying the extra $ for the dinner hours. Keep it up, Ocean!
author: Ghia G.

description:
Did AYCE at the bar. Bar is better since each person gets their own pot. 

Pretty great soup base and good selection of meats. I ate about 4 plates and it was way more than enough. The all you can drink is pretty worth it for the extra $10 if you drink more than 2 beers, otherwise just order beer instead. 

I loved the Veggie plate and the service was pretty good too. The waitress was very attentive and brought out our meats pretty quick.
author: Jerry Y.

description:
I am a Shabu House fan.  Trust me.  I normally go to the location in Burlingame but I decided to give this new location a chance.  Wow, this place is tiny.  It's smaller than my garage.  In fact, it's probably smaller than a one car garage.  I went with a party of six and we called ahead of time but the lady on the phone said that reservations were booked but they were still taking walk-ins.  She informed us that the our best bet was to come around 8 because there would be no wait around that time.  So my group took her advice, stayed in the house a bit longer and played Dance Central 2 like sober squares on a Friday night, because that's how I roll!  

8PM comes and we all head out to the spot.  It was pretty packed, we signed our name and was told it was going to be a 30 minute wait.  

...2 hours later, we were seated.  You are reading this and probably thinking, why wait two hours?  You should have gone somewhere else.  Well, the birthday girl has been talking about trying this new location all week and we didn't want to ruin her birthday dinner.  Plus, if you know this location, you know that there aren't any good restaurants close by.  The closest worthy restaurant is probably a 10 minute drive down super busy 19th avenue.  We all know that traffic down 19th is a pain.

All in all the food is the same as the Burlingame location (obviously).  The service was amazing.  The manager was nice enough to give us 2 free appetizers for our long wait.  Most of us were blasted by the time we left since all my group did was take sake shots during out 2 hour wait.  By the time it was time to eat, one person in our group was already falling asleep like an embarrassing slob in the middle of eating.  DAVID, I'm calling you out!

Honestly, I prefer driving to Burlingame, it's worth the drive.  There's no wait and it is a lot bigger.  I'll probably go here after shopping at Stonestown if the wait isn't that bad.  


Oh yeah, if you haven't tried Shabu House before.  Order the regular kobe with spicy miso broth.  It should be more than enough and the broth is super delicious.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description:
Food is the same as the other Shabu House restaurant, so no complaints there. This place is TEENY TINY. That's my only issue with this spot. There are some tables that are right at the door where people stand and wait. I find that rather intruding and uncomfortable. I rather be away from people standing, waiting, and listening to my conversations. 

The bar is the best spot at this location. There's only 5 seats, which is a little odd because I would think an even number makes more sense? Go figure, if it works, it works. 

A plus is that they let you make reservations at the bar. So if you're going with one other person, best bet is to just call ahead and save yourself a spot at the bar.
author: Jeannie L.

description:
Another Shabu House opened in San Francisco! Same menu, same food, same everything pretty much. Pretty easy to find parking near here. The bar is a lot smaller than the other ones (only 6 seats or so) compared to the other Shabu Houses.

I got the all you can eat as usual because I was starving that day.. First plate that comes out, a quarter of the meat was fat. Second plate that came out, maybe a third of the meat slices was fat. It wasn't really appetizing eating so much fat so I stopped there but needless to say, the more plates that you order, the amount of fat in the slices also increases. Maybe it's just me but the quality of the meat here is worse than the other ones, maybe it was because the slices were on the thicker side due to how it was cut. The worst part of the meal was the enoki mushrooms that had this weird taste to it, it wasn't fresh at all.

Overall, Burlingame over Geary over Ocean in terms of Shabu House for overall quality/experience. I doubt that I will be going to this location again.
author: Aaron H.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE!

Good reviews do not need much wording. 

Excellent food and EXCELLENT service. I've never had a bad time here. It's amazing. And very very clean.
author: Cynthia L.

description: The wait time here is so long.  And the price is not cheap.  But the meat is fresh.  We got the all you can eat.  $31 per person.  I figured if you get three rounds of meat, then you got a pretty good deal.
author: Byron L.

description:
Okay, I admit that I hated shabu places because I wasn't taught the proper way of shabu-ing (?) That is until I went to Shabu House! The first time I shabu-ed (?d) was at Shabuway in San Mateo and I left hungry because I lost my veggies, meat, and noodles in the pot. The result? Overcooked everything! At that point, I was like "never again!" My friend wanted to go to Shabu House and she promised to teach me, so I agreed. Parking wasn't difficult at all! My friend was able to find a spot right in front of Shabu House and I was able to find one on the opposite side. Downside? It's metered before 6pm and the meter maids check that area often so be careful.

Immediately upon entering, I was somewhat confused because there is no hostess to greet you. I noticed how close the seats tables were to each other which could potentially make you uncomfortable if you don't like listening to other people's conversations. My friend and I ordered the regular and large Kobe Beef with the diluted spicy broth as suggested by the waitress. My friend ordered extra udon noodles, too.

The regular kobe beef was perfect for me since I don't like to eat a lot however, if you have a large appetite, I recommend going for the large Kobe beef plate. The vegetable plate comes with mushrooms, mushroom shoots, lettuce, spinach, and udon noodles. It also came with your choice of green tea or red bean ice cream, which was nice. After finally learning how to shabu, I want to go back again! The total for two people was $40 something which is a little pricy for dinner, but it's nice to indulge once in a while. My only complaint, other than the seating, is that the waitresses never refilled our cups for water and the wait for our bill took FOREVER. Although it was clear that we were finished, I asked where we should pay and they told us to "just leave it there" I told them that we were paying with debit card and they finally took our bill, which was a bit of a hassle. I'll be back!
author: Joyce E.

description:
Based on the reviews I had pretty high expectations for this restaurant. Don't get me wrong, it was good. I just didn't find it to be great. Then again, maybe I AN spoiled by the shabu shabu restaurant I go to in LA

We ordered the Gyoza appetizer. It was good, though they were fried rather than steamed. They also came toward the end of our meal. The sauce was unremarkable - not bad, but no wow factor.  The lack of wow held true for the shabu sauces as well. The peanut paste was different for all of us; I was the only one at our table who used it at all. The other sauce was okay. The meat WAS indeed very fresh as we're the vegetables. The green tea ice cream was a nice end. 

Overall this restaurant was good. No complaints whatsoever and I might well come back. I liked it. I just didn't love it.
author: Diane B.

description:
3 stars here mainly because of the great happy hour special.   Wanted to take the gf to some shabu shabu since she was craving it.   Overall it wasn't bad but not great either. 

Service:  Pretty good, the waitresses were very attentive and polite.  I really liked how quick they were to serve us when needed as well. 5 stars

Quality:  I think this is where you have to decide for yourself quantity vs quality.  I'll admit they give a lot of veggies and meat, but I've definitely had better quality meat at other shabu shabu places.  But hey, if you think meat tastes like meat then this might be great for you!  Couple things I did have an issue with hence why I think this place is just alright:  the broth and sauce.  The broth was lackluster (we had the spicy miso).  It was really watered down and I could hardly taste miso.  I think the worst item was the sauce.  We were given 2 sauces; a ponzu type and a sesame/miso (which I never use no matter where I go).  Now what I love about ponzu is that great citrus taste you get.  However, I could tell that they used vinegar instead, which I think is disappointing.  2 stars

Price: We ordered the AYCE for $31.  Looking back, I think we should have ordered a large order ($20) instead.  I was really forcing myself to eat which was pretty gross.  Unless you're really hungry and up for it, I would suggest just getting a large plate.  Overall most shabu shabu places are essentially the same price. 3 stars

Overall, I would say this is a place where if you're really hungry then its great.  If you're looking for some great tasting shabu shabu then maybe you should try somewhere else.  Oh and I forgot to mention, one thing that I was also disappointed with was that we had to share a burner, which meant we couldn't have ordered separate broths.  It didn't bother me too much, but I know some people will be affected by it.
author: Anthony I.

description:
Party of 14 please!

Went to this place for my BFF's birthday. We had a party of 14, but she forgot to say that when she made the reservation. We sat 14 in a space for 12 and squished in for a bit, but after a while the table next to us left so they were able to extend our seats. 

We all ordered the all you can eat/drink. The food was fresh and the drinks kept coming. We originally ordered 1/2 chicken 1/2 spicy for our pot, but ended up getting the full spicy b/c it wasn't spicy enough. 

I ate a lot of everything and didn't even eat my rice. 

We all had such a great time even though one of our waitresses was rude. The other was very helpful and so nice to us. We all ordered a round of ice cream and they even put a candle in the birthday girl's ice cream.

I'd def. come back here. YUM!

P.S. The nicer waitress had a very high tolerance for some of the drunker people in our group.. we had spills and someone had an accident in the bathroom, but she still kept her smile and friendliness to us.

SO SORRY ABOUT MY DRUNK FRIENDS =\
author: J-nine I.

description: I love this place. Servers are great. Super friendly and efficient. This place is definitely better than the Burlingame location and a nice equivalent of the Geary original location. The vegetables are fresh and not wilted from sitting around for too long and the quality of meat is very good. My go to place at least once a week and always leave happy and satisfied. And the 5-6pm happy hour is a sweet deal too!!
author: Wendy L.

description:
I've been here two more times since my original review 2.5 weeks ago - geez! Everything is good except I retract my recommendation of the pork - it's kinda inconsistent (maybe because not enough people order it) - only beef for us from now on :).

I like that I'm not super thirsty afterwards. This tends to happen at other hot pot places that are heavy with the MSG...
author: Rachel Y.

description:
Awesome Location, Awesome Food, Awesome Waitresses. 

I had their Veggie Dinner Plate, Ginger Chicken Broth, 2 bowls of rice and a carafe of sake, I think it took me about 2 hrs to finish the enormous platter, but I finally did it. You wanna pace yourself and think Marathon pace and not sprinting, if you sprint through the never ending platters of food you will most certainly fail.
author: Stephen C.

description:
Had dinner here last night at the bar and I've noticed that this branch may be smaller than the one at Geary but the staff are just as pleasant. If you are a big meat eater, the regular's meat offering might not be sufficient. Beware, though as they really are VERY generous if you opt for the AYCE thus end up having a lot of waste. 

Sharing regular/large options is fine but they charge a sharing fee. The free ice cream was a nice touch and you can order half and half of both flavors. I like the adzuki better, though.

The agedashi tofu was more than good with a delicately light coating on five cubes of soft silken tofu snowed in with a decent amount of bonito flakes and nori strips. Was it worth it for approximately $1.10 per cube? Maybe not every time but the flavor surely delivered.

The place gets packed (as any of their branches) even before 6:30 so try to get there early. They only take reservation of party of four and more. Noise level can get on some people's nerves but remember that you eat here for the food not for the ambiance.
All in all, good value for money. Happy hour of 15% off 5-6pm purchases is a plus.
author: Jam M.

description:
It's absolutely delicious. I convinced my boyfriend and best friend to come try and we figured the new location on Ocean St. would better accommodate us for lunch and we were right! 12:30pm on a Friday afternoon and there was barely a crowd, so we were all able to get a seat at the bar (which is the best since you get your own pot, but hard for conservation). 

During lunch, for a little less than $15, you receive a LARGE plate of meat (beef &/or lamb), a plate of vegetables, udon, rice, and a choice of red bean or green tea ice cream. I always choose spicy miso for my broth because it's so delicious. 

I am definitely going to come to this location more often than the one on Geary, that is, until people catch on. Boyfriend loved it and we are looking forward to our next trip!
author: Jessica T.

description:
Came here with the gf cuz she was craving shabu. I have been to their spot in burlingame. This one is quite tiny. but quality of food and service still the same. still get the same amount of meat and veggies. great place to bring a date, very cozy feel to it.
for the price and the amount of food, i will definitely come back.
author: Andi I.

description:
Yummy...it just keeps getting better...and now I am moving! So sad!
Seriously glad I gave this place a chance, it is so good. The spicy miso broth is perfection and I love that you can add pumpkin to your veggies (do it...so good). The staff is super friendly and the prices are just right.
author: Kellie N.

description: I have been to other Shabu House but this one will be my last time coming here. The food was fine is the way how they seat their customer.  When we arrive there was 2 party in front of us after more than 40min of waiting our group of 4 will be next. The hostess just ignore our group and call the group of 6 which was later than us. The hostess told us cause the table can fit 6 people better. So we told her we waited for more than 40min and we don't mind to split into 2 & 2. So finally they couldn't locate the party of 6 and give us the table. I think the owner need to do some training on the staff.
author: Matthew k.

description:
We waited FOREVER to sit down despite reservations, which is fine, it takes a while for people to finish their shabu, I totally get it.
Though the ridiculously slowwwww service didn't help push things along at all.

The food was AMAZING and I ate a ton, came home feeling so full and happy.

BUT then came bedtime, and sadly my night was spent doubled over all night, crawl-racing my boyfriend to the bathroom...
The next morning we found out that others in our party had suffered the same fate.

So eh, the food was excellent but it got us sick, I'll be weary from here on out if I ever visit this chain again.
author: Valerie H.

description:
Not a great experience here. Its not that the place is terrible, but it was way overpriced for what we got. I came here with my folks and I wasn't that hungry. My dad got the combo plate and my mom got the combo plate. I decided just to get the edamame and some sake. But for some reason the waitress said they would charge me $15 if I didn't get an entree. I didn't understand why because we didn't get any of the all you can eat things. But my mom wanted to eat here so I just got the lamb plate. I don't understand the logic behind that at all. The girl was nice and all, but not a great server. We were there for a while and the waitress never refilled the pot, had to be called over to fill our waters once, and otherwise didn't really come by the table. The food was alright. Nice thinly sliced meat and plenty of veggies. Its what you'd expect to get for those prices.

The restaurant itself is tiny. Probably difficult to get large groups in there. There is a tiny little bar space to sit at. Theres just a couple seats there. It's got a big tv in the restaurant too. The food isn't bad, but their not exactly customer oriented.

Pay to sit restaurant...
author: Arthur C.

description:
I am a huge fan of Shabuhouse, the location on ocean especially. This location has ample parking, and the ambience is modern. I usually order the large beef/pork combo with the spicy miso. The soup is superb, and the meat is fresh, not to mention the vegetable plate is fresh as well. This location is small, but the service is great. The team of girls who work here are young, but they make it feel like I am eating at a four star restaurant. 

Per the remarks below by Jessica R. I am not sure how the menu is stated which may require grammatical corrections. Any "all-you-can-eat" places will charge based on the amount of customers. Guess you may need to venture out more to understand this concept. I have never heard of two people ordering ONE all-you-can-eat.. that's just foolish. Every business will lose money by doing this. Just stating the facts. 

I will definitely come back to this location, but the other locations of Shabuhouse is great as well.
author: Zukru O.

description: My first shabu experience and I have to say I finally know why everyone loves to shabu! The soup base was GREAT and the unlimited amount of meats and veggies just cant get any better. You really do get your money's worth if you eat  a lot of meat. I of course did the all you can eat combo, and I usually only eat beef and veggies, lamb  is not really my thing and im not a big fan of  the taste, but we also got PORK as well and it was good! The service there was great and people were very helpful and friendly and the place setting was really nice . I def would recommend to come here again and they had really good green tea ice cream at the end of the dinner ;D
author: Tiffany K.

description: The chicken ginger broth of the shabu-shabu was very tasty. The portions on the large generous and fresh. The service was very friendly. We'll be going back a LOT!
author: Rod N.

description:
This location is open during lunch on Fridays and Saturdays. The serving size seems to be the same as dinner and it's a couple of bucks cheaper. Everything tasted amazing as usual, and just like the Geary location, the Ocean store is freezing most of the time, so it makes the meal even better. 

Friendly staff, hearty shabu and flat screen tv at the bar? My kind of lunch.

Minus one star for a few bites crusty rice. But other than that, I'll be coming back.
author: Lynn C.

description:
I have always seen pictures of this place and heard of this place, but I never got the chance to go. My boyfriend decided to finally take me here because he knew I would love it and ... I do! It was really good and it was a fun experience!

Once walking in I thought the place was really small and the tables were REALLY close together. Personally, I thought it would be awkward if someone sat next to us since it was so close, but first let me tell you about the food!!

My boyfriend decided to get the ALL YOU CAN EAT for both of us. We got kobe beef and lamb, and they came in two big trays. I have never ate lamb before, but I could not tell the difference in taste. It came with helllla veggies, rice, and udon noodles also. I didn't think it was all was going to fill me up quick, but it did! The quality of the food was great, and the servers were really nice and filled up our cups of water whenever they were nearly empty, which is a plus! I love the idea of actually cooking the food in front of you! I definitely want to come back... but to a different location because..

the tables were just so close together! I'm not sure if the other Shabu house's are the same where the tables are really close together. If they are then ehh I'll live with it I guess haha! Me and my boyfriend seriously heard this guys whole life story next to us.. and it was pretty hard not to ease drop when we weren't that far apart and he was talking fairly loud. He was talking about how his life has been a struggle and how he lived through getting shot and STABBED. Then he ran into a chick he knew and of course this chick comes over with her friend to talk to them and CHOP IT UP... talking about clubbing and drugs and what not LOL me and my boyfriend were just like WTF. We wanted to enjoy our food in peace, but these fools were killing the ambiance lol

Other than the people next to us.. the food was REALLY good and the service is great, but be prepared to spend a quite a bit of $$$ here because if you want the ALL YOU CAN EAT my boyfriend paid $70+ for just us two. Thatshitkray.
author: Kate E.

description:
OH MY...I am in love with SHABU!

I came here with a girlfriend..it was my first time ever eating shabu!

The place was small and cozy..limited seating. 

Not many Large tables but plenty of small tables for two.--we didn't wait long...

I ordered a Large Kobe Beef w/ spicy miso. It came with the veggies/udon/etc.

We also ordered Stars Sparkling Sake..my all time favorite! I like it better than the hot sake =)

The beef was yummy! The spicy miso wasn't TOO spicy..we had to add a little more spice to it..which is good because then you have control of it. They refill your miso from a pitcher.

I am definitely coming back!
author: Sarah F.

description:
Date/Time:  Sunday, 7:30pm
Occasion:   New Years dinner with bear bear
Party of:  Two
Ordered: Large beef with miso/chicken ginger combo + vegetable platter
Total incl gratuity: ~$48

Being the shabu monSTAR that I am, I will take any opportunity to eat shabu.  Now that they've opened one a smidge closer to bear's house, it makes it that much easier to eat my favorite food.  Unfortunately, I'm not sure that this particular location is up to par.  The vegetable platter is noticeably inconsistent.  The mushrooms and spinach was a lot more sparing on my plate than on bears.  The meat and broth are comparable to the other locations.  Buttery kobe beef and flavorful miso broth.

This location is considerably smaller than the other two so steer clear if you're planning on dining here with a large group.  At this point in time, the service is still very rookie....a little on the inattentive side.  Food and condiments do not come out in a streamlined manner.  Hopefully they improve as they progress!

My favorite still stands as the Burlingame location but ya know....I'll take shabu anytime, anywhere ;)
author: Jess C.

description:
This place is reasonable and pretty standard compared to all the other shabu spots in the city. I use to live pretty close to this location, so i've been here more than a few times.

Parking is doable. This street gets a little busy and hectic at times, but not too bad.

Service varies from my visits. Most of the time it is just okay. The wait can be super long sometimes. And once seated, you really have to flag them down sometimes to place your order. The waitresses are sometimes so occupied that they mix up your request.

Now onto the food. I usually get all you can eat. It's $31 per person. Don't forget about HAPPY HOUR! 15% off your entire bill. I've never made it to happy hour though, but seems like a good deal. TIP FOR HAPPY HOUR: Your entire party needs to be present. That's why I have been able to use that sweet deal.

They also have this thing about putting everything on one tab even if you have a fairly big party. So if someone wants all you can eat, everybody needs to get all you can eat or it's a no go! Understandable, but just a bit frustrating when you go with a larger group.
author: Amimee D.

description:
Looooove shabu! My bf took me here for my birthday & we're hooked!

We had the spicy miso broth which was delish! You get a choice of meat (lamb & Kobe beef) and it comes with a plate of veggies (enoki mushroom, cabbage, spinach, mushroom, tofu, carrot and udon) 

If one person chooses All-you-can-eat option, it applies to every one at the table. It is stated in the menu. 

The staff is great here! Very nice & attentive but it does get busy!
author: Alyssa B.

description:
Compared with the hotpot restaurants that I tried before, this one is nothing special and the taste is soooooooo common, but the price still high.
Even though we are a three-people group, the table is too small for us.  And three of us need to share a super small hotpot, so I think it is not comfortable.
author: Olive S.

description:
This location might be the worst Shabu House. We went there at 5 pm on Sunday. We had a total of 2 adults and a toddler. The lady sat us at a small 2 person table and put the high chair in the walkway and so close to the soup pot. There were plenty of table open wince it was only 5. I asked her to move to the table just next to us so the high chair will be out of the walk way and also have a bigger distance from the soup pot. She didnt seem happy but we moved anyways. 

Everythincame out in a timely manner. Like my reviews on the other Shabu House locations, the quality of the meat cut is a hit or miss. This time it was a miss. There were no marbling on the beef at all. All red slices.  I looked at the other tables and some of there beef had nice marbling. 

Service SUCKED. The waitress came refilled our water once! And that was our service for the dinner. 

Shabu House should be disappointed in their service and overall dining experience at this location.
author: K C.

description: Heard many good things about this location. It's closer then going to their other location. This place is over-rated! I got the spicy miso broth but it wasn't even spicy at all.  The broth was kinda bland. The broth got oilly really fast.  it took forever to heat up.  The meat is delish.  Service is okay.
author: LZ T.

description: I've always opted for the all you can eat because one large plate is already 19.99. The plates they give you when you start off with all you can eat are large ones. The meat here is sliced a little thicker than at Mum's or Hot Pot Garden making it a little chewier. They have a great selection of ice cream flavors--mango and sesame. A nice change from the usual green tea, vanilla, or red bean. They also offer 15% off your bill during happy hour from 5-6pm and there is plenty of parking nearby.
author: Lily Z.

description:
Love this place!  It's their newest location aside from the one on Geary and the other one in Burlingame.  The wait is never as long as the one on Geary and it's a little more spacious.  I think the spicy miso taste a little better here than the one on Geary.   You can really taste miso, with a lot of spice to it!

I usually order the regular sized kobe here.  For some reason, the last time I went back to Geary, I ordered the large meat and it seemed to be the same size as the regular here.  I felt a little jipped, to be honest.  After that incident, I've been coming back here all the time.  My cousin and I are probably their regular customers, since we love Shabu so much!  Anna, one of the servers, is the best!
author: Nancy S.

description: First time trying shabu and it was delicious! Had all-you-can-eat with Kobe beef and lamb. Great quality meat and the two servers there were really nice and quick on their feet. I think their names were Amy and Melissa. Not sure.. But I will be back!
author: Wilson M.

description:
I loved Shabu House on Geary, and then I moved.
It was a hassle to get out there, and then this place opened up, on my birthday no less.  And you know what?  I think I like it better than the Geary one.  The waitstaff is a little inexperienced, as would be expected, but the food is just as good and the atmosphere is better.  And I like the neighborhood.
author: Mick B.

description: I love shabu-shabu and Shabu House is my favorite place to go when I'm craving it! I don't usually go for AYCE only because I physically can't eat my money's worth so I'm so glad they have combo options! I always get the regular for $17.95 (large is around $21 I think) which comes with either Kobe beef, lamb, or pork or a combination of 2, veggies and udon noodles, and a scoop of green tea or red bean ice cream at the end. My favorite broth is the spicy miso, so good and not too spicy. I've tried the ginger chicken broth, but I didn't like it that much- not enough flavor. Also love this place because service is good, it's always clean, and it's less crowded than the Geary location!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
I came to SF for 3 days to visit a friend and two out of the three nights, we ate here because it was that good! I tried both the ginger chicken broth and the spicy miso broth, and though I prefer the spicier miso broth, they are both really good. The beef also melts in your mouth. 

Definitely recommend this place. 

PS: I love their red bean ice cream!
author: Evelyn R.

description: Amazing food! It was our first time and we were not deceived. The beef fondue is delicious, with complementary green tea ice cream :) the service is awesome too, really nice and helpful (for those who don't know what they're doing)
author: Marie F.

description:
My boyfriend, friend, and I all got the combo plate (lamb/kobe) - there are two sizes for the combo plate, regular and large. 

For the soup base: Traditional Water because the boys can't handle anything spicy (spicy miso) nor do they like ginger (ginger chicken broth). 

Our table only had one stove which is why I had to agree to the traditional water or I would have personally liked to try spicy miso. 

It's a plain ole' shabu house that's close to my place so I will probably come again and try to spicy miso broth. 

p.s lots of side vegetables!
author: Mona L.

description:
Finally. Shabu House has come to my neighborhood!

This is their third location. I went to the one on Geary when it first opened as well as their Burlingame location. I was glad to finally try out their latest addition.

I went there on a Friday night. As with all Shabu House locations, it was packed. My party of three waited about 40 minutes to be seated. Not too bad considered we did not have a reservation and the fact that it seemed everyone seated was taking their "sweet" time finishing up.

As always, I ordered the All you can Eat with the Spicy Miso Broth. The quality of the ingredients and the service was as good as always. The servers were attentive at our re-orders. 

I am glad to have this location in the neighborhood so now I do not have travel far to get great Shabu Shabu.
author: Jesson d.

description:
Consistency amongst chain restaurants is what everyone should strive to be like in that industry.

Shabu house does it right.  I know that when I go from one location to the next, I'll still get the same meal! 

You're quite awesome Shabu House.  

AYCE =)
author: Kathy N.

description:
I feel like I always end up going to Shabu House whenever I'm in SF. Not complaining, I crave for it all the time anyway!

Atmosphere is very homey and chill. The place is very clean and very modernly decorated. It is a small restaurant, therefore when it gets crowded, there can be a long waiting list.

Their food is delicious! I love it! (I'm not even there, but thinking about it is making me so happy right now...) Their service is wonderful, the ladies there are extremely nice and friendly. Their price is fair, not too expensive.

I like this place so much, I can't wait to go back again!
author: Angela L.

description:
I'm not surprised that the owner decided to convert the ramen/yakitori restaurant into another Shabu House - who wouldn't, knowing that the one on Geary is so profitable?!

In any case, I have not been to the one on Geary before - the fiance wasn't a fan and didn't even want to try it a second time - but I somehow got the fiance to try this one. He is a tough cookie when it comes to Shabu, so let's just say he was less than pleased. However, i'm much more lenient so here goes -

I ordered the All You Can Eat (priced at $31, it's on the steep side) and was sure to really get my money's worth. We steamrolled through three plates each like the champs we are and definitely got our money's worth... but damn, why is shabu so expensive when I cook my own food?

They give you three choices of meat: "kobe" beef, lamb and pork. Mind you, it's not true "kobe" beef and can barely qualify for American Kobe beef. The first two plates of beef were pretty good, but when we got the third plate, it was fairly tough and seemingly hard. The meat might not have been as well marbled and I don't know if it was coincidence that our third order came out this way or if they started bringing out the cheap stuff as we ate more. The lamb and pork are nothing to complain about, but I'd definitely go lamb over pork any day.

The vegetables are vegetables, you can't go wrong there. 

The service was pretty good and the waitresses were very attentive. The only suggestion regarding service is to purchase another meat slicer - if the restaurant had been full and you only had one meat slicer, I don't think things would have ended well. 

The sesame sauce here is much better than surrounding shabu places (Kufuya, G-Cube) but still doesn't hold a light up to Shabuway's in San Mateo.

In fact, no shabu place around here can hold a light up to Shabuway.

Would I go back? If I had a surplus of money, sure. However, based on price and quality of food... most likely not. The bill came out to $77 for only two people. My wallet cried as I pried my overused card from its clutches.
author: Christina B.

description:
love it here, wish they were open at lunch because i work across the street. 
ive been here twice and i cant get enough of it. ill be making it a habit to come here
author: T M.

description:
With this cold weather, I've been CONSTANTLY craving hot pot. I remember trying to yelp hot pot places in SF before, and this place popped up, but it just seemed so far. But, driving to Stonestown once, I glanced over and lo behold. There it was!!!! I was a little too ecstatic about it and might have been a danger to some pedestrians. haha. just kidding...Anyway, after picking up  my friend, we immediately came to Shabu House. As always when I go eat, I'm to the point of starvation. We quickly each ordered the Large combination sets, one with Kobe Beef and Pork, and the other with Kobe Beef and Lamb. The food and veggies came out super quick. The worst part? Waiting for the damn soup to boil. UGH it was horrific. It took so long. Or maybe like 6 minutes, but it felt like a real trip. Everything was great after we were able to start cooking our food. The rice though. It was so soft and chewy. I had to be a fatass and order two bowls and I still had a ton of veggies and udon. OH. lol I forgot about those. The service was really great and you don't have to worry about being overwhelmed by the steam from the hot pot cz the place is quite spaced out and comfy to eat at.

5/5 - I don't know if I was just really really hungry, but I thoroughly really enjoyed Shabu House. The food, the atmosphere, the service. They were all very good and I will be back. Next time I need to remind myself to take it slow though. Dang soup burnt my tongue.
author: Carmen L.

description:
Came here with a group of folks on the weekend, and it was fairly packed. It's a smallish location, and is the first Shabu House I've been to (apparently it's a chain).

The shabu itself was decent--they give both spinach and napa cabbage, and there's pumpkin (yay!), asparagus, shitake mushroom, enoki mushroom, tofu, baby carrots, and what I think was zucchini. All of it looked pretty fresh, even if it felt a little overpriced for what I was getting.

Coming here as a vegetarian was difficult, even though they have a vegetarian shabu, because they don't have the divided pots (and apparently the only broth you can get is the traditional water with kombu, because the spicy miso broth has fish in it) and there were only two burners at the table for seven of us. My friends were kind enough to just cook veggies in the pot I was at until I could get everything cooked and put into an extra bowl the waitress brought for me to make it easier (she was very nice about trying to accommodate me). I have to say the waitress really did try to help as much as she could, and the service was pretty good in terms of refilling water and making sure we were doing okay (and bringing us more green onions, etc, when we ran out). Even so, I don't think I'll be back unless I'm with another vegetarian to share the pot with...
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Yay! Finally a Shabu House thats close to my house and parking is decent! 

We arrived at 6:30pm on a saturday evening and there was a group ahead of us and 2 open tables. The girl said about 30mins for a table of 4. We said ok, put our name down and decided to kill some time by walking around Walgreens (that was a block away). Came back 15 mins later and my name was gone from the list! The girl goes "oh i thought you weren't coming back." And I'm just like "no...we just walked around." Anyhoo, they sat us down really quick. The 2 empty tables from earlier were still empty so I dunno why we had to wait 30mins....

Since it was just me, my mom, and my 2 daughters, we ordered 2 large kobe beef plates. The amount was just right! Food is always yummy! I've been to the other 2 locations so I knew what to expect.

Service was good. Our server checked up on us a few times, which was fine.

Place is small tho, compared to the other locations so you wouldn't be able to fit a large party. There are a bunch of table of 4's.
author: Jean T.

description:
I have to say, this place is one of the best Shabu places in the city. 

I came here with a huge group and we had really awesome service and a great experience. Great service = great experience. (:
Our server was Wendy! She was so nice and explained everything in full detail when we were ordering or deciding what to order. 

Food quality was great. Everything was fresh. No complaints.

The menu can be a little tricky to navigate but with a little reading, it isn't too hard to understand. lol. Just remember that they have a $5 charge (like all the Shabu House restaurants) if you choose to share. 

They also give ice cream to your whole party at the end of the meal. ^_^

Parking isn't too bad, since there is residential parking areas near. I was lucky to find parking right in front.
author: Susan Y.

description:
Shabu Shabu! Yum yum!

During Tuesday HH the restaurant wasn't busy at all. It filled up a bit as the night went on, but we wanted to get there in time for 15% off the bill.

We ordered all you can eat and they are very generous with all the veggies/noodles and plates of meat. The spicy miso was the best shabu broth I've had...it had a good amount of flavor and spice. With 15% the bill for two came to $57 plus tip.

Only thing I would change would be ramen noodles instead of the udon. I guess I can't knockoff a star for that because I don't eat much of the noodles anyway.

Definitely can't be a regular customer, but I would come back for a special occasion or date night.
author: Annaliese D.

description: When I go here I always order the large beef.  It comes with a lot of fresh vegetables which I love. There meat is pretty good. It it sliced thin and has nice marbling. Sometimes though it might need a little bit more defrosting. The main reason why I come here is because of there sesame sauce which they make in house. They grind there own sesame and it's so good. I always tell them to give me a lot a of sesame sauce and I can just eat that all day with rice. I've been to many other Shabu restaurants and there sesame sauce is never as good. There spicy miso broth is also very delicious. It's not too spicy or mild. Service can be spotty sometimes. I would have to ask them to refill my water or give me more rice. The wait can sometimes be long so I advise you to make reservations if you can.
author: simon c.

description:
Shabu House, what can I say, it's pretty much my standard by which I judge all other shabu places and normally it's what ultimately keeps me coming back. 

At first I thought that this new location would be crazy in terms of parking but luckily most places in this little strip of Ocean are closed right around the time that Shabu House opens in the evening.

The good news is that most people still do not know this location exists or prefer the other two (Geary / Burlingame) locations instead, so everyone including ourselves got seated right away with no wait unlike the out the door wait that sometimes occurs at the previous locations.

The bad news is that the place is smaller than either of the two other places. The Burlingame location is huge and the Geary location has the benefit of the upstairs room and a larger bar. Speaking of the bar, it's extra small at this location, seats maybe 4? The rest are tables. Now I always prefer bar seating at Shabu house since that means I don't need to share a pot with my fellow guest and easier access to my waitress should I need something, so if you're like me, this may be an issue.

Other than that, same old good Shabu, just a different location.
author: Peter W.

description:
ALL YOU CAN EAT 31.99per person!
Get the spicy miso soup! Get all the types of meat!
Order more veggies!

Go in early in the night or else it will be packed way later on in the night.

But to be honest I don't see what's so great about this place.
I'd rather go for regular chinese hotpot because you get more types of food!
Plus it's way cheaper than this.
The only thing that makes it better is probably because it looks fancy in here and it looks cleaner...nothing else.
author: Annie H.

description:
I went to Shabu House for the first time tonight and it was a great experience.  My friends and I did they ayce with drinks.  We ate to our hearts content and the waitresses came by and asked us if we wanted more meat and drinks.  

The staff was very friendly and very accommodating.  They hooked us up with an extra sake after last call.
author: Chrissy M.

description:
The lady and I love Shabu House and decided to give this one a shot.

The food was good and the service was great but the place was not as big as the others and the noise level is insane.  Can you imagine a bunch of college folks drunk off sake trying to see who can yell the loudest?  Yup.  I couldn't even talk to the girlfriend.  I think you would be better off going to the one in Burlingame.  But hey, if you're all about shouting matches, knock yourself out.
author: Chai S.

description:
Saturday, October 4th before noon....

I'd give it five stars if it weren't for the price.  My mother and I were guests of my brother and my dear sister-in-law.  We decided to go with the "all you can eat meat" option ($31/person). The concept is not meant for someone who cannot finish at least four plates of meat.  Note that if one orders all you can eat, each member in the party is required to do the same, even if one's appetite is not all there. 

The non meat platter contained a sampling of spinach, cabbage, enoki mushrooms, flower mushrooms, cubed tofu and udon noodles (my favorite).  I would have asked for a second plate, but that was not what I was there for.  This platter along with a half plate of meat was enough for my 87 year old mother.

The choice of meats, thinly sliced (for ease of cooking), included high grade beef, lamb and pork.  The meat was excellent.  Needless to say, this is where I made up for the price.  I had four and a half plates of meat (I ate the portion of beef my mother could not finish).  If I had been my son's age the plate count would have been doubled (possibly more).

One had to ask for rice, but again, that wasn't what I was there for.  

At the end, right before I ordered the last plate of meat (because I had a last minute yearning for the second plate of lamb), I was served a scoop of red bean ice cream - great way to end the meal.  I wanted to ask where I could get a gallon of the stuff, but afterall I do have to watch my weight.....[uh huh].

If you want good service, go early.....no waiting and the staff is gracious and rearing to serve up a great meal.  Order the all you can eat only if you are hungry.  I'd say the price should have been no more than $20 or $25 for the meat option and $15 for the vegetable option.....Afterall, this is not a Brazilian Steak House.
author: Glenn N.

description:
Great place to eat to fight off the cold San Francisco weather.  We got there about 5:30, no biggie, there were 2 table occupied.  Between myself and my two girls, the waitress insisted that we squeezed into a table for two.  Hhhhhmmmmm.  Like there are tons of open tables that could seat four.  But we took the table thinking it was a bit strange.  As a few more people arrived around 6 we heard her say, sorry those tables are reserved, that was more than half the tables in the restaurant.  By the time we left, around 7:00 ish, the whole place was packed and there were four to a table for two.  There was about 6 other people waiting for a table.  Next time we'll make reservations for sure.  

The price was reasonable, with the Shabu Shabu, we ordered 2 large beef, but since the waitress didn't bring a ordering pad with her or paper, she brought us two regular size.  They already came with veggies, so there really isn't any need to order additional veggies.  I also got a Tempura Soft Shell Crab Salad, that was ok, but the crab wasn't very big and there was tons of vinegar dressing on the bottom which wilted some of the salad on the very bottom.

This is a fun place to come eat, but keep in mind, you're all sharing the same soup pot.   They also have an all you can eat and another all you can eat and drink (I assume this is sake).  We walked away very full and content.
author: Twist' D.

description:
The food here is absolutely perfect except for a BIG MINUS: THE SERVICE.

It's true that when i come here this place is kinda busy. I accepted the fact that the service would be slow. However, asking for a cup of ice for my Coke for 5 times and finally my mom had to go inside to ask for cup of ice ice-this is something that the manager here need to discuss with your staff. 

Besides, the service attitude of one of the girls here-Amanda (I had to ask for her name because of her bad attitude toward customers) - is totally UNACCEPTABLE. 

She is non-stop talking to her friends (which is sitting next to my table) when we ask for check and ask for refilling sauce few times and the other girl is busy with other customers. She totally ignored my table (which is next to her friends' table). The other girl had to run to help us after serve other tables. And do not blame for busy time, because it was almost 10pm and you guys already ask us if we needed anything because of the last order. 
It was totally Ok to have a chat with your friend when they come to your workplace to have dinner, but PLEASE remind yourself that there were still other customers needed your service and other colleagues needed your help to serve customers. Chat with your friend when the place is not full of customers who need your services. 
Do not blame for "busy day so we can not serve u well" when you talking with your friends.
We do not ask you smile at us because we know how tired you were to work all day. But please show some RESPECT to customer by nicely put the bowl of ice-cream down at table instead of kinda throw at our faces.

P/S: Dear, Amanda, you should watch your attitude if u want to have bigger tips. And manager should talk to her about her attitude if you want to have more and more pleased customers.
author: IVY D.

description:
All you can eat deal is the best bang for your buck at a place like this!

The pricing isn't too bad. A regular plate runs about $13-15, large plate runs about $20, all you can eat is about $30 and all you can eat & drink is about $40-50? 

The service is great! First, they'll seat you w/ the menus. Then once you've decided on one of the three soup broth choices (spicy miso, ginger chicken, and traditional hot water?) they'll bring out plates of veggies! along with your choice of either rice or udon noodles. followed by your meat selection of kobe beef, pork, or lamb. Kobe beef is the best! The meat is lean, not too fatty so it taste delish! The only con about this place, it's quite small compared to its other location in Burlingame and they only have one unisex restroom. 

Oh!  I forgot to mention, they do serve ice cream after the meal! Red bean or Green tea. I personally enjoy the Red Bean one much better!
author: Alex T.

description:
I'm a big fan of shabu places.  I tried the Shabu House on Geary and it was pretty good so I decided to give this one on Ocean a chance.  Location is new, and the furnishing is clean and tidy.

For Shabu, the most important things are the quality of the meat and the dipping sauces.  On both of these accounts, places like Mums and Shabuway are superior.  The "American Kobe" was well marbled, and decent, the meat was frozen pretty stiff and came to the table that way.  The sesame/peanut sauce is a bit dry and hard.  The dashi/soy-based sauce was too salty.  I had the chicken stock as a soup base and it was a bit bland.  Nothing came together very well.  I was glad that I did not order the "all-you-can-eat" as it didn't taste good enough for me to eat beyond the first plate.

The waitress packs the rice down super hard so instead of fluffy grains of rice, you get this hard mass of starch which cannot be separated easily.  Waitress was not rude, but was in a bit of a rush and did not dispense with any pleasantries.  Service was much better elsewhere, such as Mum's.  Shabuway usually is pretty busy and the service is not that great either, but I would rank my experience here at this particular Shabu House lower.  

Overall, this place is "ok" but all of the other Shabu places I've tried are better.  I would probably not come back to this location again unless a buddy specifically requests it for some reason.  Stick with Mum's over at Japantowns or Shabuway down the penninsula.  Even the Shabu House on Geary is better.
author: Ed K.

description:
The new place looks nice. Definitely less cramped. Tables are much bigger, each has 2 burners. Nothing new or different except seems like I got less beef when I ordered regular. Soup was standard. The sauces are usually what makes the meal good. But the sesame was just alright. Grainy and thick? 

Service was slow. 

15% off between 5 to 6 though for now.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Tip: AYCE Shabu and AYCD. Need I say more. 

This place is packed so get there early and then get grubbin. Service is pretty decent and food is always a good choice. Come hungry and if you plan on going out afterwards, cancel those plans because if you do the AYCD, the only place you're going is back home to pass out. 

Dont get too much rice since you want to eat the meat. Spicy broth is the way to go and don't forget to load up on the garlic. No spitting game that night but the meal will be totally worth it. 

The green tea ice cream at the end of the meal is also a nice touch.
author: Roth S.

description:
Went here for the first time with a few buddies.  I really liked this place and will be going back.  Food was great, seats are nicely designed, roomy and comfy.  Ambiance and design of the place (and the tables for that matter) are very nice and modern.  Wait staff and service in general was the best I could've hoped for.  I liked the tv's they had but kinda wish they installed another flat screen at the front of the place instead of just at the back and side wall.

I like their buffet option with choice of 3 different meats.  The vege plate with udon noodles was a very nice addition.  The mushrooms soak up all the flavor from the broth and is just as good as eating the meat.  I recommend getting the spicy miso broth.  I kinda wish they added a ramen noodle option though.

I don't drink enough to take advantage of the limitless drinks option, but their hot house sake tasted nice and smooth.

I usually don't like Shabu places that charge per plate because it takes a while to fill me up on that sliced meat.  The buffet option was a must for me.  

Nice touch with the ice cream at the end.
author: Gilbert C.

description: I've been to this location twice and both times the food was great and the service was slow. If you want to make a reservation, you need at least four people otherwise you have to wait. I waited for 30 minutes for a party of 3 on a Sunday night which wasn't too bad. Although the meal is pricy at 31/pp AYCE or 42/pp AYCE + drinks, the food and broth was delicious. The plates of meat are fresh, not frozen, and they're easy to pick up and don't clump together like many other similar places. I feel this is a five star restaurant but it just has slow service. Every single plate of meat, vegetable, water and broth refill had to be requested twice. The waitresses are so quick to move around and don't take their time to notice the empty plates and cups. I think it took about 15 minutes each time between request and arrival of more food. On both occasions, I took the full two hours because the service was rather slow.
author: Ryan L.

description: Nice little spot, service is fast food is great.
author: Jesica C.

description:
After a Giants game, went looking for a place to eat.  Decided upon Shabu House and hoping we would be the crowds.  Luckily, we did.  Came in and sat right down.  Service was quick and crisp.  Down to business - starting with the chicken broth, we ordered lamb and beef.  Always get the lamb!  Use the green onions and garlic to season your broth and your sauces.  

Great meal.  Don't know about the ice cream - both the green tea and azuki beans did not excite us.
author: Bill L.

description:
This place used to be one of my favorite places. This place to me is not just a place to eat but an experience. I have loved this experience so much that I have been coming here for years. This place is known for its "All-You-Can-Eat" Shabu Shabu. I have talked about this place for years to soooo many people. I have talked about this place soooo much that I invited A group of 13 of my best people to come an experience what I have experience. 
Now here comes the hard part for me.... I WAS SOOOOO EMBARESSED!!! This is how. We waited to be seated. When we sat down to order to my surprise we could not have what we wanted. there were no signs, there were no warnings, there was no notice about all people are your tables needed to order the "All-You-Can-eat" in order to have it. Can you beleive it. Okay I understand that the business may think we are going to share food. So they said that those who wanted the "All-You-Can-Eat" would have to be at another table. So we came up with an idea to split the table. Those who wanted the "All-You-Can-Eat" would be at one table with their own check and those who wanted something else would sit at another with their oen check. Well thats wasn't good enough, the employee said that we would have to eat the "All-You-Can-Eat" far away from the other tables as to ensure that we would share food. CAN you beleive it????? I was so embaressed! what a way to lose face. 
If you don't want to lose face, stay away from here.
author: Nic P.

description: Comfort food on gloomy days in SF, it's definitely my fav Shabu spot in SF, we don't need anymore reviews about them. I don't always order all you can eat because I think the one plate is enough and I love the PORK more than BEEF! Highly recommended!
author: Sandy L.

description: This is rare that I ever write a review, but damn. I've frequented the other shabu house locations, and had overall good service. This time around, I'm sorely disappointed. Had reservations for 8pm and didn't get seated until 815pm. It took a good 10 minutes to finally have our waiter greet us and ask us if we were ready to order. Ordered all you can eat shabu, and patiently waited for our lovely meats to arrive. It's been 15 minutes, and we haven't even received our waters yet. Also, our broth is boiling and already a quarter of the way down. I don't know. You decide if we received bad service or not. I can understand if you're short-staffed, but at least give us a courtesy check-in to let us know about the delay. It doesn't help either that the waitresses were just standing around chit-chatting with each other. It's now 8:40pm and we just left the restaurant.
author: Ellen D.

description:
First of all, why Papyrus? 

Second, I never had a more fulfilling experience at a shabu shabu place before. 
Service was on point. 
The place is amazingly clean.
The meat is cut right as you order in the safest, quickest way possible.
SUPER clean bathroom. 

With three locations, these guys are totally doing it right.
author: Margaret S.

description: Clean, modern decor, busy, ok service. Space is tight. They don't give enough noodles but plenty of veggies.
author: Cee B.

description:
food 3/5 
service 5/5
atmosphere/decor 4/5

I came to this place when it was still fairly new so they might have had some kinks to work out. The reason for the 2 rating is not the quality of meats/veggies but just because there was nothing special about this place. There is absolutely nothing to keep me from comming back. And parking is extremely difficult. I wouldn't come back here. The prices are like other shabu shabu places, around $20 per person. I prefer their location on Geary, although the Geary one is alot dirtier. The waitresses here were nice though.
author: Cecile S.

description:
So we made reservations for 4 on a Friday night, and upon walking into the place you'll understand why. This place very small and maybe have just a handful of tables, but the decor set the mood for binge eating, so all of us decided to do the AYCE.

The Food:

The selection is EXTREMELY limited compared to other places. You have the 3 meats: pork, beef, and lamb.  You have the veggies, shrooms and tofu. Ummm that's all.. The broth, chicken ginger.. spicy miso, I think that might be it. The broth was okay and I wouldn't complain about that, but the MEAT QUALITY was inconsistent. Some plates of beef were rough and just plain unenjoyable, while some caressed the taste buds with its fatty marbleization.

The Service:

The service was good, and it's no surprise because this place is so small, all the waitress needed to do was turn around. The food arrived fairly quick.


Improvements:

It would be nice to have a wider selections in food. They had one type of beef, no fatty beef, no kobe beef, seafood or whatever other places serve.
author: Felix L.

description:
Went here when they first opened and was quite happy with the experience.  A regular order is enough to make me nice and full.  The service was attentive and everything was clean.  I got the miso broth base, nothing too special, but it taste really good at the end once everything has been boiled in it.  Meat is really good quality; Shabu House in general has the best beef in my opinion.  The happy hour discount is also really nice.  It's nice not having to go across the city for Shabu.

Random bonus: They have to-go containers so you can take your leftovers.  (I've found that most other Shabu or hotpot places don't.)
author: Ariel D.

description: Finally got to try this place and it was no disappointment! Got the spicy miso base with Kobe beef, mm mmm delish! I would definitely go back! the only negative thing I have to say is that there's no reservations and it's at least 45min wait first come first serve. Other than that, soo good!!
author: Nita C.

description:
Excellent!!!   Just got home.  We have been to the Shabu House in Geary a few years back, the one on West Portal and G-Cube on Taraval several times.  

Tonight Shabu House was no less than awesome.  We took some friends who have never done shabu shabu and they had a great time too.  

The food and drinks just kept coming and if it wasn't for great restraint they would have had to wheel us out of there.

To top is off our waitress, Amanda, was nothing less than perfection.  Accomodating (we had three kids in our party of 8), fun and right on time with everything.  It is not often that I ask for the wait person's name but she was so good that there was great reason to give her her due notice.  Waiting tables is not as easy as it may seem and we often read about poor service...well...she had it down..and funny too.
