The food was great...we will be back...no doubt.  And our friends were very impressed with everything.
author: Mike G.

description:
I have been going to the Shabu house on geary for a long time now but am glad they finally opened one near my house. I have tried other shabu places but the Shabu house was always better. The food is really good but service is inconsistent. 
Food:
Lamb and Beef- Really good
Spicy miso- the go to soup
They also give ice cream for desert too.
author: Elliot T.

description: Waited forever for meat. Ordered three all you can eat. All we got was 3 beef. And one pork. For that price I could of just got a large. Never again. Useless service. I had to ask for the meat again an realized she didn't even put my order in.
author: Bumble B.

description: We have been coming here since they first opened and never had any problems.  We also go to the Burlingame restaurant frequently and we love it there. The 1 star is for the meat and food. This place needs more waitresses. There were only 2 waitresses for the entire restaurant. Service is Horrible. We ordered 3 all you can eat meals and only got 2 plates of meat in the beginning. When we asked for more meat we waited for a total of 25 minutes for it to never showed up. My husband had to constantly get up and leave our table to flag our waitress down to ask for more noodles, meat, forks, order drinks, etc. We finally said forget it and asked for the check since our meat never came and no one checked on us. We were basically just sitting there for 25 minutes with nothing but boiling broth and empty plates in front of us. When it came down to paying, they ended up trying to charge us for 3 "all you can eats". We had to politely point out to the waitress that we ordered 3 all you can eat and only got 2 plates of meat. The waitress argued stating they "packed" our 2 initial plates with meat. They ended up charging us for 2 meals only after my husband politely explained to them how unfair it is to be charged for 2 when clearly all 3 of us had to share 2 plates of meat and it clearly wasn't "all you can eat". There was attitude, No apology and the waitress dropped the check on the table and walked away without a word. I've never experience such poor customer service. We will never come back here.
author: amber c.

description: Order the all-you-can eat option. Do not go there and order the "entree" option because it's just not worth it.  The place is a standard hot pot place with better than average service once you sit down. I've been here a couple times, but the last time, I went with my 73-year-old mother. I was a little peeved when the hostess actually asked if we wanted to sit on stools at the counter.  If I was on my own and with friends, that would be no problem, but not with my elderly mom. The hostess was hesitant in giving us a table that could seat 4-6, even though other tables had only three. We were only three and arrived at 6:15.  It was getting busier, but all I ask is to treat us equally. Anyways, this place is a step above other hot pot places.
author: SF P.

description: Yum! Finally a shabu place near my house! The beef and lamb were fresh and the sauces provided complimented the meat and veggies very well. I got the large lamb/beef combo set with the chicken ginger soup base matched with a bottle of Asahi. Very flavorful and perfect for a cold night. The only thing I didn't like was the line, but I'll come back again!
author: Cheri S.

description: I love how shabu house gives you other options if you're not trying to stuff your face and belly with AYCE. I usually come here and order a L Kobe beef option which gets me equally as full and I can finish the whole serving. It comes with a plate of vegetables (cabbage and spinach), mushrooms, tofu, carrots and udon. You also get a bowl of rice and in the end you can pick between green tea ice cream or red bean ice cream. Shabu House kobe beef is one of the very few places that has good quality meat, usually nice marbling with that melt in your mouth texture. Very easy to chew and both their spicy miso and ginger chicken soup is very good. Although waitresses can be a bit slow sometimes, they are apologetic and still show respect. The location here always has a wait during dinner as the building is a bit small. A lot of parking outside.
author: Jenny Y.

description: So after eating here for so long, Im finally writing a review! This review is for this establishment only! I love this place. It feels like an extended dining room for me. I'm so happy it's close to home, literally 5 mins! We eat here at least once a month. The staff here are great and very accommodating. I can sometimes be a very needy client. . . I need this...I need that....can I get more of this...that...etc. Any how, they always get me stuff without the "annoyed look" . Thanks shabu ladies!
author: Vi V.

description:
it always makes me happy to see a local company do well. 

from the folks that popularized flavored miso broth for shabu shabu, shabu house opens up their ocean avenue location.

this is a trip down memory lane for me. i used to live in this hood. lakeside villa what!!!

i remember village foods, the cool local grocery market where that martial arts place is now. hell, the older pinay working in the walgreens recognized me saying, WOW youre so old now! no hair!!!! she didnt age. she looks almost the same 15 odd years later!

anyways. shabu house.... its basically the same as their geary location. the staff is great. food is good. and this old balding man like dinners early so i avoid the big rush. and its a very short drive home after im way too full.

whats not to like?
author: Euge L.

description: The service is pretty great depending who your waitresses are, but on days when it is busy, it's so so. I love the red bean and green tea ice cream, but the last handful of times I've eaten here, the waitresses have said that they are trying to ice cream out: sesame and something else. Whatever it was, I did not like it. I come for the shabu and the ice cream, and to have the ice cream change without a legit reason is mind boggling.
author: Stephanie D.

description: $41 per person all you can eat hot pot. The service is great. The food is outstanding. The atmosphere is wonderful. Go here! You'll love it.
author: Stephanie M.

description: I've been here on numerous occasions and it never disappoints. The service is good, and so is the food. The waitresses are so helpful. The first time my boyfriend and I went there, we needed an explanation of how it works and she was so nice about it. The broths are really good and I do enjoy the ice cream at the end. You can even get half red bean and half green tea - which is good because I could never really decide when it comes to ice cream. The broth is super hot and is super steamy so be careful not to burn yourself!
author: Mai C.

description: It was one of those evenings where I had no clue what to eat for dinner , so I Yelped  "Shabu".  To my surprise Shabu House on Ocean Ave popped up.  That's about a five minute drive from my house.  Normally it would take me 20 min to drive out to Burlingame or 20 minutes to find parking at the Geary location. This new location has plenty of street parking.  Same menu options & the food tastes identical to the other locations, .  Conveniently located, so I'll def be back.
author: Stacey L.

description: We were expected  to have nice lunch at shabu house. When we got there, we found it closed!
author: Sabrina W.

description: Just like the sister locations on Geary and in Burlingame......same meats, soup, veggies, ice cream......  i'm still a large kobe beef spicy miso fan! I love that this location is closer to my house, we'll see if the wait is going to be as insane as the Geary location...
author: Julie F.

description: Got the half and half broth, lg order of meat and extra udon noodles tonight for dinner and had a great experience. The waitress was very friendly even though I had a toddler with me. Price was affordable will definitely be back.
author: Dawn B.

description: More neighborhood exploring led us to this fantastic shabu place. It was quite busy when we showed up, and we squeezed in to a table in a minor lull as I saw a queue for the rest of the evening. The soup base was savory, the meat was paper thin sliced, and the tasty bits to put in your pot were fresh and delicious. Watching the ninja like guy slice the meat in the open area was like watching art being made. This guy has nerves of steel to slice such tender meat so thin and accurate.
author: Nadia M.

description: I've been here multiple times... never had they disappoint me in service. After being here multiple times it's time to write a review. I am hospitality major so I am super hard on service.  They are very attentitve especially if we go in a large group. Always refilling our soups, sauces, and if we did AYCE they make sure our table always have food. The girls are really nice.
author: Kafeen L.

description:
This place was a lot of fun.  I'm not usually a fan of Shabu, but turns out I was over boiling the food.  The servers took the time to show us how to cook and season the meat.  We followed their adivce and everything tasted great.  Pus, the price wasn't that bad, not cheap but not to expensive.  

The food is a solid 4 stars, but I'm giving it five becuase of the great service.  We will definitely be back.
author: Sam S.

description:
This is the best shabu place in the area. I come here almost every other week on average for the past 6 months. I think being a regular here might be why I don't seem to get the same reviews as the ones posted previously though, I have encountered some occasions where the meat and service wasn't completely up to par.

The spicy miso soup base is really what makes this place exceptional. I've tried Shabuway and G-Cube before and no spicy miso soup is as flavorful and tasty as Shabu House. You don't even need to cook the meat in the broth and the soup is good. My friend and I sometimes just drink it while it boils. Most places are bland and taste close to water before you add in the flavors of the meat. ShabuWay's tasted like water and chilli peppers. I do not recall any miso flavor in the soup.

The meat has its inconsistencies, especially if you order AYCE. Sometimes the meat is not as good as the first round. (Less fatty or the cut is not as good.) There were times where I think my meat was sliced near the bone and there were small strips of bone in it. I just pick it out and continue eating. Sometimes, the meat can be a little frozen. For the most part though, the meat is still fresh and tender. The more marble looking it is, the better it is.

I also really like their side of veggies. It offers way more veggies and sides than ShabuWay and G-Cube. (G Cube probably had like three pieces of spinach and four pieces of cabbage.) They are also flexible with their side dishe if you ask nicely... e.g. replace everything with just enoki mushrooms or only cabbage instead of spinach.)

Service is excellent at this place in my opinion. I can see why a lot of people do not like the service but most of the time, they are busy. The waitresses usually recognize me and when they find out I don't have a reservation and it is a busy night, they always ask why I don't call them to make a reservation. Once, they didn't charge us for the three beers we drank while we were waiting. (Of course I ended up tipping 25%.) Another time they gave us free sodas. They never offer or tell me (probably because they don't want other people to know, but we receive our bill without it. They have also asked a party of two to move over to a smaller table so it would open up a bigger table for my party of four. They are slow sometimes and they might not catch your attention but most of the times, I see the girls running around the restaurant trying to tend to people. The restaurant is also awkwardly shaped like a hallway so sometimes, it is easy for them to neglect the booths on the outside while they tend to the tables in the inside. 

Overall, I love this place. I keep coming back and I am still not tired from eating there after 6 months. My go-to pick is the Kobe Beef set!
author: Jenny L.

description: I've only been to this location once, but it's just as good as the one in Burlingame.  The service is good and everything is the same.  The only thing is, the location is way smaller than the Burlingame one.  When I went, they had a Happy Hour deal  going on where you get 15% off if you go before 6pm.  Not sure if they offer that deal still, but it's well worth it and they also offer the all you can eat and drink special.  I love this place and I'm glad they opened one closer to home so I don't have to travel all the way down the Peninsula.
author: Leah A.

description: Walked in and was greeted and seated right away. Food came within five minutes that we ordered. The food was delicious and service was great. Our server, Tran was really sweet and made sure we were good. YUMMMMMMM! ^__^v
author: Amanda C.

description: This place rules. It's so tasty and it's a fun place for my family. My 8 year old daughter loves to help make the soup. Almost more important than the delicious soup is the low price. Inexpensive for the quality.
author: Randal C.

description: All you can eat, all you can drink for 40 bucks is a deal! High quality, great service. Just be careful when you go, you may have to wait a while for a table.
author: Chad T.

description: Horrible service and extremely rude staff. Stick to Burlingame.
author: Lorelei C.

description: I really like Shabu but there's not much I can say about it...I personally think its an expensive way of making your on Pho but with Miso broth? It's really good stuff...I really don't know what else to say...It didn't blow my mind but it was really flavorful..
author: nabil s.

description: Worth the drive. Easy street parking, generous portions, great tasting broth and sauces. Service is sometimes slow and can get incredibly loud
author: Sarah L.

description: Love this place!!! All you can eat shabu is definitely worth it! Only $31 for all you can eat, and $41 for all you can eat and drink. The spicy miso broth is the best one. For the meat, we usually just stick to the kobe beef. They also give you a plate that has spinach, cabbage, udon, tofu, and mushroom things. I usually ask for extra udon and tofu on the side. Service is usually really good, and everyone seems friendly and helpful. This place is awesome. Went here for the first time about a month ago, and I've already gone 3 times.
author: travis t.

description: Came here for their HH deal- 15% off!! All you can eat (bad for my waistline) and all you can drink for $36.00 after tax and a 20% tip! What a steal! We ordered the spicy miso soup base and Kobe beef. These ladies were nice enough to not give us the boot even though we stayed beyond their 2 hour mark. But everything was so yummy. The soup base I absolutely loved!!!!!
author: Nghi Thu H.

description:
the waitresses here are usually pleasant unless you encounter the manager.  shes very rude and doesnt seem to care about keeping customers.  

my boyfriend and i made this our favorite place to go for quite some time until we went in on a busy sunday.  we understood it was busy and knew we would wait but didnt mind because we really enjoyed this place.  after an hour the woman went to seat us and i asked for a larger table and she refused.  she said that table was for larger partys however their were only two couples behind us who were also walk ins.  i asked to speak to a manager because after waiting an hour we should be able to sit where ever we want.  she said she was the manager and still reused to sit us where we liked.  while still arguing with me, a party of four walked in and asked for the table for four without reservation and were seated immediately.  how is this fair?  they didnt even have to wait behind the others who arrived after us that had also been waiting for some time.  we finally sucked it up and sat at a tiny table that couldnt even hold the food we ordered.  what a disappointing trip.  

after our terrible experience that night, my boyfriend checked his bank account and realized we had been charged for our meal plus an extra $105!  WHAT?!  how can you mess that up.  he called and they said they would refund it but after a week he still didnt see the money.  he checked in like any normal person who isnt rich and the manager again was horribly rude and wasnt the least bit understanding.  she said she did the refund and now it was no longer her problem?  really?  

sense then when ever we go in is the manager is working we get incredibly poor service, almost like she tells who ever is helping us to treat us unfairly.  we never get waters, we always have to grab the waitresses for help instead of them checking on us, and once the manager even tried at all cost not to sit us a 4 person table even though it was slow because of the disagrement we had.  she eventually did anyway.  

long story short; good food, ok service sometime... HORRIBLE MANAGEMENT.  it makes us so sad to say we havent been there in months after making it our weekly to biweekly dinner place for about half a year...
author: Skindy B.

description: Came in on a Monday night and got seated right away. I'm not sure if it's because it was a Monday or if not many people know about this location yet. It's slightly smaller than the original location, but has the same great service and food.
author: Adelina W.

description: Best Kobe beef ever. I will always come back here for the kobe beef. I'm usually partial to lamb but the kobe beef at Shabu House is absolutely amazing! I get the set meal, which is always a perfect way to round out my meal. Oh- and must get the read bean ice cream here. You won't regret it.
author: Nadiyah S.

description: The worst customer service and absolutely the worst run shabu house that I have ever been too. Only two waitresses with no clue how to communicate with customer!! The two server argued back to us & when we left, she said good bye with an attitude!!  Also seating customer not in order!!! Would not recommend any ppl to come here. If I can I will give them no star for there unprofessional service!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Jimmy L.

description: Had Mommy Daughter day Saturday at Shabu House. My first time having Shabu, lamb, and  sake.  I had the beef/lamb combo can't remember the name of the sake I drink but very strong walked sideways  to the bus stop ;)  the young lady that took our order was every helpful and made my experience wonderful. Who knew you can throw slices of meat in boiling water and  out comes a meal. We had the spicy miso yummy.  My very picky daughter didn't like her sake and the young lady took it off our bill, that was so nice because I would have paid for it cause my baby can be a pain in the hind end when it comes to food/drink. Anyhoo I say run to Shabu House. I will be.
author: Linda S.

description: This restaurant took hella long to seat us. Had us waiting almost 2 hours. Even tho they were slammed, they still did not check in with us about seating us. SMH
author: Maxwell T.

description:
this review is based on my experience yesterday. i'm giving this place a 2 star based on the service that i experienced. 
it was not even that busy we had to ask for so many things from the server because so many stuff was lacking on our table, our condiments for the sauce was almost empty so we had to refill it. the server took it to refill it but never put it back so we had to use the one from the other table. ok, so when we asked for rice, we said 4 rice, since we were a party of 4, only gave us 2, and the way she served us, did not seem that she was paying attention at all. ok, next issue was we only had 3 spoon for the soup and had to ask 2 servers to get a spoon, that clearly shows they were not paying attention at all. then for the dessert, they would usually ask what flavor we want after cleaning up our table (based on my experience for going here million times), but we actually had to ask them. i honestly felt weird asking but it shows on the menu that it comes with it, and the service should not be like that at all. HORRIBLE. i think they need to be re-trained. 
those 2 servers who worked when i was there was just HORRIBLE, i don't even think they deserve to work there if you can't SERVE. i wish i could have gotten their names, i only remember one girl, blonde asian with dolled up make up, i don't know how she got the job, or maybe it was just not her day.
author: Toni Rose M.

description: My husband and I went here because he heard this was a really great place.  Unfortunately, we had a disappointing experience. The food good but not for the price. They charge a $5.00 SHARING FEE even though I just want appetizers as my meal. The waiters are nice but never checked back to see if we needed anything else or refilled our water.
author: MG D.

description: Came here on a Tuesday night for dinner. Luckily I got here right before Happy Hour was over!! Ordered the regular beef and the portions were perfect for me! Servers were very attentive and filled our waters and teas too! Overall the food was delicious and service was great. Will definitely be back.
author: Eva souppah W.

description:
My best friend invited me to her b-day party here last Saturday.  It's the first time here for me and I felt welcoming.  We had two large long tables combine and the meat plate were extremely large.  I thought the restaurant itself could have been a little bigger since there were alot others waiting for dinner.  Our waitress was extremely nice and fast...we asked for more vegi, or just plates of mushrooms and there it is in a few minutes.  

I loved their dipping sauce.  There are a few variety but I mixed mines a little with the help of the b-day girl.  It was delicious and fulfilling.  Overall, it was a great experience for my first visit and to be with all my good friends at the table was a memorable one.  I think I had a little too much to eat, not to mention there's also delicious ice cream your choice of red bean or green tea...yummy and delicious!
author: Susie N.

description: This is our second trip to the Shabu House. Another wonder cook pot place close to our favorite movie theater. The price to quality ratio is great. All you can eat shabu shabu makes for a great dinner.
author: Dan Q.

description:
if you like meat, this is your place, they serve from  (kobe american) beef, lamb, and pork, , for the price of $31 per person, all you can eat,  and if you want all you can drink , its going to be $41 per person, you have choice of spicy miso broth, ginger chicken, or just plain hot water base.. keep in mind, if you want your soup to be salty at the end, dont order miso broth, because it could get very salty at end.

the all you can eat also come with vegetable, spinach, chinese cabage, 2 different kinds of  mushroom,(black and enoki kind), tofu, carrot, (for soup base),

no seafood, no traditional kinds of sides(like taro, fishcake, etc).

go there early, to get 15% off from 5-6 pm (happy hour special), and the line is also shorter,  

in conclusion, if you are meat lover, this is the place, i will not go there if you also like some seafood as your choice 
and green tea and red bean ice cream is a plus
author: jane y.

description: Same as the one in Burlingame, but smaller. Make reservations because it gets fully booked up! Love the beef and spicy miso. Again, prepare to be smelly!
author: Men A.

description: food is yummy but for the amount of money i spend here on a single meal the service could be better.  the food takes forever to reach your table after you order and if  you need a refill for anything GOOD LUCK WITH THAT.  sometimes i feel like the servers deliberately pretend they dont see you so they dont have to help you and you have to wave them down or actually get up and walk to the bar to get their attention.
author: Jill M.

description: We've been to Shabu House more than 10 times and at both locations.  The Geary location was the first one and definitely busier, but if you are older, have kids or just not interested in the young Asian dining crowd, come to the Ocean location.  Shabu House on Ocean has more available parking and you can usually get a same day reservation if you call earlier than 6.  We usually order a regular beef or pork with ginger chicken broth and the food is consistently good.  Best part is drinking the tasty broth with udon noodles at the end of the meal - this is definitely a welcome meal on a cold San Francisco day.  Service is friendly and very accommodating for families.  We usually share our food with our 3 year old son (meaning we don't order a separate meal for him), but they are always super nice and give him his own bowl of rice and ice cream at the end of the meal.  We definitely will continue to come back!
author: Tim L.

description: Not all it is cracked out to be. The spicy miso is kinda bland and not spicy at all. I think little sheep taste a lot better and is more worth the price we pay. All in all it was alright.
author: TinNgai L.

description: Pretty small meat and vegetable selection, but it filled us up. Staff were exceptionally nice, but didn't seem to work together too well. Environment was awesome too. The price was a little high for the limited menu, but over all nice place.
author: Marcus L.

description: I got the all you can eat, but it wasn't worth it. I'm a medium kind of girl, and all you can eat is more for those are looking for an extra large portion. Plus, the meat is kinda too fatty for my liking.
author: Lan N.

description: Decided to check out the new location on Ocean. Food was amazing. The Kobe style beef slices were melt in your mouth tender.... I think I like this location more than geary!!
author: Lorraine G.

description: regular-size kobe beef w spicy miso is all i need from here. no rice please. that sweet/sour dipping sauce is soooo yummy, i think i'm craving THIS now as i type. :(
author: Grace V.

description: We got here just in time for the Happy Hour where you get 15% off your entire bill! My boyfriend and I both ordered the American Kobe Beef shabu shabu and it was good... meat and vegetables were fresh! And it came with dessert...you can never go wrong with that. Overall, the service was friendly and the food was good. We'll be back to try the All You Can Eat!
author: Aurora S.

description: This place makes me wana buy an expensive japanese cow and hide it in my backyard and shave kobe beef from it everyday for supper...and have a water hose that drips the yummy spicy miso soup...wishful thinking.. I love how you get to cook your own meat just the way you like it. The only draw back to that is if your pmsing you can't blame the chef for over cooking your meat cuz you did it yourself. Love the veggies and gotta have my siracha sauce to spice it up even more. If you're plan on using the hot sauce with ur spicy miso, i highly recommend the free icecream in the end. Itll help u later on when ur in the ladies room...trust me.
author: Maya W.

description: Really nice place to go in the neighborhood. If your a shabu fan this a great place. Would recommend to my friends which is really all you need to say
author: Johnson W.

description:
as promised i decided to try my luck and come back here. like i said in my prior review the food is great, another plus was the owner emailing me, explaining to me how new the place was and how the staff was adjusting.

came here this time with 3 others instead of a large party and the service was excellent! we were never ignored and the staff was so friendly. they sat us right away, asked if we have been before, took our order and asked if we wanted rice... 
the two young ladies took turns checking up on us.. i wish i got their names so i can give them props..

I now feel bad for my poor review, because the staff here works so hard.

if you have never been, its a must try.. get the spicy miso soup base and whatever meat you like.. enjoy.
author: Jay R.

description: I'm a huge fan of Shabu House - I'm so glad they opened one on Ocean! Nothing beats all you can eat, high-quality meat. Service is also really good here.
author: Ruth T.

description: seems like the portion are smaller then the Geary St. one. had to go twice to make sure and sure enough i was right. think I'm going to take a picture to compare, because i love the Geary St. one, but the Ocean St. is just around the corner. what do you think ?
author: derek l.

description: Do not order the spicy miso as they add tons of MSG...... OMG
author: Thomas H.
